loans.name: Yanapay Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “YANAPAY”, lengua quechua que significa traducido al español (ayudar) viven en la ciudad del Cusco, y se reúnen en las oficinas de la organización arariwa con cede en huanchac.

Nuestros socios, alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, alguno de ellos tienen restaurantes, otros desean invertir en la culminación de sus construcciones de viviendas, venta de quinua (bebida proteica), alquilar un stand en el centro comercial el molino, etc. Los socios desean el préstamo para poder invertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Yanapay", a Quecha word that means "to help", live in Cusco city and meet in the offices of the organization Arariwa, which is headquartered in Huanchac. They alternate their household responsibilities with their retail activities: some of them have restaurants or wish to complete construction on their homes, others sell quinoa (as a high-protein drink) or rent stands in the El Molino commerical center. The members would like a loan to invest in their respective businesses. The members appreciate and value the loan granted through Kiva and are committed to repaying their debt in the period established.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up businesses

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 27 year old young lady. She is married and the mother of one child. She is currently in school and is also a very hard-working trader. She enjoys selling and cosmetics sales has been her major source of livelihood for the past four years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she sells on top of a table at the community market.

Gladys believes that with this loan, she would be better able to purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory, and income, for that matter. She is a member of a group called Nyame Tumi, which means God’s Power.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Odo Ne Ye Group

texts.en:
Serwaa is forty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children. She is a trader and trades in mineral water (soft drinks). She sells in a store in her community.

Serwaa is the leader of a trust bank group called “Odo ne ye” which literally means “It is good to love”. She is in the middle of the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Nith

texts.en:
Nith D., 27, is married and currently lives with her husband in Sa-ang approximately 40 minutes from the city. She has been engaged in the business of selling vegetable since 2005 with an income of US$3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, making US$2.50 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year and inflation struggles have affected all Cambodians. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, D. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, D. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase a trailer to easily transport more vegetables to sell at the market because she has noticed that this business is the primary source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: Roekl Group Ii

texts.en:
This is Yeabu S., Bintu S. and Zainab K. of the Roekl Group II. They are small traders from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from Kiva partner SMT. With the help of previous loans, their businesses improved a great deal – they were able to make enough profit to repay their loan, feed their families, and support their school-going children. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan to further enhance their businesses.

Yeabu S. (pictured middle) is the leader of this group. Yeabu was born in Magburaka about 51 years ago. She is a widow with four children. She is a farmer as well as a businesswoman who sells dishes. Yeabu will invest this loan into her business.

loans.use: To invest in her dish-selling business

loans.name: Matiullah

texts.en:
Matiullah is the son of R.. He lives in district 16th of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 and married with four children.

Matiullah would like to repair his house and to buy the essential construction materials for it. So he has requested a loan of 50,000 Afghani.

Matiullah would like to mention that Kiva is an effective process that supports the ones who really need money.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad en la ciudad de Monsefú, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde que tenía doce años se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco y seco – salado en el mercado de la ciudad de Pomalca, ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo; todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para comprar su mercancía en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Santa Rosa (a 25 minutos de Chiclayo) y luego dirigirse a su centro de labores para ofrecérsela a sus clientes.

Los continuos viajes que hacía diariamente para sacar adelante su negocio la llevaron a ahorrar dinero junto a su marido para comprarse un auto con el que pueda facilitar el transporte diario de su mercancía, hace seis años que adquirieron la unidad móvil y desde entonces su esposo se ha dedicado también a trabajar como taxista durante las horas del día en que Martha se encuentra vendiendo en el mercado.

Estos negocios son la única fuente de ingreso económico de su hogar y día a día tratan de salir adelante, actualmente el continuo uso del automóvil ha hecho que este sufra serios desperfectos en el motor, esta situación ha motivado a que ella solicite por pirmera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación de su vehículo y en el mantenimiento de su negocio con la compra de más pescado para venta.

Martha sueña con ver a sus dos hijos convertidos en profesionales, por ello se esfuerza al máximo para sacarlos adelante. Ella es muy estimada por sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo que coinciden en considerarla una mujer honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Martha is a mother of a family, 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children of 14 and 12 years of age in Monsefú, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Ever since she was 12, Martha has sold fresh and dried salty fish in the market of the city of Pomalca, located 10 minutes from Chiclayo. Every day she gets up very early to buy her produce at the wharf of the city of Santa Rosa (25 minutes from Chiclayo) and later she goes to her workplace to offer her purchases to her clients. The continual trips that she made on a daily basis to advance her business led her to save money with her husband to buy herself a car, which made the daily transport of produce easier. They bought their vehicle six years ago and since then her husband has worked as a taxi driver during the hours of the day that Martha is at the market. These businesses are their only source of home income and day by day they try to move forward. However after continual use of the car, the motor has suffered serious damage and this situation has motivated Martha to apply for the first time to Kiva's field partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that she intends to invest in repairing their vehicle and maintaining her business by purchasing more fish to sell. Martha dreams of seeing her two children become professionals, because of this she pushes herself to the limit to get them ahead in life. She is very highly regarded by her neighbours and work colleagues, both of whom consider her to be an honest and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and purchase of fish to sell

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu R. is currently in the business of selling phaste and bread and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and pulses to sell.  Dudu is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase  beans and pulses to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L. is from the village of P-Pugaan, Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling  a variety of products like finger foods and other daily-used items in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In October 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

location.town: P-Pugaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun N., 57, and his wife, Mrs. Yen Teav, 55, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1971 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home and the other one attends school.

Moeun and his wife have been selling fruit for 2 years. They hope to expand their business; it will be better for them to manage income for supporting their family. So, Moeun is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase fruit on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit on contract for resale

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela E. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Lowela is married. To make a living, Lowela owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lowela has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lowela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lowela is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lowela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel L. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 21 years old. Maricel is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. Maricel has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 200 PHP daily.

In 2009, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maricel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Quinzamarie

texts.en:
Quinzamarie L. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Quinzamarie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Quinzamarie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Quinzamarie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Quinzamarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Quinzamarie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Quinzamarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Derly Hubert

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Derly tiene 22 años y es soltero. El socio Derly vive en la ciudad de Calca departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio estudia contabilidad en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco y esta en el quinto ciclo. El socio viaja a la ciudad del Cusco a las 7 a.m. y permanece hasta las 3 p.m. en la universidad. El socio los domingos juega fútbol en el equipo “Humberto Luna” de Calca y nos cuenta que su equipo el año 2009 salio campeon. El socio administra su pequeño negocio familiar de venta de golosinas, galletas, etc., es un kiosco escolar que funciona en el colegio “Humberto Luna” de Calca. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un joven trabajador, emprendedor que saca adelante su carrera profesional. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como golosinas, galletas y refrescos para el kiosco escolar.    
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Community bank member Derly is 22 years old and is single. He lives in the city of Calca, in the Cusco region, and belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Asunta" of the Arariwa Association.

Derly studies accounting at the National University San Antonio Abad del Cusco and is in his fifth semester. He travels to the city of Cusco at 7 a.m. and stays at the university until 3 p.m. On Sundays he plays soccer for the Calca Humberto Luna team, and he tells us that his team was the 2009 champion.

Derly runs a small family business that sells candies, cookies, etc., in a school snack stand at the Humberto Luna school in Calca. He has already worked at this business for several years and it has gone very well for him, thanks to all the effort that he puts into his work. Our community bank member Derly is a young worker and entrepreneur who is advancing his professional career. He is seeking the loan to buy more products like candy, cookies, and soda for the school snack stand.

Derly is grateful for the opportunity offered by the loan, and he also promises to repay the loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products like candies, cookies, and sodas to sell at school snack stand

loans.name: Luis Joaquin

texts.es: Luis Joaquín tiene 43 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que son lo más importante pues es por ellos que él se esfuerza para salir adelante. Su actividad económica es la venta y crianza de cerdos, el inicio este negocio hace 6 años por lo que tenía que buscar los medios necesarios para generar ingresos a su familia. Este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita en Fundación León 2000, por lo que ha sido muy provechoso para su negocio. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos pequeños ya que últimamente están muy caros. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis Joaquín is 43 years old and supports 2 children, who are the most important thing for him. It is for them that he tries to get ahead. He buys and raises pigs. He started this business 6 years ago when he needed to find ways to generate income for his family. This is not his first loan from Fundación León 2000, as his business has been very profitable. He is requesting this loan to purchase piglets since recently they have been very expensive. He hopes that his children will be able to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is 34 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. For the last eight years, he has run a shop where he sells flour, sugar, salt and other food items. He also runs a taxi service and a farm. He has one employee, and is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping him provide for his family, and especially for helping him give his children an education.  He would like his children to continue in school, and expand his businesses by buying a piece of land on which he can build rental housing. Silas has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy supplies for his store, including sugar, kerosene and maize.  He is hardworking and friendly, and would also like to open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, kerosene and maize to sell in his store

loans.name: Mourn

texts.en: Mourn S., age 42, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She works in the agriculture sector as a farmer raising pigs and growing rice with her husband, earning an income of USD 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. The family is also assisted by one of the children who is a local primary school teacher, earning USD 2 per day. Sakhorn is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a mill to grind rice. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered by Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a mill to grind rice

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the village of Ramon Magsaysay, Sindangan,Zamboanga del Norte. She is 42 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and manages a Jeepney transport in town. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

At present, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for car repair. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Car Repair

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more motorcycle spare parts for his business

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 59 años, separada, pero de aquel compromiso tiene dos hijas, una de ellas trabaja en la ciudad, por lo que solo vive con su segunda hija en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 5 años vende mazamorra (dulce típico peruano), pero hace 3 años, que se estableció en un puesto de venta. Su actividad empieza desde la mañana hasta la tarde, y de lo que resta del día se limita a comprar lo necesario para elaborar por la mañana su postre. Por la calidad y buen gusto con que prepara la mazamorra, ha hecho que merezca el reconocimiento de sus clientes, y eso le ha favorecido mucho en las ventas y por ende en sus ganancias. Por lo pronto se proyecta en preparar más mazamorra para aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que el aporte que recibirá le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes necesarios  para la preparación de  mazamorras.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 59, is separated and has two daughters. One of her daughters lives and works in the city so Genoveva lives in her own house with just her second daughter. She’s been selling mazamorra (a typical Peruvian sweet) for five years but it was only three years ago that she got her own sales stand. She is open for business from morning to afternoon; she uses the rest of the day to shop for her ingredients for the next day’s dessert production. Thanks to the good quality and delicious taste of her preparation, she has become very well known among her customers so sales have been good and income has increased. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she assures that she will repay in a timely fashion. Besides, she considers the help she will get to be very useful for her business’s progress. She will use the requested funds to buy necessary ingredients for her mazamorras.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: “We have a one-hectare farm, which we till for so many years now. It is our source of livelihood that is why we keep our best to sustain it so that we could provide our family with all their needs”, says Lina E., a 43-year-old farmer from Trento Agusan del Sur. Now she is preparing the farm but still needs additional money to buy all the other farming needs. In addition to farming, she also raises pigs. She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 7,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 48 years old, is married to Helen, and they have two children aged 11 and 14.

Rogelio owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years already.

In 2007, Rogelio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies. This loan will be his seventh from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 50, is a low-income person living in a rural area of Battambang Province. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She now takes care of a school-aged child, while another three are ready married and have started new homes.

To earn a daily income, S. always buys fish paste in bulk to resell in the local market. Also, she orders fresh fish and turns them into fish paste to sell. In a day she is typically able to make $3 to control the financial problems of her family.

Because her current business is a very profitable one for her family, S. applies for a loan to sustain its growth.

loans.use: To sustain her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty I. is from the village of Western Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Betty is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Betty owns & operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as cloth, needles & thread. Betty is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Betty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella C. is from the village of Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Anabella works in someone else's business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Anabella has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anabella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anabella is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Anabella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mirna De La Cruz

texts.es: Mirna de la Cruz tiene 43 años, sus 3 hijos están a su cargo, La actividad económica de Doña Mirna es la venta de tortilla y mercadería en general. Por lo que tiene más de 6 años, de tener este negocio, ya que ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y disfruta de su negocio. Pues sus inicios han sido muy difíciles,  ya que no tenía los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Solicita este financiamiento para maíz, leña, cal, cosméticos, cremas y perfumes. El sueño de Mirna es mantener activo su negocio, pues siempre está pendiente de mantener a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mirna de la Cruz is 43 years old. She has custody of her 3 children. Ms. Mirna’s job is selling tortillas y general merchandise. The reason she has had this business for more than 6 years is that she is a fighter and enjoys her work. Though, the beginning was very difficult because she did not have an income sufficient to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy corn, wood, lime, cosmetics, creams and perfumes. Mirna’s dream is to keep her business active so she is always devoted to keeping her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth nació y vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco. A sus 23 años es una micro empresaria que se dedica a la venta de huevos de codorniz. Actualmente, Lizbeth cuenta con tres carretillas de venta de huevos de codorniz y tiene tres empleados quienes se encargan de vender en el mercado modelo de “Vino Canchón” del distrito de San Jerónimo y también se encarga de administrar la tienda de abarrotes, que está ubicado en su domicilio, donde vende comestibles a sus vecinos. Con su próximo préstamo, Lizbeth espera recibir $1100 USD. Le gustaría comprar dos carretillas más. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”, ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Lizbeth tiene varios años participando  en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es en homenaje al distrito de San Jerónimo y también porque viven por la zona.
texts.en:
Lisbeth was born in the San Jerónimo district of Cusco province. At the age of 23 she is a micro-entreprenuer dedicated to selling quail eggs. At present, Lisbeth can count on 3 push-carts to sell quail eggs and she has 3 employees in charge of sales in the “Vino Canchón” model market, located in the San Jerónimo district. She also has a grocery store which is located in her own house, where she sells foodstuff to her neighbors. With this next loan, Lizbeth hopes to receive $1,100 dollars. She wants to buy 2 more push-carts. The “Las Leonas de (Lady Lions of) San Jerónimo” Communal Bank has existed through 10 loan cycles, and Lisbeth has participated in this communal bank for various years. Things are going well. The bank's name pays homage to the San Jerónimo district and it also reflects the fact that they live there.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TWO MORE PUSH-CARTS FOR SELLING QUAIL EGGS

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa T., photographed here with one of her kids, is from the town of Talibon. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. She makes charcoal for a living, and has been involved in this activity for more than five years now. Her husband delivers the charcoal to their customers nearby and also to other islands. Celsa is hoping her business will grow. She also hopes to sell fruits and vegetables.

Celsa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase wood for making charcoal. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wood for making charcoal

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Don Mario es un agricultor de 52 años de edad, reside en el Cantón piedra Azul de San Rafael Oriente en San Miguel, está casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 10, 14, 18 años de edad, su familia depende económicamente de él. Don Mario aprendió a sembrar maíz y frijol desde los 15 años de edad cuando su padre le enseñaba como lo debía hacer.
Él solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de abonos para poder cultivar maíz y frijol, este crédito le ayudara a obtener una mayor y mejor producción de maíz y frijol, que a su vez ayudara a cubrir las necesidades principales de su familia. Él sueña con seguir produciendo Maíz y Frijol y que dicha actividad le ayude a desarrollar a sus hijos con la educación que necesitan para poder seguir adelante mejorando cada día su condición económica.
texts.en:
Mario is a 52-year-old farmer. He lives in the small town of Piedra Azul de San Rafael Oriente in San Miguel. He's married and he lives with his wife and three children of 10, 14, and 18 years of age. His family depends on him economically. Mario learned to plant corn and beans 15 years ago when his father taught him how it was done. He's requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to cultivate corn and beans. This loan will help him achieve a better production of his crops, which will help cover he principle necessities of his family. His dream is to continue producing corn and beans and that this activity will help his children get the education necessary to get ahead and improve their economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to plant corn and beans

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Albie

texts.en:
Albie A. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Albie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Albie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Albie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Albie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Albie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Albie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Albie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Norjmaa

texts.en:
Norjmaa D. is 40 years old and lives with her three adult children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house with a fence. Two of her children work privately in the construction sector in the summer months, while during wintertime they help in their mother's business. Her youngest daughter attends the university. 

Norjmaa operates a meat retail business in the local market in her town. She began this business in 1995 by selling only intestines of livestock. After many years of work, she has built a stable and successful operation and has gained much experience. Norjmaa is a very optimistic, clever and hardworking businesswoman. 

She is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase and preserve more meat to sell during the upcoming winter months, when prices for meats traditionally rise.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve more meat

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman G. N. is thirty-one years old and married. His wife assists him in running their shop. They do not have any children yet. His business is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He sells assorted items in his shop including bread, milk, sodas, soap, sweets, ornaments, and detergents. He has been in this business for three years and has one employee. 

He says that the business is profitable. He serves the local people. He says that his major challenge is financial constraints and the fact that there are too many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy broilers (chickens) to supply to nearby restaurants to expand his business while taking care of his customers' demands. He hopes that in future, he will be able to diversify into the real estate business. He describes himself as hardworking and business-oriented.

loans.use: Broilers

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia R. is from the village of Pelaez, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Aurelia is separated from her spouse and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, canned goods and instant noodles in the local community. Aurelia and her husband are also engaged in corn farming. They plant, harvest and sell their harvested corn.  Aurelia has been operating her business for over ten years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old. Evelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Celia  Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Celia; ella tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de papa, la socia vende en el mercado de vinocancho siendo su horario desde las 06:00am hasta las 05:00pm, de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the “Unidos para el Triunfo” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Celia is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her potato business.  She sells her products in Vinocancho Market from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  This is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Celia is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business.

She is grateful to those who will take part in this dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Nelly Nohemy

texts.es: Nelly Nohemy M. D. L. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Atiquizaya, en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 9 años D. edad. Nelly es una persona muy confiable y responsable con su familia, ya que a pesar que su esposo tiene un trabajo estable, ella posee una venta D. ropa, zapatos, frazadas y cortinas, las cuales comercializa en su casa D. habitación, así mismo venD. sus productos D. forma ambulante, lo cual le permite contar con más ganancias para ayudar económicamente a su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. zapatos, ropa y frazadas, las cuales pueda comercializar en mayores cantidades para este fin D. año, y así D. esta forma tener más capital para invertir aún más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelly Nohemy M. D. L. is 38 years old.  She lives in Atiquizaya, in Ahuachapán department, with her husband and two children aged 12 and 9.  Nelly is a very trustworthy person who is very responsible towards her family since, in spite of the fact that her husband has a stable job, she owns a business selling clothes, shoes, blankets and drapes which she sells from her home.  She also sells her products as an itinerant street vendor, which allows her to make more income to help her husband financially.

Nelly is requesting this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of shoes, clothes and blankets which she will be able to sell in larger quantities during this end-of-year season and thereby have more capital to invest even more in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya T. is 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and child in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rented apartment. Her child attends a local primary school. 

Tuya operates a CD and DVD rental shop in her town with the help of her husband. They bought latest movies and songs from internet and translate those items into Mongolian and sell a variety of movies out of their rented work place. They started their business in 2004 and have built a stable operation. After years of operation, they have managed to improve their equipment and tools. They plan to expand their business by establishing a mini movie theatre with 3D technology in the future. 

Tuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the necessary tools and equipment for her future mini cinema.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (Cada ciclo son 4 meses) y el banco comunal está bien administrado por la junta directiva. 

Rita, tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en el departamento de Cusco provincia de Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Rita vive en el distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus hijos. 

Rita se dedica a la confección pintura artistica y vende artesanía de tipo muñequería, ella también se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos y bordados. Ya son 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Rita espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
Rita belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association. The Communal Bank has received 13 loans (each cycle is 4 months) and the Communal Bank is well managed by its governing board.

Rita is 36 years old, is married and has two children. She was born in the department of Cusco, province of Cusco, Perú. At present, Rita lives in the district of Santiago in the city of Cusco with her children.

Rita makes paintings and sells handicraft dolls as well as knitting and embroidery. She has had the business for some 3 years and is doing very well thanks to all of the hard work that she puts on her business.

Rita hopes to receive a loan of S/. 1500 nuevos soles and will use it to buy materials like fabric and other items.

loans.use: To buy materials like fabric and other items.

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en: Battumur is 54 years old and lives in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. All of her children are married and now she lives alone in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her son’s backyard. In 2009, Battumur started a felt craft and production business making Mongonlian traditional boots after participating in training organized by World Vision, a non-governmental organization. Battumur makes boots and felt crafts that are ordered by World Vision. This provides an income source for her. Battumur is requesting a loan of 300,000 MNT to purchase felt to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase felt

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza wants to start her own business to support her family along with her husband. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase 1000 laying hens to start a poultry farm on a piece of land her husband owns. Fayza's husband was a government employee and has recently retired. Fayza has two daughters and three sons. She will be able to help her husband take care of the family and fill the free time they both have now with a useful project.

Fayza appears in the photo in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase 1000 laying hens to start a poultry farm

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: El señor Christian trabaja en una panadería; el crédito lo necesita para realizar un tratamiento odontológico que necesita hacerlo lo mas antes posible. Es soltero y no tiene hijos; vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de El Tejar  de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Christian works in a bakery.  He needs the loan to have dental work done as soon as possible.  He is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house, which is located in the El Tejar zone in the city of La Paz.  This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: Cost of treatment for his teeth and gums

loans.name: Alicia Betty

texts.es:
Alicia de 47 años, vende un plato típico en Ecuador llamado “Fritada”. Por su dedicación y esfuerzo a podido mantener esta tradición vendiendo los platos de fritada que son hechos con carne de cerdo y granos. 

Trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo fritada para sus clientes fijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar haciendo más paltos típicos. Pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y asi mejorar su casa como cemento, arena y bloques.
texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and sells a traditional dish in Ecuador called “fritada”. With effort and dedication, she has been able to maintain the tradition of selling “fritada” dishes made of pork and grains.

Alicia starts very early preparing “fritada” for her established customers. She has many aspirations for her business, which includes continuing to make more traditional dishes. Now she wants to use this loan to buy construction materials for making improvements to her home such as cement, sand, and blocks.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and blocks for making home improvements.

loans.name: Jenny Cristal

texts.es:
Jenny es habitantante D. un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como L. novia del sol, ya que ademas D. ser una region ganadera es uno D. los lugares donD. hace mas calor del estado D. Veracruz.  Jenny  tiene L. edad D. 21 años, estudio L. preparatoria y es madre soltera D. una pequeña niña D. nombre camiL. D. 9 meses D. edad.

ElL. nos platica que desD. que termino D. estudiar L. preparatoria inicio a trabajar para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar pero ahora que ya tiene una hija debe buscar L. manera D. darle una mejor calidad D. vida asi que ha pensado en iniciar a vender zapatos y bolsas para dama las cuales piensa ender con sus ecinas y compañeras D. trabajo.

elL. necesita este credito para invertirlo en L. compra D. catalogos zapatos y bolsas para su posterior venta.

elL. espera que su negocio tenga exito y con sus ganancias seguir invirtiendo para que dia a di craesca un poco mas. 

elL. se encuentra agradecida con L. fundacion ya que este credito le dara L. oportunidad D. iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Jenny lives in a place called White Earth, which is better known as Girlfriend of the Sun since it is one of the hottest places in the state of Veracruz, in addition to being a region for raising livestock.  Jenny is 21 years old.  She went to high school and is a single mother of a little girl named CamiL., who is nine months old.

Jenny tells us she has been working since she finished high school so she could help her family with household costs, but now that she has CamiL. Jenny wants to find a way to offer her daughter a better quality of life.  Because of this, Jenny has thought about selling women's shoes and bags, which she will sell to her neighbors and colleagues.  

Jenny needs a loan to invest in the purchase of catalogs for shoes and bags for their later sale.  She hopes her business will be successful and that with her earnings she can continue investing in it, so her business will continue to grow a little more every day.

Jenny is grateful to the foundation since this loan will give her the opportunity to start to work in her own business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia is 38 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Vevencia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items like sardines, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store. Vevencia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns income from furniture and raising livestock. Vevencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhay K. (pictured here) and her husband are farmers. They have three sons and three daughters and live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chhay is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial, de 29 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, esta casado con Jenny de 28 años y juntos viven en su propia casa  al lado de sus dos queridos hijos a quien desean brindarle un mejor porvenir. La labor que realiza Marcial es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva cacao, café y frutas cítricas, sobre las 03 hectáreas de terreno que posee. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra desde muy niño, y a la edad de 20 años compró su propia parcela desde entonces viene trabajando en sus propias tierras. Marcial en tiempos de cosecha y limpieza de sus terrenos necesita apoyo, es por ello que contrata jornaleros  para realizarlo en el menor tiempo dicha actividades. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son muy productivas generándole ganancias considerables. Cuenta que la  estación de invierno, hay más precipitaciones de lluvia logrando así perjudicar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, porque posteriormente desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle tal aporte. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono y semillas de cacao para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar mayor cantidad de frutos en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Marcial, age 29, is a native of the city of San Francisco. He is married to Jenny, age 28, and they live in their own house with their two dear children to whom they want to offer a better future. Marcial works at tilling the soil. He grows cacao, coffee, and citrus fruits on the 3 hectares of land that he owns. When he was a young child, his parents taught him to farm, and at the age of 20 he purchased his own land. Ever since then he has worked his own land.

At harvest time or when clearing his land Marcial needs help. That’s why he contracts with day laborers in order to carry out these activities quickly. He feels very committed to his work because, thanks to his daily effort, he enjoys seeing very productive crops which generate respectable earnings. He tells us that during the winter there was a lot of rain which hurt his crops.

This is his first loan with MFP. He is obligated to make his payments on time, and he is determined to do so. He is thankful to the institution for giving him so much support. With the loan applied for he will buy sacks of fertilizer and cacao seed so that he can plant it and have a bigger harvest in a short time.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and cacao seed.

loans.name: Odias

texts.es: Odias, de 32 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro, con tal de sobresalir en la vida. El día de Odias comienza muy temprano, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana sale junto a su inseparable motocarro en busca de personas que necesiten de sus servicios, él es una persona muy carismática, lo cual ha hecho que clientes no le falten y que su motocarro sea uno de los más solicitados de su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con los pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es tener que realizar jornadas de trabajo de casi 16 horas. Espera en adelante comprar otro motocarro y así generarse mejores ingresos económicos, por ello pide de su ayuda para concretar sus planes. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causar problemas en su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido, por la alegría que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar su motocarro, puesto que con el tiempo ha ido fallando y ya es hora de que le de mantenimiento.
texts.en: Odias, who is 32 years old, is a very modest and hard-working man.  He lives in his own home and is prepared to work very hard to be successful in life.  Odias's day starts very early.  At approximately 6:00 in the morning he leaves with his inseparable "motocarro" (a three-wheeled van) in search of people who need his services.  Odias is a very charismatic person, which has helped him to have no lack of customers and one of the most requested "motocarros" in his neighborhood.  What Odias likes best about his work is talking with the passengers and making their trip more enjoyable.  Odias has been in this business for 6 years.  The most difficult part for  him is having to work 16-hour days.  He hopes in the future to purchase another "motocarro" and thereby generate a better income.  That is why he is asking for assistance in realizing his plans.  This is Odias's third loan with MFP, and he is prepared to make all his payments on time, since he doesn't want to cause problems in his communal bank.  He is well-liked in the communal bank for his happy disposition.  With the thousand nuevos soles ($375 USD) that he as requested, Odias will fix up his "motocarro" since it has been breaking down and the time has come to provide some maintenance.

loans.use: to send his vehicle to the mechanic for repairs.

loans.name: Otgonmend

texts.en: Otgonmend is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 3 year old daughter in Darkhan, the -second largest city in Mongolia . His wife stays home and looks after their child. He has been running a small shop which sells mobile phones, chargers and phone accessories from China since 2008.  Recently Otgonmend started a cell phone repair service based on the experience he gained in the  last 3 years.  He thinks that he can increase his shop income by offering his customers more varieties of cell phones to choose from. Therefore he needs to buy more cell phones for his shop..

loans.use: To buy more cell phones to resell in his mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Hayitgul

texts.ru: Хайтгул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Её муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет торговую точку, где продает вафли, печенья, конфеты, жевательную резинку и многое другое. Кредит берет для покупки печенья,  конфет, шоколадов, соков и напитков. На полученную прибыль она хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Hayitgul lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 52 years old. She is married. She has two children. Her husband does construction work for hire. Hayitgul has secondary education and has been in retail for more than twelve years. She has a vendor location near her house where she sells waffles, cookies, candy, gum and other items. She is taking out the loan to buy cookies, candy, chocolate, juices and soft drinks. She will use the profit to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, chocolate, juices and soft drinks

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La señora Silvia, tiene 48 años de edad, originaria de León, es madre de tres hijos , esta casada, su nivel académico es básico solo termino la primaria llego hasta sexto grado , ella es comerciante, tiene su propia pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace 12 años , lo puso con capital propio , fue comprando inventario en poca cantidad tales como sodas, leche ,arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevo , también compro ropa y accesorios de mujer para vender de esta manera fue surtiendo su pequeña pulpería hasta convertirla en su medio de subsistencia, su esposo aporta en el hogar con el salario que recibe como electricista.  Solicito el préstamo para comprar carnes de res y de pollo que son productos de consumos diarios  y demandados por sus clientes.  Al invertir en compra de mayor cantidad de este producto le ofrecerán mayor descuento y podrá sacarle una mejor ganancia y así poder invertir en comprar otros  productos que también son muy demandados en su pulpería. Ella desea comprar 2 vitrinas y un estante grande de aluminio,pintar su pulperia darle una mejor apariencia, pues sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar cada día , hacer compra de mas inventario para mantener surtida su venta y hacer clientes nuevos y mantener satisfechos a lo que ya son clientes de ella.
texts.en:
Silvia is 48, originally from León and is married with three children. Her academic level is basic as she only completed primary school up to the sixth grade. She is a shopkeeper with her own grocery store. She started her business 12 years ago. Using her own money she bought small amounts of products such as drinks, milk, rice, beans, oil and eggs. She also bought women's clothing and accessories to sell, and grew her small grocery store until it was her means of survival. Her husband contributes to the household with the money he earns as an electrician. 

She asked for this loan to buy beef and chicken, everyday products asked for by her customers. By buying a greater amount of these products, she will be able to offer her customers a better deal and make more profit. In this way she will be able to invest in buying other products which are also in great demand in her shop. She wants to buy two glass cabinets and a large aluminium shelf and to paint her shop to improve its appearance, as she is expecting her business to expand and improve each day. She wants to buy more inventory to keep her store well stocked, as well as to gain new customers and keep her current customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy everyday products such as beef and chicken.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a single, hard-working farmer, a job he has done for five years. He is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicide for his farm. He feels that the loan will be of great help in growing his crops and is looking forward to the possibilities.

Felipe earned 38,000 PHP of income in his last harvest last April, which was used as budget for his family's basic needs and supporting his sister's education. Being the bread winner of his family, Felipe desires to get higher income from his yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Eliberta

texts.en: Eliberta lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her husband and four children. She makes a living by running a small eatery out of her house where she sells a variety of local fare. Eliberta has a steady clientele of neighbors, passersby, and friends from her church. She is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, beef, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, cabbage, potatoes, cornmeal, and condiments.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 43 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children.

Mercy has a business selling items such as soft drinks, canned goods, rice and corn. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month. Mercy has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy more stock. Mercy has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Mercy would like to have a big store in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Veronica Siomara

texts.es: Verónica Simona tiene su negocio que es la venta de ganado. Hace más trece años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Inicio este medio de vida por su Mama que le enseño y con el esfuerzo de su esposo es que ella pudo iniciar su propio negocio, que está ubicado en su vivienda. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de vacas, toros, chivos entre otros.
texts.en: Verónica Simona has a business selling livestock.  She has been in this line of work for more than thirteen years.  Her mom taught her the business and, thanks to her husband's effort, she was able to set up her own business which is based at home.  She is requesting this loan to buy cows, bulls, goats, etc.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls and goats

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en:
Quynh is a 27-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has a son. She and her husband earn money by making and repairing jewelry. They started this business 10 years ago.

Quynh would like to take a loan to buy a cutter for her business. She hopes that through this loan she will be abL. to increase the turnover of her business. This will enabL. her to increase her income, save for the education of her child and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cutter for making and repairing jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fish cage and to repair her fishing boat.

Lilia has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fish cage and to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Mjini A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mjini A Group in Western Kenya! Edward is the facilitator of Mjini A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edward takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Edward had a very good maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edward was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edward and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Edward will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mjini A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a 33-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Suhair has a mobile phone shop where she sells mobile phones, prepaid credit cards for mobile phones and some other mobile phone accessories. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase prepaid mobile cards and more mobile phones.

Suhair is looking to redecorate her shop.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Suhair's husband.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid mobile cards and mobile phones.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is an iron smith and makes iron boxes on order. He is an expert in his work and his iron boxes have good demand in the market.

With the loan he will purchase iron and tools that will allow him to make better quality boxes and increase his sales and profits.
He has vast experience in his business and Rashida is hopeful that the investment will be productive one for him.

She is a housewife and performs her household duties very well. She is 29-years-old and has 3 children, 1 one them studies while the others are not of school age yet.

Note:- The lady holding passbook called Asasah passbook is Rashida

loans.use: to buy iron for making iron boxes.

loans.name: Ashirbu's Group

texts.en:
Ashirbu leads this four-person loan group. She is 55, lives with her husband, and works with him at raising livestock. They started this activity a long time ago and are highly experienced. When they need money, they sell some of their animals. She is applying for this loan to buy more animals to raise. In the near future, they plan to celebrate their younger son’s wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Zoila Blanca

texts.es:
Zoila sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Zoila sigue trabaja en una empresa pública ósea en una empresa del estado (INPE). 

Zoila con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el gasto familiar.

Zoila solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de mensualidades de estudios de sus hijos.

Zoila se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoila continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Choquequirao”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues to work for a public entity that is owned by the state (INPE).  

With her previous loan, Zoila did very well and was able to obtain good benefits.  For this reason, she wants another loan to help with family expenses.  Zoila is requesting a loan to invest in the monthly tuition for her children’s studies.  

She is grateful for the opportunity being provided and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to pay her children's monthly tuition.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single mother of two children who attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.  

For the past three years, she has sold clothes, door to door to her neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Noum

texts.en:
Noum, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store at home. Additionally, she carries some kinds of sweetcakes to sell around the village. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Noum is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to carry her cakes to sell. In the future, she plans to produce those cakes by herself. Moreover, she would like to renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her cakes to sell

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La socia Rocio pertenece al banco comunal "VILLA RAYANNIYOC"; El banco esta ubicado en la provincia de Pisac en el distrito de Rayanniyoc en la Provincia de Cusco.
La socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el poblado, la socia desea invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, ella trae de Cusco y hace pedidos para abastecer su tienda Rayanniyoc esta situado a 30 minutos d e la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de arroz, azucar, harina, leche, fideos y otros productos.
La socia agradece el prestamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of "VILLA RAYANNIYOC", a Communal Bank located in Rayanniyoc, a town in the Pisac province of the Cusco department.
Rocio is 33 years old, she is single and she runs a grocery store in the village. She wants to invest money in the purchase of basic necessities. She brings products from Cusco and she places orders there to stock up her shop. Rayanniyoc is 30 minutes away from the town of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of rice, sugar, flour, milk, noodles and other products.
She is thankful for the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, flour, milk, noodles and other products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Margarita es una persona  muy trabajadora  la cual actualmente  tiene un negocio de abarrotes,  esta le  ha  permitido  salir  adelante  día  con día, en esta  ocasión requiere  de nuestra ayuda para realizar  su  proyecto  el cual consiste  en  comprar mercancía para   vender, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado   ya  que  le  permitirá  aumentar sus   ventas   generando  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita is a very hardworking person who currently has a grocery store business which has allowed her to get ahead day by day. On this occasion she needs our help with a project which consists of purchasing merchandise to sell. 

She appreciates the support provided since it will allow her to increase her sales and generate greater income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Diana Beatriz

texts.es: Diana tiene 47 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo realiza actividades relacionadas con la construcción, ella tiene una pequeña tienda frente a una escuela de su localidad, ella solicita del crédito para poder variar sus productos y así poder satisfacer las necesidades del los clientes y por ende aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: para poder surtir su tienda

loans.name: Dassi

texts.en:
Ms. Dassi A. sells firewood. She is a mother of four children, who she has been raising for twenty years. Her husband, who does not have stable employment, does not earn enough income to meet the family’s needs. So Ms. Dassi A. works relentlessly to help her husband manage the family’s expenses. The business of selling firewood is very prosperous, but her income barely makes a dent in the household expenses.

Faced with the ever-growing demand of her customers, Ms. A. is no longer able to satisfy everyone by her own means. That is why she is requesting a loan of $850 to build a sufficient stock of firewood and sell it when there is a shortage. This way, she could increase the size of her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Dassi est une commerçante de bois de chauffe. Elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants qu’elle élève depuis une vingtaine d’années. Son mari n’ayant pas un emploi fixe ne dispose pas de revenu pour supporter les besoins de la famille. Ainsi, Madame A. Dassi travaille avec acharnement pour aider son mari dans la gestion des charges du ménage Le commerce du bois de chauffe est une activité très florissante. Mais les charges de son ménage font que ses efforts ne sont pas visibles.

Devant la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, Madame A. n’est plus en mesure de satisfaire tout le monde avec ses propres moyens. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour faire un stockage consistant de bois de chauffe et les revendre en temps de pénurie. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter la taille de son commerce et améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell firewood

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Francisco is married and has 4 children, who are 1, 3, 7 and 10 years old. He works selling tripe, pigs feet, barbeque and broths in a business he inherited from his father. His father started the business 18 years ago in their hometown: Saltillo, Coahuila. Francisco has had to work a lot to move his business ahead and to remain a favorite of his clients during so many years. He has been able to do so thanks to the support of his family. At the moment he needs a loan of $375, which he will use to buy materials which will allow him to provide a better service to his clients. He commits to repaying the loan in a period of 3 to 6 months.

Francisco has dedicated all of his life to this business, and wants to improve his working conditions in order to offer his family a better quality of life. You can become an important part of the growth of this business. Don't hesitate any longer; please decide to support him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, de 1, 3, 7 y 10 años de edad.
