Él se dedica a la venta de menudo, barbacoa y caldos, negocio que le fue heredado de su padre quien lo inició hace 18 años, en la localidad de Saltillo, Coahuila, de donde son originarios. Francisco ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante su negocio y permanecer por tanto tiempo en el gusto de sus clientes, pero lo ha conseguido gracias al apoyo de su familia. En estos momentos él necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de materiales que necesita para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y se compromete a devolverlo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses.

Francisco ha dedicado toda su vida a este negocio, y quiere mejorar las condiciones en las que trabaja para poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Tú puedes formar parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y decídele a apoyarlo.

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
My name is Adriana Z. and I sell groceries. I've had my business for the past three years, and the sales are very good since I hardly have competition. However, I need a greater variety of products so I can make more sales and earn more money, since I want to save up and remodel my business and keep on maintaining my family.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Adriana Z. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis ventas son muy buenas ya que no tengo mucha competencia pero necesito tener mas variedad de productos y asi tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias, deseo poder ahorrar dinero para remodelar mi negocio aparte de mantener mi familia.

loans.use: Purchasing eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, sodas, lard, etc...

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
Born in 1974, Godlove is married and has four children. He is proud of having executed the traditional rights to legally stay and have children with his very supportive wife. The deaths of his mother and brother caused him great pains that almost rendered him unable to work.

With his two previous loans he succeeded in providing his community with fresh tomatoes. Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy manure, fertilizer, and chemicals to expand his garden. He intends to buy goats and 10-day-old chicks to fatten and sell for food.

He plans to repay the entire loan by the end of the 18 months. The first loan repayment installment shall commence at the end of the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Buying manure, fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny makes cleaning products such as chlorine, water softener, and disinfectants. She has been working for five years in this business. Fanny learned how to make these products from a friend. With her savings she began produce the products and her first client was the high school where she worked. Her clients are primary schools, high schools, and her neighbors. She makes her sales during the afternoon, with the help of her daughter. She also has other sources of income because she is an inspector at a high school. She also tutors children with learning difficulties at her home.

She will use this loan in a similar way as she used a previous one and she will buy the raw materials to produce her products in larger volumes: chlorine, creosote, water softener, disinfectants, and acid. Fanny was very successful with the loan she received several months ago and is anxious to continue investing in her business. She now has the flexibility to offer more products and more varieties of fragrances.

Fanny was born in Manabí. She is 41 years old. She has two children. The older one is already working and her daughter helps her with the business. Her husband works as a driver for a business and on his days off he helps his wife deliver her products. They are a couple that is very willing to work hard to get ahead, and they are always learning something new. Thanks to their incomes, they have been able to improve their house and increase their business. Their aspiration is to grow their customer base.

loans.use: Buy materials and ingredients necessary to make her products.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a woman who sets goals and accomplishes them. This single mother of 2 children has owned a small grocery store or “tienda D. abarrotes” for the past ten years. Modesta began working as a “feriante,” which means that she would travel from the city of Ayacucho, Perú several hours to the rural countrysiD. to buy large supplies of cereals and other products to bring home and sell in the smaller city markets. It was an extremely difficult way of life, and one which did not allow the generation of much profit. It had always been a dream of Modesta’s to open a grocery store, and so one day she decided to change gears completely and accomplish her lifelong goal.

Today, 10 years later, Modesta is the proud owner of a beautiful grocery store in a neighborhood just outsiD. the city center of Ayacucho. As the keen businesswoman Modesta has grown to be, she is always looking for ways to increase the amount of business that passes through her doors. She began with a simple supply of “abarrotes,” or staple food items sold in bulk such as rice, flour and cooking oil. This grew to the supply of more specialized food items, candies, and sodas. Just recently, she has begun selling a wiD. selection of fresh vegetables and homemaD. condiments. Daily she prepares a variety of traditional Peruvian condiments such as chili and garlic sauces that greatly help her busy customers in the preparation of their daily meals. Modesta decided to add these new products to her grocery store because she says the only way to attract more customers is through offering new and different products. She happily reports that the vegetables and condiments have been a great success and she is serving even more customers than ever.

Modesta is currently working towards her goal of renovating her home and grocery store. It is the next step, she says, in the continual improvement of her business. It is very necessary that she turns over the greatest profit possible as she not only supports her two children, but also the three surviving grandchildren of her son who just recently passed away. For this reason, she is very happy to be a part of her village bank. There, she has learned how to save her money in the bank where it accumulates interest. It is also a place where she is able to socialize with friends and be distracted from the difficulties of life. Modesta is currently requesting a loan of $300, with which she will buy larger quantities of products to stock in her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of goods to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Fidayaddin

texts.en: Fidayaddin is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan. He and his family was relocated to the university dormitory in Baku city as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. He rents a booth and works as a barber. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. He wants to repair his barber shop and build a water line. This could consierably increase the level of service he is able to offer to his customers. He has had one previous loan from Normicro Baku branch. Now he is applying for a second loan of 600AZN to invest in his business.

loans.use: To repair his shop

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en: My name is Fozia I.. I have a one-year-old. I live with my son and partner in Multan, Pakistan. I create embroidered dresses, and my husband sells fruit. He has been in that business for three years. My husband wants to expand his business so that he can increase his sales, and we're asking for a loan for this purpose. I dream of owning a house. Along with the women in my loan group, I have learned to save and to be responsible and punctual. We have also learned valuable social skills that can help all of us in our lives, such as how to collaborate and help each other. These women would use the loan for the following businesses: Zarina B. and Nasreen B. will invest in their shoe business. Tahira B. would use it for the family's fruit business. Najma B. will use this loan to expand her stitching and embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy fruit for resale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela has been selling ice cold drinks (beer and soda) for a long time. Her desire to continue forward is fuelled by her children who are studying and desire to have professional careers. She is 51 years old and wants to develop and establish her business. She also wants to make her business space larger so she can provide more comfort and a better service to her customers. She would like a loan to help her achieve her goals. She hopes for the help of a generous heart.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuela se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas) desde hace tiempo, sus ganas de seguir adelante en este negocio, esta impulsada por sus hijos que estudian y poseen las ganas de desarrollarse procesionalmente en una carrera. Ella tiene 51 años de edad y muchas ganas de seguir creciendo con este su negocio de bebidas heladas ya que quiere implementarla y sobre todo ambientar su espacio de ventas para brindar una mejor atención y mayor comodidad a sus clientes, por esa razón requiere de un capital de inversión que le ayude a conseguir cada uno de sus propósitos.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de un bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: To establish her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. D. N. has a small sewing business in the tropical city of Pucallpa, Ucayali.  Erlinda specializes in making bedspreads, pillow covers, sofa covers, and blankets.  She started the business 4 years ago after taking a sewing class at a local technical school.  
	
Erlinda is 57 years old, married, and has 9 children.  She is a special woman and community leader.  In addition to caring for her children, Erlinda runs a preschool in the morning, sews in the afternoon, and works as an officer for a health organization in the evening.  She is proud that she can be a leader in her community and a positive influence for her children.
	
A member of the community bank Juntos Hasta el Final, Erlinda is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months.  Erlinda will use the loan to buy more cloth, elastic, and thread.

loans.use: To buy more cloth, elastic, and thread.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a young mother of two children and a budding entrepreneur.  She’s recently started a small grocery store, which will help her keep supporting her family.  As her business is in her initial phase, it’s not generating the amount of income the entrepreneur needs to boost it and face all her financial issues. Therefore, Martina is requesting a loan to keep investing in the purchase of different goods to supply her store. The businesswoman hopes that her grocery store can grow insomuch as she’ll get a well established clientele and before long improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of many goods to restock a grocery store.

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en:
Logotaeao K., 47, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience selling taro to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She will use part of her loan for her children's educational needs. Her husband is unemployed but is helping out with the business, including the farming.

Logotaeao has had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Logotaeao’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and more taro tops.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells fried cocoyam chips. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Elizabeth and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been trading in the market for the past 10 years. She is divorced, with two children. Mary enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She trades in onion, ginger, and eggs on top of a table. She would like a loan of $975 to add rice, sugar and vegetable oil to her inventory of goods to increase her income. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children in school. Mary belongs to the community group called Living Faith Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for the repayment of each others' loans through pledge.

loans.use: To add rice, sugar ,and vegetable oil to her inventory of foodstuffs for sale at the market

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda is a dedicated and hard-working 60-year-old woman with two children, one of them already independent and the other a student, who both live with her. Her husband Félix is a farmer who helps her a lot in her business of selling plantains in her area. She started the business 27 years ago and works at it all day. Florinda does not have to worry about going to buy her plantains because her husband grows them every season. Her work is very profitable, and she has had no problems so far. She is working to pay the household expenses and to educate her son. She wants to invest money in the construction of a booth so that her plantains are better protected.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Florinda es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora, a sus 60 años es madre de dos hijos, siendo uno de ellos ya independiente y el otro estudiante, ambos viven con ella, su esposo Félix es agricultor la apoya mucho en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de plátano en las afuera de su vivienda, lleva en este negocio 27 años y vende durante todo el día. Florinda no se preocupa en ir a comprar plátano para venderlo, ya que su esposo se dedica al cultivo del mismo y se lo envía cada temporada. Su trabajo es muy rentable, y hasta ahora no ha tenido problemas. Trabaja para los gastos del mercado familiar y la educación de su hijo. Quiere invertir el dinero que solicita en la construcción de un kiosco para que sus plátanos estén mejor cuidados.

loans.use: Construction of a booth to protect the plantains she sells and make sales more convenient

loans.name: Essivi

texts.fr: Essivi A. est âgé de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et des habits « prêts-à-porter », à Adeta, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant des pagnes et habits pour la revente. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de  ses enfants
texts.en:
Essivi A. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five. She is a retailer of “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth) and of ready-to-wear clothing in Adeta, a village located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to increase her business capacity by buying pagnes and clothing for resale. The profits from her business will enable her to take care of her children better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes and clothing for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 tres hijos, los cuales 2 de ellos ya son profesionales e independientes gracias a la educación y buenas costumbres que les impartió, quedando el último de sus hijos a su cargo, quien está estudiando en la universidad. Vive con su esposo Teobaldo que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente y la apoya mucho. Marina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace varios años atrás, para contribuir con los gastos familiares. Debido al carisma con el que cuenta la cantidad de sus clientes ha ido en aumento, por ellos se ve en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, por lo que requiere de un capital para lograr su meta trazada. Con tu apoyo, Marina logrará lo que se propone.
texts.en:
Marina, age 44, is the mother of three children, of which two are professionals and independent thanks to their education and good manners they were taught. The last of the children remains in her care and is studying at the university. She lives with her husband Teobaldo who is self-employed and supports her greatly. Marina has been selling groceries for many years in order to contribute to the family's income. Due to her charisma which so so many of her customers count on, her business has grown. Because of this, she sees a need to increase and equip her business, and this will require capital to achieve this long-time goal. With your help, Marina will achieve what she is proposing.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for grocery store.

loans.name: Bacilio Jose

texts.es: El señor Bacilo José Velásquez tiene la edad de 31  años habita en el barrio C. ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa y tres hijos , la esposa se don Bacilio trabaja como comerciante  y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa , el tiene un negocio desde hace 15 años el cual le genera ingresos y la ves se dedica a la agricultura , una de las hijas de Don Bacilio de 16 años le ayuda con la pulpería , los sueños de el es darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos . El solicita un monto de C$ 6,000.00 para comprar insumos ya que necesita que los cultivos estén en buen estado para así vender un buen precio.
texts.en:
Bacilio Jose V., 31, lives in the C. neighborhood of Ticuantepe with his wife and three children. His wife buys and sells merchandise and helps with household expenses. Bacilio has operated an income-generating farming business for 15 years. One of his daughters, who is 16, helps with the store. Bacilio's dreams focus on making a better life for his kids. He's applying for C$6,000 loan to buy supplies to ensure that his crops are in good condition so that he can sell them for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pesticides and fertilizers for crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Palatinas Al Progreso” del distrito de Tarica, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 68 años de edad, 7 hijos y vive junto a su conviviente que es albañil. Su principal dificultad es el dolor de huesos que siente cuando camina mucho y cuando se mantiene de pie por mucho tiempo. Comenta que ha crecido mucho porque ha puesto su negocio de venta de golosinas en el Colegio José Carlos Mariátegui de Paltay, al costado del negocio de su hija. Aunque la vida en el campo le parece más agradable ha optado por este negocio por ser más sencillo el trabajo, aunque cada mañana ordeña a sus vacas que tiene en casa y con la venta de la leche apoya a sus hijos económicamente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de medicinas para su vaca debido a que sufrió un accidente y necesita el animal en buen estado porque también es un sostén para su familia, así mismo comprará golosinas para su negocio.
 
Victoria espera permanecer en su banco comunal porque recientemente se está integrando y desea seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Victoria is part of the “Palatinas Al Progreso” communal bank in the Tarica district of the Huaraz province in the Ancash department. She is 68 years old, has seven children and lives with her partner, who is a bricklayer. Her main difficulty is her ,aching bones, which she feels when she walks a lot and when she stands for a long time. She says she has grown a lot because she has a candy store in the José Carlos Mariátegui de Paltay school, next to her daughter’s store. Although she finds the country more agreeable, she has decided to continue with the store because it is more straightforward. However, every morning she milks her cows and with the milk sales, she can support her children financially. With this S/.500 loan, which will be paid back in four quotas, she will invest in medicines for her cow, as it has been in an accident, and Victoria needs the cow to be in good condition to support her family. Additionally, she will purchase candy for her store. Victoria hopes to stay with her communal bank because she just recently joined and hopes to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicine for her cow and purchase candy

loans.name: Silviana Jael

texts.es:
La señora Silviana vive en alquiler con su mamá con la cual comparte los gastos de la casa, vive en la calle Burgos de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja en una radio emisora donde le pagan un salario mínimo, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de una computadora y con el equipo que tiene, mas un socio, instalar un café Internet por su zona ya que es un lugar muy alejado y no cuentan con este servicio. También de esta manera poder generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida

El historial de la señora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silviana lives in a rental unit with her mother with whom she shares household expenses. She lives on Burgos street in the Achachicala zone in the city of La Paz. She works at a radio station where they pay her a minimal salary. The loan she is requesting is for buying a computer. With the equipment she has, she and a partner will open an Internet cafe in their neighborhood since it's a remote area and they don't yet have this service. In this way, she will also be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Silviana's credit history is very good, and she is qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Adizatu

texts.en:
Adizatu A. is sixty years old. Though widowed, Adizatu still has some children and grand-children to take care of. She says some of her children are grown and living independently. However, her last born is currently pursuing a degree programme at the university. She lives with some of her children and grand-children in a family house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community.

Adizatu works very hard to take care of the family. She sells fresh yams. Adizatu does not sell in the market as other sellers do. What she does is to procure the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages and supply to a number of senior high schools in and around her community. She has been in this business for six years now.

Adizatu wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a very large scale so that she can distribute to more schools and so increase her profit margin so that she can help her grand-children also to have access to formal education.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam for re-sale

loans.name: Milagros Del Pilar

texts.es:
MILAGROS DEL PILAR P. VÁSQUEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Los Naranjos N° 851 – San Fernando del Distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 27 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo vende pollos y gallinas.

Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró pollos para criar en su casa: 10 gallinas criollas, para vender en el mercado de Bellavista.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, implementó en su negocio ubicado en el Mercado de Bellavista la compra de pollos, patos, gallinas, tiene muchos clientes es muy hábil para viscerar las aves.

Ella está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por la confianza a pesar de su edad, espera ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
MILAGROS DEL PILAR P. VÁSQUEZ belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women's Solidarity), located at 851 Jr. Los Naranjos, in San Fernando, in the district of Manantay, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 27 years old, has 2 children and her son sells chickens and chicks.

Her first loan was for 300 Soles and she used it to buy 10 chicks to raise, which she later sold in the marketplace Bellavista.

With this new loan of 1,200 Soles, she will invest in her business by buying chicks, ducks, chickens to raise and to sell to her customers.

Milagros is very grateful for all of the support she has received through Manuela Ramos and she hopes to become a great business person.

(Translated by Tommy and Elliot of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in her business by buying chicks, ducks, chickens to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chh

texts.en: Chh L. O., 25, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She stays at home doing housework and her husband, pictured here, is a goldsmith making US$ 12 each day. Chh L. O. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase materials. She sees this purchase as a good investment to expand her husband’s business and she is confident it will increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase goldsmith's materials

loans.name: Eleoteria Asuncion,

texts.es:
Eleoteria se dedica básicamente a la cocina. De lunes a viernes prepara almuerzo para trabajadores que laboran cerca a su casa. Lo especial de su trabajo es que no solo prepara la comida también se los lleva al lugar de trabajo de sus clientes, ganando la fidelidad de ellos y mas clientes. Por otro lado, los fines de semana ella cocina y vende tamales para el desayuno de sus vecinos. 

Por el momento y debido a que su esposo perdió su puesto de trabajo también trabaja ofreciendo servicio de limpieza en casas particulares, para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su  casa y además, de sus cuatro hijos aún menores, quienes tiene, catorce, doce, tres y un año.

En el futuro ella planea instalar una tienda en su casa o en el mercado de su localidad.
texts.en:
Eleoteria generally works in the kitchen. Monday through Friday she prepares lunch for those who work near her home. Her business's special feature is that she doesn't only make the food, but she also takes it to her customers' work sites, gaining their loyalty, and additional customers. On the weekends, she cooks and sells tamales to her neighbors for breakfast. Because her husband lost his job, right now she also works cleaning private homes in order to pay for the household expenses and to support her 4 minor children, ages 14, 12, 3 and 1. In the future she hopes to open a store in her home, or at the local market.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies and cooking supplies.

loans.name: Señor De Quinuapata Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Señor D. Quinuapata son D. la Provincia D. Cangallo, que se ubica a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la población D. la zona se dedica en mayor proporción al comercio, también a la agricultura. Este bancomunal pertenece a la Region Wari D. FINCA Peru.

Gloria es soltera, venD. todo tipo D. postres como humita, mazamorra, queques, que ella misma prepara, además es enfermera D. profesión y trabaja en el centro D. salud. el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. tortas como harina. Los sueños D. Gloria son tener una tienda D. postres.

Zoraida es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, Zoraida se dedica a la venta D. helados que venD. en las diferentes ferias y comunidades, Zoraida tiene proyectado tener una bodega, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes. Los sueños D. Zoraida son mejorar sus negocios, realizarse como mujer y viajar en la vejez.

Betzy es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos D. 6, 8 años, Betzy inicio vendiendo cosméticos por catálogos actualmente tiene una tienda en donD. venD. ropa, zapatos, joyas, cosméticos. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará lencería y otros productos para surtir su negocio. Los sueños D. Betzy son tener una tienda en la ciudad D. Huamanga y que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
The members of Banco Comunal Señor D. Quinuapata are from the Cangallo province, which is located 3 hours outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. The population mainly works in the commercial industry, and also in agriculture. This communal bank belongs to Region Wari of FINCA Peru. Gloria is a single woman who sells all types of desserts that she prepares herself, including humita, porridge, and muffins. She is also a nurse and works at the health center. The loan she will get is to be invested in the purchase of ingredients, such as flour, to cook cakes. Gloria's dreams are to have a desserts store. Zoraida is a single mother with 2 children. Zoraida works selling ice cream that she sells in the different markets and communities. Zoraida plans to have a store, and her loan will be invested to purchase groceries for the store. Zoraida's dreams are to improve her businesses, fulfill herself, and travel when she becomes older. Betzy is a single mother of 2 children aged 6 and 8 years old. She began selling cosmetics by catalogue, but now actually has a store where she sells clothing, shoes, jewelry, and cosmetics. With the loan, she will be able to purchase linens and other products to stock her business. Betzy's dreams are to have a store in the city of Huamanga and that her children have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El Bancomunal is requesting 5,700 for their 11 members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables in his produce shop.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 28 years old and is married to Benjie B., who is 30 years old. Benjie makes his living driving a passenger tricycle. They live in Purok (district) Raniag Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. They were blessed with three children; their eldest child Jaymark is 8 years old, next is Rhea Angeline who is 7 years old and the youngest child Johnie is 5 years old.  Having three children is also a large responsibility, she is paying for them all to attend school and hopes that they will be able to complete university. She is very happy that her family’s standard of living has increased because her husband has begun to earn more money.

Gemma's main business is raising hogs. She is requesting a second loan of PHP 9,000 as additional working capital to further expand her business. She sells her hogs when they reach an average weight of 80-90 kilos, which takes about 3 months. She will use her loan to purchase hog feed for the animals and is hoping that through the financial assistance from lenders, she will be able to generate higher income from the business.

loans.use: Business capital and to purchase feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: opening a beauty salon and buying necessary supplies

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim M. is the leader of the Biva Muntuuyo group in Kayunga. He is married with six children that are all in school. He is a business man who has had a tailoring business for 12 years. He makes casual and formal suits for men. He is well known for the services he renders and this wins him many loyal customers. In the shop, he employs three people to utilize the four sewing machines he owns. They help run the business with him, making more suits and more money.

He is requesting a loan to buy more suit materials for his business so that he has a variety.

loans.use: To buy more suit materials for his business.

loans.name: Jamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jamileth, de 33 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, trabaja como secretaria de actuaciones en el poder judicial de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años, esta solicitando su primer credito a esta institucion para poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda, como es ponerle el cielo razo, ya que en el invierno aparecen muchos insectos que pueden ser perjudiciales para su pequeña hija, ademas desea comprar e instalar una puerta de mejor calidad que le brinda seguridad a su casa, ya que la que actualmente tiene se esta deteriorando. Sueña con darle a su hija las mejores condiciones que esten a su alcance pues es lo unico que puede dejarle para el futuro.
texts.en:
Jamileth, 33, is single, and she has a three year old daughter. For nine years she has worked as a secretary for judicial proceedings in Juigalpa. She is asking for her first loan to be able to make improvements to her home. She will put in a ceiling because in the winter there are a lot of insects that could be harmful to her small daughter. She also wants to buy and install a better quality door to make her house safer. The door she currently has is deteriorating. She dreams of giving her daughter the best living conditions that are within her reach to give her. It is the only thing that she can leave her for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a ceiling and a door

loans.name: Gilness

texts.en:
Gilness is a member of the Furaha borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 50-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of eight children. Her children are aged 33, 31, 29, 27, 25, 23, 20 and 15 years.
 
Three years ago Gilness started her own business selling clothes and charcoal. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 280,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Gilness’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal and clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Gilness hopes to save money, get more food for her family, pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mafino Group

texts.en:
Here are Rosaline T., Abibatu T., Adamsay T. and Mariatu T.. They are members of the Mafino (Goodness) group. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from Kiva partner SMT. The women have been in business for many years but their businesses have developed at a very slow pace. Consequently, they have come to SMT to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL each to improve their businesses.

Rosaline T. (pictured right) is the leader of this group. Rosaline was born in Magburaka 32 years ago. She is single with two children who both attend school. Rosaline is a nurse and also a small trader. She will invest this loan in both her small pharmacy and her palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) business.

loans.use: To invest in her pharmacy, and in her palm oil business

loans.name: Niel

texts.en:
Niel F. is 44-year-old mother of 3 children. She is a pig grower and currently having 1 sow that produces piglets, which she sells for Php 1, 800 each. She wanted to grow her business to be able to support the college education of her children. Aside from pigs, her family also raises native chickens to provide an adequate food to live. 

She needs a loan to support her business growth. Receiving a loan of Php 8,000 is truly worthwhile since she doesn’t have money to buy new piglets and feed. 

While everyone is dreaming about business success, her dreams are, her children will grow as responsible persons and do whatever is right to help other people.

loans.use: piglets and feed

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe B. is from the village of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Phoebe owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Phoebe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Phoebe is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo A. is a seaweed farmer. He grows and sells seaweeds in the island to be able to pay the daily expenses in their home. From his business, he earned enough money which he uses to buy food, clothes and other basic needs. The income as well is very helpful in sending his children to school. 

He would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to be able to buy the needed seaweed seedlings for his business expansion. The seaweeds is sold per kilo and the more strand of seaweeds he plants, the more income he will make for his family.  He is doing the best he can to provide his 4 children a better life.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 36 years old, married to Luis and blessed with a child named Jasin.  Anabel has been engaged in the hog raising business for one year in their village in San Andres, Aurora, Isabela. Their main source of income is farming where they plant crops and vegetables.  Her income from the business is carefully budgeted to meet the needs of their family.  

She wishes to expand her business and this is the reason why she is asking for additional capital of PHP6,000.  This will be used to purchase feed and for the maintenance of her business.  She believes that her wish will be achieved someday.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Living a life full of challenges is not easy for Felomina B., 52 years old. She manages a water refilling station in their village. Additionally she has a typical retail store, and a livestock business. Her major source of income is farming. Each crop harvest, she has a net income of PHP 5,000.00. From her retail store and water refilling, she has a net income of PHP 3,000.00 per month. She wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for additional capital. She will use the funds to maintain her businesses, especially for her water refilling station. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible.

She is married to Felizardo B., and they are blessed with two children. Both of the children are already married, the eldest is a tricycle driver and the youngest is a domestic helper abroad. Sometimes, Felomina gets a remittance from her daughter, and even her son helps her in her business. She says that she feels so blessed because she has a lot of friends who have always supported her throughout her life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Каршиев Юлдош проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 32 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Юлдош более 10 лет занимается выращиванием и продажей риса. Кредит просит чтобы собрать и посеить новый урожай риса. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Yuldosh K. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Yuldosh has been involved in growing and selling rice for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan in order to harvest and plant a new batch of rice. He wants to use the resulting profit to repair his house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and planting rice

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Kunthy L., 29, is single and lives on an island in the Mekong River with her grandfather and her mother, who is a silk weaver. Her home is approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Kunthy has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

The space under her house where she weaves is small, which makes weaving difficult for her. Therefore, Kunthy is applying for her first loan of $350 to build a shelter in front of her house. After the renovations, she will be able to weave more comfortably.

loans.use: To build a shelter in front of her house where she weaves.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza A. is a 39-year-old and a member of ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.) in the western part of the province, Antipolo, Rizal where many marketplaces are located. Analiza sells frozen food products to support the needs of her four children. She is married to Pedro A., 40 years old, a tricycle (three-wheeled public transport vehicle) driver and a supportive husband.

In 2008, Analiza joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap Inc.), a Microfinance Institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines, to continue pursuing her family dreams. She utilized her previous loans from ASHI wisely for her business and she manages it well and brings in good proceeds. Analiza wants to continue her frozen foods business and make more savings from it.

She has applied for her 4th loan amounting to Php 15,000 to pay for a variety of frozen food products like hotdogs, cheese dogs, 'tapa', 'longganisa', 'tocino', 'embutido', patties, etc. She wants to build a stall in the market to accommodate the needs of her customers and to give her family a good income.

She will try her best to manage this business to assist her children's education. She is grateful for the trust of the lenders, who are making this loan possible. She hopes that her membership in ASHI will help her achieve her greatest dreams in life. She would love to have an expanded business and her own house to live in.

loans.use: pay for a variety of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Llesica

texts.es:
LLesica, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 34 años, Es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de su motocarro y a la venta de prendas de vestir, ambas actividades las realiza desde su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es enfermero de profesión. LLesica forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Sabias”, desde hace un año.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de lencería.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 300 soles, que será nuevamente utilizado en la compra de lencería. La meta de LLesica es tener una tienda de ropa bien surtida.
texts.en:
Llesica is a dynamic woman who lives in the District of Manantay, Ucayali Region. She is 34 years old and the mother of three dependent children. She rents out a motorcycle taxi and also sells clothing. Llesica manages both businesses from home and has the support of her husband, who works as a nurse. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Sabias” (The Wise Women) for one year.

The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to buy lingerie. She is now a requesting another loan of 300 soles in order to purchase more lingerie. Llesica’s goal is to have her own clothing store that is well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Darlang Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Darlang A. es trabajador de la alcaldía es obrero trabaja en los viveros, el dinero lo solicita para comprar una puerta de su casa es el segundo crédito con nosotros el crédito anterior le ayudo a  realizar pequeñas mejora en su habitación y espera que siempre Ceprodel lo apoye de esta manera brindándoles financiamiento, es acompañado le tiene dos hijos uno en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Darlang A. works for the mayor's office in the municipal nurseries. He needs financing to buy a door for his house. This is his second loan with us; his previous loan helped him make some small home improvements. He hopes that Ceprodel will always help him by offering financing. He lives with his life partner and has two children, one of whom is still of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a door and cement.

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
Roland G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is in Control. He is 33 years old and single. He has a two-year-old child whose educational level is nursery school. Roland is a high school graduate but he could not continue his education through university due to poverty. Roland and his family live and work in Dolo’s town, Harbel, Margibi County, Liberia. His business is the sale of gasoline.  He buys his products from wholesalers and sells at retail per gallon to residents of Dolo’s town, Harbel, Margibi County, Liberia.
 
He has been running this business for more than five years and hopes to own a petroleum station in the near future. Roland started selling gasoline with 980 Liberian Dollars that was given to him as working capital; he now operates with 45,000 Liberian Dollars.  He talks to his customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from him. Roland needs this loan to purchase more gasoline for resale to improve business.
He dreams of giving his daughter the best education to have a good future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Roland is the fellow standing on the right, wearing light blue shirt.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more gasoline for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy yam and ginger bulbs

loans.name: Orlom

texts.en:
Orlom is 37 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. All of her children, three sons and two daughters, attend a local secondary school. They have been living in their current home for five years.

Orlom operates a clothing trading business out of a shipping container at the local market in her town. She sells a variety of men's and women's clothing items to her many customers. She has been operating her business since 2003 and has steadily grown her business.

Orlom is a very open-minded person and has good business sense. Last October she used her earnings to purchase another container at a different location in the town to expand her business. Orlom's business is very important for her and she says, “It seemed that people who have two containers make more profit. Therefore, I purchased a new container for my business. Now it is important for me to purchase more inventory.”

Orlam hopes to continue to grow her business in the future and is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a variety of new inventory for her clothing trading business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of new inventory

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El Señor WALTER A. G., Labora como oficial de mantenimiento en el mercado de Mayoreo de Managua, es casado y padre de  tres Hijos a los que tiene en el colegio ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Walter A. G. works as a maintenance official in the Mayoreo market in Managua. He is married and has three children. The children are in school. He and his wife have been able to get their family ahead. The requested loan is to buy construction materials to remodel his home. His goal is to give his family greater security and to give his children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge and improve his house

loans.name: Batdulam

texts.en: Batdulam is 40 years old and lives with her daughter and parents in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for nine years. Batdulam is planning to live separately from her parents (but with her daughter) in the future. Currently, she operates a second hand products trading  business. She started her business in 2004, and initially she sold her products at a rental counter. In October, 2009 she purchased a shipping container for her business with capacity of 20 tons at a local market. Batdulam usually sells second hand shoes from Germany to her many customers. Her working capital is 4,000,000 tugrugs (~  2890 USD). She has been planning to keep stabilizing her business, since it is more comfortable for her to operate the business from her own shipping container, which is her workplace. Batdulam is focused on the future and says, “I would like to purchase my own plot of land with a house and yard for me and my daughter in the future.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1445 USD) loan to purchase four large packages of used shoes for her business. The cost of the shoes per package is 300,000 – 500,000 tugrugs (~ 215 – 360 USD).

loans.use: To purchase packages of used shoes.

loans.name: B. Catherine

texts.fr: L. B. Catherine est née le 25 Novembre 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADJAMONSI Sylvain, un technicien, Catherine est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Catherine vit avec sa famille depuis trois ans au quartier Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Catherine vient en aide à son mari, en supportant avec lui, les différentes charges familiales. Catherine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Mais depuis quatre ans, Catherine a commencé à vendre divers produits (œufs, lait, conserves de tomate et de sardine, galettes d’arachide, sachets, savons, allumettes, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Catherine vend aussi des biscuits. Catherine a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Catherine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et accroître sa clientèle, raison pour laquelle Catherine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
B. Catherine L. was born 25 November 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Sylvain ADJAMONSI, a technician, Catherine is the mother of two children, of whom one is attending school. For the past three years she has been living with her family in the Agblangandan borough, in the Sèmé-Podji commune. Catherine helps her husband by sharing responsibility for various family expenses. Catherine has attended school up to secondary level, but began four years ago to sell various products from her home (eggs, milk, canned tomatoes, sardines, peanut flat-cakes, plastic pouches, soap, matches, etc.). She also sells cookies as a side business. Catherine has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was fully repaid. She is now requesting a second loan, as she wishes to increase her stock of supplies and the number of customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap, milk, cookies, pasta, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dim

texts.en: C. is 31 years old, married, and lives in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia. Here, she and her husband have been establishing their own small family and working as local cultivators. The couple usually harvests and sells its crop when it is mature, and typically generates around $5 of income per day to contribute to feeding their one, school-aged child. C. depends on income from her farming business to support her child's studies. She will use her loan money to buy an additional piece of farmland for the purpose of cultivating rice crops.

loans.use: To buy an additional piece of farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet C. is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 44 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Janet owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of commodities in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Janet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Janet is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mornica

texts.en:
Mornica A. N. is fifty-one years old, married, and has five children, aged between twenty-four years old and thirteen years old. Her business is located at Kibuye in Kisumu, Kenya. She has been selling such items as detergents, soft drinks, flour, cooking oil and others for the last two years to the local people. 

Mornica says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She describes herself as God-fearing and honest.

loans.use: buying soft drinks

loans.name: Benicia

texts.en:
Benicia C. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Benicia is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Benicia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Benicia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Benicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Benicia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Benicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Angela; ella tiene 41 años de edad y La socia es natural de Acomayo, Ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo, , su esposo es agricultor y ella se dedica a  todo tipo de productos agrícolas en el mercado de Iscuchaka, ella vende lo que su esposo cosecha, el siembra maíz de diferentes variedades, también habas, y los otros productos como la papa, chuño, moraya, pallares, frijoles y demás, los compra de otros proveedores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos para la venta. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui" communal bank. She lives in the Anta district, in the province of Anta, Department of Cusco. This borrower is Mrs. Angela. She is 41 years old and originally from Acomayo. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a farmer and she works with all types of agricultural products in the Iscuchaka market. She sells what her husband grows. He plants different varieties of corn, as well as fava beans and other products like potatoes, chuño and moraya [freeze-dried potato products], pallares [lima butter beans], and other beans. She also buys from other producers. She is requesting this loan to buy dry goods that she will sell. This borrower values and is infinitely grateful for the loan offered to her, as it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She also promises to comply with her repayment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dry goods to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Carlos H. R., tiene 36 años, es casado tiene 3 hijos, su esposa migro a Argentina en busca de nuevas oportunidades, desde hace 6 meses pero aun no se establecido. El Sr. Juan Carlos Vive en la Zona de la Maica Sud Parada 7, Zona rural y agrícola de la ciudad de Cochabamba.


El Sr. Juan Carlos se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, cuenta con 12 cabezas de ganado, los cuales con mucho sacrificio las obtuvo hasta ahora, si bien ya tiene el ganado, estos no pueden producir bien en las condiciones en las que vive por lo, para mejorar la producción y a la vez sus ingresos necesita construirles un comederos. El sr Juan Carlos, se dedica por completo a la cría y cuidado de su ganado vacuno y nunca descuida a su hijos quienes son muy pequeños, y los tres están en escuela; los niños son consientes del sacrificio que realiza su padre y ayudan también en algunos quehaceres diarios como el llevar alfalfa, cuidar a las vacas y tareas sencillas. La visión que tiene el Sr. Juan Carlos es poder hacer estudiar a sus hijos una carrera profesional con la cual puedan defenderse en la vida.


EL Sr. Juan Carlos solicito el crédito para poder construir un comedero para su ganando vacuno, así con el tiempo podrá optimizar su producción de leche cruda y generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos H. R. is 36 years old, he is married and he has 3 children. His wife emigrated to Argentina 6 months ago in search of new opportunities but she has not yet established herself. Juan Carlos' occupation dairy farming. He has 12 heads of milking cows that he managed to obtain with great difficulty. But these cattle are not able to produce milk well enough in the current conditions of the stable, so he needs to improve these conditions to see better earnings. He needs to build new feeders. Juan Carlos is completely dedicated to the care of these cows but he never loses sight of caring for his children who are very young. All three of the kids are in school. The kids are conscious of the sacrifices that he has to make and they help with some day to day chores, such as bringing the alfalfa, caring for the cows, and some simple chores. Juan Carlos' vision is to keep his kids in school and see them grow up to have careers so that they will be better off in life. Juan Carlos has requested a loan to build a feeder for his cows. With time he will be able to see an increase in milk production and he will be able to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a feeder for his cows.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad O. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 68 years old. Natividad is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
26-year-old H. Abdu has a three year experience track record in his cattle sales business in Nakyesa-Kayunga. With this business he has taken on the responsibility for most of his family’s needs. His customers range from butcher shop business people to cattle herders. 

Abdu began as a cattle herder and later his business taste gravitated towards dealing in cattle. He also operates a commercial motorcycle business.

Abdu is married with two children. In a month his business generates him approximately $650. With this loan he wants to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more cattle for resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 16 and 10.  She runs Romu Investment where she provides transport services.  This is her tenth year in the business and she has employed one person.  She also has flats that she rents out to increase her income.  

Faulu Kenya has helped her to upgrade her skills on business record keeping.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy sand and vehicle tires.  She hopes to build more flats in the future.

loans.use: To buy sand and vehicle tires

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy N. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol, tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Joy is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a messenger. She has 4 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation costs.

He has operated his Phoso mill (maize grinding machine) business for over six years. Samuel faces a challenge of high costs of fuel for the maize grinding machine. He hopes to open another Posho mill business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase a bale of clothes to start a clothes selling business. Samuel decided to join Yehu because of its favorable interest rates and sustainable loans products.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes to start selling business.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda A. is 22 years old from the Manyatta area in Kisumu city. She is married to Solomon and they have two children, Sonia, four years old, and Sarah, 10 months old.

Rhoda has a business of selling vegetables, tomatoes and grains. Her monthly income is KES 6000. She is applying for her second loan after successfully completing the first one. She wants to buy vegetables to add to her stock. Her profits will be used to pay fees for her child, who is in baby class.

Her desire is to diversify into the livestock business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to add to her stock

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo A. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 51 years old. Carmelo is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Carmelo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelo has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Carmelo is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Carmelo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van C., 43, is a single woman living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice and vegetables on her farmland. In addition, she also raises some pigs behind her house for additional income to help meet the family's daily expense needs. She has five children; three of them are single and the other two are married. Two of them are employed in different jobs and one has a formal salary per month to share responsibilities with the family. 

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Van C. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica M. prepares banku, which is made from corn, for sale at Takoradi. She is divorced and lives together with her six dependents. Her banku business is a year old. She sees to the welfare of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to reinvest the additional income from the loan received.

loans.use: To buy corn to prepare banku for sale

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet  the basic needs of his family. He is 56 years old and married with 6 children who are between the ages of 5 and 37. His youngest child is currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. His major challenge is the lack of an organized market for his products. He plans to start poultry farming in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Xiomara Mercedes

texts.es: Xiomara Mercedes se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, pues no solamente se dedica a este tipo de actividad, ya que tambien realiza trabajo de costura. hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, es una mujer que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar su trabajo, con el paso del tiempo la experiencia que ha adquirido ha sido muy importante. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, calzado.
texts.en: Xiomara Mercedes makes a living selling general merchandise, but this isn't her only business, she also works as a seamstress.  She has been in this business for more than 11 years.  She is a woman who gets up very early every day to do her work.  As time has passed, the experience that she acquired has been very important.  She has a large variety of customers that request different products.  The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of perfumes, creams, treatments, shoes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Piere

texts.en:
Piere is 33 years old and married with two children. For the past 15 years, he has worked as a car mechanic. Piere opened his own garage in 2009 and is well known in his region. He works hard to provide for his family's future and seeks perfection in his business. 

Piere is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua to buy new tools for his business, such as a car scanner and a carbon dioxide testing machine. Piere’s clients are friends, neighbors, and community members. His high quality of work helps to improve and expand his business. In the future, Piere hopes to expand his business to specialize in certain kinds of cars or services to attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is the father of two daughters and three sons. He has an electronics shop in Rafah in Gaza Strip. He came to FATEN and took out a loan to purchase more home electronics to increase his customers. Isam is a Palestinian National Authority employee, known for his good reputation and commitment. Isam appears in the picture in his shop in Rafah.

loans.use: To purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 64 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su hija y un N., doña María desde joven se dedica  a la venta de semilla de marañón,  esta actividad le ha ayudado mucho para crecer a su hija y cubrir todas las necesidades que demanda el hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo, pues se está en la temporada de marañones, lo cual es el momento propicio para adquirir semillas y almacenar para un largo tiempo, por esta razón surge la necesidad del financiamiento, esperando comprar cuando los precios estén cómodos.     
Las proyecciones de doña María es mantenerse en el negocio, lograr la inversión para sacarle provecho y aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 64, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department with her daughter and a grandson.  Since a young age, María has sold cashews.  This activity has helped her raise her daughter and has provided for all her household needs.

She is asking for a loan because this is cashew season thus the best time to acquire them to store for a long time.  Because of this the need for financing arises in hopes of buying when prices are the most affordable.

María’s projections are to stay in business and attain the investment to benefit from it and increase profits.

loans.use: To buy cashews.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 52 años; convive hace 9 años con Felicia, con quien tiene una hija Joselin. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en ciudad de Tarma. Según menciona se casa dentro de 15 días. Desde hace 28 años comenzó a trabajar en una empresa de trasporte público, como chofer, trasportando a los pobladores del lugar a diferentes ciudades. En ese tiempo sufrió un accidente quedando lisiado, ahora está tramitando su pensión por tiempo de servicio. Según menciona,  en este tiempo de crisis la persona que la ayudado en los gasto del hogar, fue su esposa. Pues ella se dedica en la venta de cuyes y chanchos, en donde primero los alimenta y cuando llegan a un peso exacto, son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 400 soles por venta. Su principal problema son los gatos que paga mensualmente el colegio donde estudia su hija. Por ello, ahora que no trabaja, está pensando incursionar en la fabricación de comida balanceada con el molino que posee, elaborando harina de quinua, maca, soya y demás. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera concretar sus objetivos. Arturo, dará el primer paso para su negocio invirtiendo el crédito en la compra de morocho por kilos, para comenzar a trabajar y procesarla en su molino.
texts.en: Arturo, who is 52 years old, has lived with his partner, Felicia, for 9 years.  They have one daughter, Joselin. They live together in their own home in the city of Tarma.  Arturo tells us that he will be married in 2 weeks.  Twenty-eight years ago, he began working in a public transportation company as a driver.  He would bring the residents of the area to different cities.  During this time, he was in an accident that left him disabled.  He is now arranging his pension for the time that he worked.  He tells us that during this time of crisis, the person who helped with the household expenses was his wife.  She makes her living selling guinea pigs and pigs.  First she feeds them, and when they reach a specific weight, they are sold in the wholesale market in the city.  She earns 400 PEN per sale.  Arturo's main problem is the monthly expense of the school his daugther attends.  Because of that expense and because he is not currently working, he is planning to get into the business of making health food with the mill that he has.  He wants to make quinoa, maca (a radish-like root), soy and other flours.  Arturo belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Muruhuay”, and this is his third loan with MFP, with which he hopes to make his plans into reality.  Arturo will take the first step for his business by investing the loan in the purchase of corn by the kilo to start working and processing it on his mill.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the kilo to process and make into corn flour.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
En la Cuenca del Papaluapan existe una comunidad llamada Paso Rincon la cual se caracteriza por ser productora de limon, en este lugar existe la contumbre de que toda la familia trabaja en la cosecha desde los hijos hasta los padres y abuelos.

En esta comunidad vive una señora llamada Angelina P. O.  que tiene la edad de 67 años, es casada y nos platica que hace mas de diez años se dedica a la siembra y cultivo del limon ya que su esposo tiene una  pequeña parcela la cual en la cual su familia trabaja.

Ella nos platica que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio son los ratos que comprarte con su familia en el campo ya que no solo trajan sino que tambien conviven y se ganan unos pesos(dinero). ella dice "en estos tiempos sino se trajaba no se come" 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su limonal ya que desea tener una buena cosecha para que sus ganancias aumenten y segirle invirtiendo al negocio.

Doña Angelina envia un saludo a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento por la confianza que le dio al otorgarle el prestamo.
texts.en:
In Cuenca del Papaluapan there is a neighborhood called Paso Rincon which is known for growing lemons. In this area it is traditional for the entire family, from the children to the parents and grandparents, to help with the harvest.

In this neighborhood lives Angelina P. O. , a 67-year-old married woman. She tells us she has been planting and growing lemon trees for over ten years now since her husband has a small plot where his family can grow crops.

Angelina tells us that what she likes best about her work is the time she spends with her family in the field. Not only do they work together but they also live together and earn a few pesos (money) together. She says that "these days, if we don't work, we don't eat."

She needs this loan in order to buy fertilizers and manure for her lemon trees as she would like to have a good harvest. This would help her to increase her income and continue investing in her business.

Angelina sends her best to the foundation and is very grateful for this loan.

loans.use: to grow lemons.

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Battsetseg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four teenage children in rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. A few years ago she married her present husband and at that time they had two children each. They had to start a new life together from scratch.

In 2004 Battsetseg started her silver jewelry retail business and since then her business has been doing very well. In 2008 she took a loan from us and started selling souvenir items, expanding her business. She is one of our VIP clients now. Her husband works as a sales manager. Recently they received a very good offer on a small plot of land and they are planning to buy it in order to build a house on it later. The loan Mrs. Battsetseg is asking for will be used to buy the plot of land to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land on which to build a family house in the near future.

loans.name: Shedrack

texts.en:
