Shedrack is 41 years old and married to a woman named Magdalene. They are blessed with two children. He operates a medical clinic at the Kativani Market located near Kibwezi Town. He has been in this business for a period of four years now. 

With this loan, He plans to buy drugs for his medical clinic. This is his second loan from Kiva field partner KADET; he paid off his previous loan well and on time. Before becoming a KADET client, Shedrack never borrowed from any other financial institution.

In future, Shedrack plans to construct a maternity wing at his medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy drugs for a medical clinic

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora de 43 años quien labora en el aeropuerto y tiene una pequeña licorería la cual inicio hace poco con la ayuda de su esposo e hija de 17 años quienes administran el negocio. 
Ella tiene la meta de que su negocio crezca y llegar a tener un bar.
texts.en: The client is a very hard working, enterprising, 43-year-old woman who works at the airport and has a small liquor store that she started a short time ago with help from her husband and 17-year-old daughter who run the business.  Her goal is that her business grows and eventually have a bar.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 39 años D. edad, vive en casa propia junto a su novio en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. Esta comunidad tiene como actividad principal la ganadería y agricultura.

Luzmila es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. chicha D. Jora (bebida fermentada hecha a base D. maíz) y cerveza en su propio domicilio. Ella atienD. los fines D. semana y cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente, Luzmila se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino y aves D. corral para su venta.

Luzmila solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. su chicha y comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. sus ovinos y aves D. corral.

Este crédito le permitirá a Luzmila tener mayores ingresos pues sus negocios se desarrollarán.
texts.en:
Luzmila tiene 39 años D. edad, vive en casa propia junto a su novio en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. Esta comunidad tiene como actividad principal la ganadería y agricultura.

Luzmila es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. chicha D. Jora (bebida fermentada hecha a base D. maíz) y cerveza en su propio domicilio. Ella atienD. los fines D. semana y cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente, Luzmila se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino y aves D. corral para su venta.

Luzmila solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. su chicha y comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. sus ovinos y aves D. corral.

Este crédito le permitirá a Luzmila tener mayores ingresos pues sus negocios se desarrollarán.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para chicha y alimento balanceado.

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
Ma. Riza is 38 years old and married with two children. She has been a vegetable farmer for the past six years in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma. Riza is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace makes cassava dough to sell (as seen in the photo). Cassava dough is used in preparing banku and is made from a starchy root vegetable called cassava. Grace has received a senior high school level educational background.  She is married and has one child. She responsibly supports her husband to provide the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to process into dough for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to process into dough for sale.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, Yanet vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Yanet se dedica  a la venta de leche en el mercado de Huancaro en la ciudad del Cusco los días sábados. Ella tambien se dedica a la producción  de queso en el mercado central del Cusco “San Pedro”. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar leche e insumos para preparar más quesos.  

Yanet es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Yanet says she was born in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 35 years old and a single mother with five children. Yanet currently lives in the same community where she was born and has developed her business activities. She sells milk on Saturdays at the Huancaro Market in the city of Cusco. Yanet also produces cheese at the central market in Cusco called “San Pedro”. She has been in business for five years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. At the moment, she is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy milk and supplies for making more cheese.

Yanet is a hardworking and responsible person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase milk and supplies for making cheese.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a dairy farmer from Eldoret town in Rift Valley, Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years now. His mixed farm produces potatoes, vegetables and milk, which are all sold to the local market. He earns additional income from his rental houses in the same town. His biggest challenge in the dairy business is lack of artificial insemination services. 

Reuben is aged 38 and married. He has 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

Reuben has made a loan request of 62,400 Kenyan Shillings in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children with ease. He plans to construct a yoghurt factory in the next 5 years in his hometown.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria De  Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Angeles, tiene la edad 54 de  años, está divorciada  y vive con su nieto. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado par engorde de pollos. Ella  cuenta con pollos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimento con concentrado para engorde mas rápido. Ella quiere lograr tener sus animales con un buen peso para su posterior venta en el mercado local. Ella quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su nieto y crecer con el proyecto de la granja avicola. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles, 54, is divorced and lives with her grandson.  She intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to raise chickens.  She has chicks in her possession that she intends to feed with feed concentrate so that they will fatten up more quickly.  She wants to get them to good weight for subsequent resale at the local market.  She wants to earn profits for her and her grandson’s wellbeing and to grow with her poultry farm project.

This is the first loans he’s received from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans from state banks.  Fudecosur offered a loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a hard-working 53-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with 28-year-old twins. To make a living, she has been operating a grocery shop. Her goal, in the next 5 years, is to have established other retail outlets selling fresh groceries. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy bananas, paw paws, mangoes, kale and onions. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to manage her business more effectively.

loans.use: to buy bananas, paw paws, mangoes, kale and onions

loans.name: Armel

texts.en:
Armel has two children whom he is sending to college. Their eagerness to learn is an inspiration for him to keep producing rice crops twice a year. Armel has been very patient in managing his farming business and, for the past 10 years, he has cultivated a one-hectare rice field. He sells his harvest to traders in the village and earns a minimum profit of 20,000 PHP. 

Armel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. With the help of his loan, he will be able to improve his crop production. In the future, Armel wants to achieve financial stability and see his children someday holding college degrees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is married and a father of four.  He does farming to earn a living.  He is also a mason by profession.  He has been able to improve his farming through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  His desire is to set up a greenhouse so as to reduce farming costs.
Martin hopes to expand his farm for more income generation.  He needs a loan of 15, 000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizer

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. Fifteen years ago, he started working in repairing electricA. devices and equipment. After gaining the needed experience, he opened his own shop in 2004. He welcomes customers who ask only for electronics repairs. With his requested loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase tools and supplies. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 32 years old. He is married, and the father of one child. He is a charcoal seller in Bamburi, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last two years. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this marks his second borrowing from KADET. With this loan he plans to add more bags of charcoal into his business. 

The anticipated profits will be generated into the repayment of the loan and the gradual expansion of his business. He hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to add more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mesias

texts.es: Mesías de 33 años de edad, soltero, él vive en una casa alquilada, ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Mesías es un joven con mucho futuro por delante, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de cacao y café en grano, negocio que lo realiza desde hace más de 3 años. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanos, quienes son los que realizan el traslado de los productos comprados hacia el almacén, donde pasa a una selección de los mejores granos tanto de café como de cacao, luego ya se dedican a la separación de impurezas. Seguidamente se le entrega a los mayoristas quienes serán los encargados de poder exportarlos. Mesías esta contento con esta labor que realiza y agradece a los agricultores quienes le proveen de sus productos, a cambio de ello él les ofrece un buen precio y algunos incentivos para que ellos puedan tener una mejor producción, como: fertilizantes, abono, semillas, herramientas y equipos. De esta manera ambos obtienen los beneficios económicos. Él en un futuro desea implementar su local de acopio y expandir su mercado de compra hacia otras zonas, de esta manera alcanzar el volumen solicitado para los exportadores. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más granos de cacao.
texts.en:
Mesías, 33, is single living in a rented house located in Sivia District.  Mesías is a young man with much future ahead of him who is a coffee and cocoa bean merchant.  He’s been in business for over three years.  His brothers help him out; they are the ones that transport the purchased products to the warehouse where the best grains of cocoa and coffee are separated out and then rid of impurities.  After that, they are delivered to wholesalers who will take care of exporting them.

Mesías is happy with the work he does and is grateful to the farmers who provide him his product in exchange for which he pays them a good price and provides some incentives so that they can have better crops like fertilizer, manure, seeds, tools and equipment.  In this way they both obtain economic benefits.

In the future he’d like to equip his gathering center and expand his purchasing market toward other zones to reach the volume his exporters require. This is his first MFP loan and he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy mO. cocoa beans.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa beans.

loans.name: Yola

texts.en: Yola is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She established a tailoring business at her home in 1997. She makes and repairs clothes. Her income is vitA. to support her family and to be able to pay for the high expenses of life. She works hard to support the family, in collaboration with her husband, who works in a locA. financiA. company. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase new sewing machines. She hopes to increase her productivity, and thus her sales and her income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machines

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mariela comerciante tiene una pulpería y a su vez con el apoyo de su mami  tiene una comideria desde hace un tiempo siendo su fuente de ingreso. Sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. 
Con el préstamo que solicitad comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro, piedras cantera, tablones de maderas, estribu, alambre de amarre, cerámica entre otros materiales que se requieren para la construcción del muro del costado derecho y colocar en el piso cerámica. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a que sus planes y proyectos sean una realidad. Mejorando la presentación del negocio obtendrá nuevas clientela así como mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Mariela works in retail; she has a general store and also runs a diner with the help of her mom, which has been a source of income for some time.  Her plans are to improve her home's infrastructure.

With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, quarry stones, wooden boards, braces, wire-ties, and tiles among other materials that she needs to build a wall on the right side, and lay a tile floor.

She is grateful to the financing institution for the support in making her plans become a reality.  Improving the look of her business will help her gain new customers as well as giving her greater security.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
This group was formed under the supervision of the village leader. The group consists of ten women who have similar pig breeding businesses. They established a group to receive a loan and training from Kiva partner, MUK.
Ni Komang is head of the group. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. She works as a cook in the school canteen. To support the needs of her children, she also runs a pig business from her home. She has a plan to use the loan to purchase two piglets and feed, and to renovate the pig pen. She hope that her pigs will grow fast and that her business will increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and feed, and to renovate the pen.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro  de 55 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos en las edades de 19 y 14 años, vive en el barrio la Ceiba en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a elaborar almuerzos especialmente las llamadas  comidas corrientes, (arroz, carne o pollo, o pescado, granos ensalada y sopa),  lo cual está al acceso de la comunidad de clientela que le compran. En este negocio hay una gran variedad de menús corrientes, pero tiene un producto muy económico, como las sopas que vende por porciones a las familias cercanas y a trabajadores que ocasionalmente se desempeñan  en este sector. Álvaro inició su negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos pues se encontraba desempleado y no era muy fácil lograr vincularse al empleo formal.  Él quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio, pero ante el incremento de su demanda, el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta es insuficiente para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una carpa para proteger a su clientela del inclemente sol caribe, de la lluvia que es constante y también actualizará su menaje especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con recipientes plásticos.  Su meta más adelante es adecuar un restaurante de gran tamaño y lograr mayor reconocimiento y por su puesto mayores ingreso y empleo para otros.
texts.en:
Alvaro, 55, is a father of two children, ages 19 and 14, and lives in the neighborhood of Ceiba in the city of Barranquilla. He makes lunches, especially daily specials (rice, beef or chicken or fish, grains, salad and soup) which are affordable to his customers. There is a lot of variety in his menu, but he sells them very cheaply, like soups that he sells to nearby families and to workers that work in the area. 

Alvaro began his business because he needed a way to generate income when he found himself unemployed and couldn't find a permanent job. He wants to keep growing his business, but with an increase in demand he doesn't have enough capital to keep up. For this reason he asks for a Kiva loan, his first with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy a tarp to protect his customers from the Caribbean sun and the constant rain, and also to finish furnishing his stall, especially with plastic containers. His goal is to have a large restaurant and to be known, and for his stall to make more money and provide employment to others.

loans.use: to buy a tarp to protect customers from the Caribbean sun and constant rain, and to finish furnishing the kitchen with things like plastic containers.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is a 49 year old married man with 7 school going children. His wife is a tailor who contributes to the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Alphonce has operated a tailoring business for the past 20 years.  His clients are local residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Alphonce dreams of expand his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he wants to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.  He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Srey Pov, 23, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a noodle vendor in the market. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Srey Pov is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a cow to feed in order to produce calves to sell. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a piece of land to run a garage for her husband to fix cars for his clients. Moreover, she would like to build a concrete house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to feed in order to produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Corali Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORALI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Amely. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, servicios de internet, tejido de mantas, venta de masitas, venta de frutas, venta de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de jugos de quinua, venta de aceites para autos, venta de zapato y costura de chamarras.

La señora Amely,  indica que hace cuatro años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una familiar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de atención de Internet que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de computadoras) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive con sus padres.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Corali" will begin its first cycle with in Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II centre. It consists of 11 members and is managed by a board headed by Mrs. Amely. Businesses that the members bring forward are varied and among them are: trade, production, internet services, blanket weaving, cookie sales, fruit sales, food sales, perfume sales, quinoa juice sales, sale of oil for cars, shoe sales and sewing jackets.

Amely has worked with Pro Mujer for four years and became involved with the institution upon the invitation of a relative. She currently runs an Internet business that she has had for some time.

The loan she is now requesting will raise capital for the purchase of computers, which Amely will acquire from La Ceja and subsequently install them in her commercial space. Amely lives with her parents, and her business allows her to generate an income to support her family.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Amely says that she likes the training.

loans.use: to purchase computers

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 53 years old and lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her husband and four children. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by providing transportation (or habal-habal) services by using a vehicle that carries two to six passengers. In 2010, Melinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 PHP to repair her vehicle so that she can provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Tribeni

texts.en:
Tribeni is a 33-year-old lady staying with her husband and children. She started a mobile business two years ago where she sells cooking oil, salt, spices, lentils, rice, snacks made of lentils, and other grocery items. She sells her products in the weekly markets which are organized in the villages near her village. She started this business to assist her husband financially and to manage the family requirements. In this way she earns 3,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient to support her family. She wants to grow her business by purchasing more quantity of what she sells, so that she can easily satisfy her customers' demand. 

Tribeni has requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase goods in bulk amount and add some new varieties of stationery items and snacks to her shop.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing cooking oil, salt, spices, lentils, rice and other grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rosemary, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 45 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya.

Rosemary is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Rosemary says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to save more money, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Rosemary will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.5 acres. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light."

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been selling clothes as a street sales woman for 4 years. She travels into the rural sectors about three times a week in order to sell there because there are better business opportunities. She has had to work and sell from a very young age because her parents were not in a good financial situation. She started the business with a $50 loan from informal lenders that charge very high interest rates. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in clothes for the hot weather and rainy season. Helen is 23 years old, she already has 2 children and she is also pregnant with another. She is currently seperated from her husband because he does not contribute to the household and he she considers him to be irresponsible. This business is currently the only source of income she has and she is very dedicated to it.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in summertime clothing

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.en: For two years my business has been the sale of used clothing in good condition since many people in my community cannot go to a store to buy new clothes due to their low income. In addition, I support my family with my earnings.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand clothing in good condition.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh's husband has asthma and epilepsy so he can’t earn money. Because his illness is serious, he needs his relatives  to take care of him and must spend much money for his medicines. They have two children, the son is still going to school. The youngest daughter must quit her class to work . They cannot  farm because they do not have the capital and because of the family health issues. Minh works as a cleaner at a public toilet in a local market and earns average 600.000vnd/month. She dreams of having a small electric motor to be able to quickly clean  the floor of toilet.

loans.use: service

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia sells pefume and cosmetics in her neighborhood, is 31 years old, has two children and her husband works as a driver. She is a member of the microcredit group Erasto Urbina 2 along with Leticia Miguela Sanchez Hernandez who sells coal, Maria Irma Sanchez Lopez who sells perfume, Karla G. who sells clothing, and Elena Martinez who sells fruits and vegetables. They will use their loan to invest in each of their businesses, buying what they need to stock up on products.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

PATRICIA , SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS EN LAS CERCANIAS DE SU CASA, TIENE 31 AÑOS , 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ERASTO URBINA 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA LETICIA MIGUELA SANCHEZ HERNANDEZ (VENTA DE CARBON), MARIA IRMA SANCHEZ LOPEZ (VENTA DE PERFUMES), KARLA G. G. (VENTA DE ROPA) Y ELENA MARTINEZ MARTINEZ (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS) SUS PRESTAMO LO USARAN PARA INVERTIR EN CADA UNO DE SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO LO NECESARIO PARA MEJOR SURTIRLOS DE MERCADERIAS.

loans.use: Sale of Perfume and Cosmetics

loans.name: Refugia

texts.es:
The rainy season is approaching and the roof of my home has many leaks and I would like to waterproof my home. Because of this, my grandchildren are often ill. I am requesting $1,200 to waterproof the roof to my home.

Translated from Spanish by Christian García, Kiva Volunteer.

“Se acerca la temporada de lluvia y el techo de mi casa tiene muchas goteras así es que me gustaría poder impermeabilizar para evitar que trasmine el agua y que pase la humedad, ya que tengo nietos que debido a esto siempre se enferman”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para impermeabilizar el techo de mi casa.

loans.use:
Waterproofing my home

Impermeabilización de mi vivienda

loans.name: Victoria Ursula

texts.en:
For nearly 20 years, Victoria has been the sole owner of her small grocery store in Ayacucho, Perú. This specific type of grocery store is known as a “tienda de abarrotes,” which is the name given to the sale of bulk food products such as rice, flour and cooking oil. However, upon entering her small “tienda,” it is obvious that Victoria puts a great deal of effort into the provision of a wide variety of products. She has a vegetable stand complete with several different types of potatoes as well as a small butchering corner where she can provide fresh cuts of meat to her customers. One can also find every type of snack food and candy on the fully stocked shelves lining the walls.

Before she opened her grocery store, Victoria was selling food products from a small stand in one of the many markets in Ayacucho. However, when she became pregnant with her first of two children, she decided to change professions to one which allowed her more free time to be with her children. For this reason, she opened her store from the front of her home. Additionally, Victoria’s husband owns a restaurant nearby, which she supplies with all of her food products.

As far as goals are concerned, Victoria has many. She says she is always looking for ways to grow her business and attract more customers as well as save diligently. Currently, she is saving capital to one day build a second story onto her home. For the past 3 years, Victoria has been a part of her village bank, and it is because of this that she has been able to grow even more rapidly and save her capital in the bank where it is accumulating interest. She is very happy within her bank, she says, because it has taught her how to be more responsible and she also enjoys the many friendships she has made there. Victoria is requesting a loan of $1000. With this money, she says she will buy a little more of everything to stock in her grocery store, thus attracting more customers and earning a greater profit.

loans.use: To increase the amount and variety of goods sold in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en: Ikram has run his farming business for 10 years. He was born in 1957. This man is married and has 3 children. The A. family lives in the Salyan region in Khaladj village. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy vine stakes and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy vine stakes and fertilizer

loans.name: Kiganda C Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for five months. Jalia has a hardware shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to open up another hardware shop. Hellen sells vegetables in the market. Aisha sells firewood while Grace sells fish for a living.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida is a young, optimistic, hard-working young lady. She has not let life difficulties get in the way of her dreams. Her parents got separated and slowly began losing their support. It was through an invitation of one of her friends that she began selling make-up to people in her neighborhood and friends. Thanks to this business, she's been able to improve her financial life and continues to work on her goal of becoming a secretary. With her two younger sibling's support and advice she receives from her mother, she's decided to increase her capital. This way she will get more money to support her college goals. Your help is very important in helping her wishes come true.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Alida, es una joven muy optimista y trabajadora, ella no se deja abatir por las dificultades que le han tocado vivir tras la separación de sus padres y el poco apoyo que recibió de ellos.Fue así que por medio de la invitación de una de sus amigas observó lo provechoso de la comercialización de cosméticos a personas de su barrio y a sus amistades, gracias a este negocio ha podido mejorar su situación económica y a renovado sus deseos de convertirse en una excelente secretaria. La ayuda de sus dos hermanos menores y la compañía y consejos de su querida madre la alientan día a día por esa razón ha decidido incrementar su capital de inversión a fin de obtener mayores ganancias para pronto incorporarse a los estudios de la carrera que tanto le apasiona.Vuestra ayuda es muy importante para la cristalización de los deseos de esta bella joven.

loans.use: Increase her capital in order to purchase more products

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminatou A. was born in 1973 in Nilai in the prefecture of Amou, 112 miles from Lomé. She is married to a refrigeration engineer and has two children. Her main business is the restaurant trade and selling staples in Agoè. As far as the restaurant side is concerned, Mrs. Aminatou Allassani prepares and sells corn paste, rice and fufu (yam paste). The income from these two businesses enables her to help her husband with the family expenses, especially since he does not have a regular income. The first loan she is requesting, CFA 500,000, will help towards the cost of 10 bags of corn and four bags of rice, as her clientele is growing daily. The rest of the loan will be used to buy five cases of tinned food.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Aminatou est née en 1973 à Nilai localité située dans la préfecture d’Amou à 180 km de Lomé. Elle s'est mariée à un frigoriste et a deux enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration et la vente des produits de première nécessité à Agoè. Pour ce qui concerne la restauration, Madame ALLASSANI Aminatou prépare et vend la pâte de maïs, le riz et du fufu (pâte d’igname). Le revenu de ces deux activités lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales surtout que ce dernier a un revenu irrégulier. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 500.000FCFA lui permettra en partie, d’acheter dix sacs de maïs et quatre sacs de riz car sa clientèle augmente au jour le jour. Le reste du crédit sera consacré à acheter 5 cartons de boite de conserve.

loans.use: To stock up on corn and rice

loans.name: Amina's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Amina is 39 years old and a widow with three children, ages 19, 15 and 13. Amina owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her shop and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her shop. She will share this loan with her group members Amina, Fatma and Munira, who have businesses dealing in food vending and fish selling.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her food market.

loans.name: Karasoch

texts.en:
B. Karasoch, 48 years old and the loving mother of three adult sons, is married to a businessman. In order to increase their family income, for the last two years Karasoch has been selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apricots, apples, and strawberries in the local market. Her elder son helps her with the business. Karasoch’s workday begins at 5:00 a.m. as she buys produce from the local farmers to sell in the market, where she is known for her attractive prices and friendly disposition. This has enabled Karasoch’s business to develop and generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

Now is the season when her goods are in great demand, so she is planning to purchase new fresh fruits and vegetables to sell. For this purpose she requests $200 for the term of 6 months. Karasoch and her hopeful son are counting on your help, and thank you for your support.

loans.use: To Increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H., 37 years old, has 3 children, 2 of whom are still going to school. Joining the TYM Fund since 2006, she borrowed 225 USD to invest in selling paints. Her husband is a builder and uses her paints for every of his building projects. Therefore, her business went well. To meet customers’ need, she sells different kinds of paints. Because she has a variety of products and her paints are not very pricy, she has more and more customers and her income increases. Her family income is 225 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 925 USD/month to stock up merchandises to supply the local building projects.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hiền năm nay 37 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006 chị vay 4.000.000 để đầu tư vào của đại lý chuyên bán các loại sơn của gia đình. Chồng chị làm nghề xây dựng vì thế các công trình anh nhận thầu chị đều cung cấp sơn cho các công trình đó, do vậy công việc làm ăn của chị cũng gặp nhiều thuận lợi hơn .Để đáp ứng tốt hơn nhu cầu của khách hàng chị đã đầu tư vốn nhiều hơn, mua nhiều loại sơn khác nhau để cung cấp cho mọi đối tượng khách hàng trong vùng. Do nắm bắt được nhu cầu của khách hàng, với giá bán phù hợp của hàng của chị ngày càng thu hút được nhiều khách hàng vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng cao. Cùng với thu nhập từ việc nhận thầu các công trình của chồng, thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt được 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Trong thời gian tới để đảm bảo đủ lượng hàng cung cấp cho các công trình xây dựng ở địa phương và các vùng lân cận chị mong muốn được vay thêm vốn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng với mức vốn xin vay là 15.000.000đ.

loans.use: buy paints for store

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy started working as a motorcycle taxi driver at a very early age. When he saw the needs of his parents and siblings, he knew that he could help with his strength and his work. After all these years, he’s now 27, and he has become one of the main supporters of his family now that his parents are losing their strength and cannot work as hard as they used to. Because of this, Eloy knows that the fruits of his labor are not only for him to spend, but also for his parents’ retirement. He is also single and hopes with his heart to keep working so that he can support what will eventually be his own family. Because of his starting as a driver, he now has his own motorcycle taxi, which is the reason he is asking for this loan, to repair the mechanical faults of his vehicle and continue with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Eloy empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad, como chofer de motocarro, al ver la necesidad de sus padres y hermanos, supo que él podía ayudar con su trabajo y esfuerzo. Luego de tantos años, él tiene ya 27, se ha convertido en uno de los sustentos primordiales de su casa, ya que la fuerza de sus padres se van desvaneciendo y no pueden dedicarse al trabajo con tanta fuerza como lo hacían antes, por ello Eloy sabe que las ganancias de su trabajo no son sólo para sus gastos personales, sino también para la vejez de sus padres. Él es soltero aún y guarda en su corazón seguir trabajando por el sustento de lo que será su propia familia. A pesar que empezó como chofer, ahora él tiene su propio motocarro, que es el motivo por el que presenta esta solicitud de préstamo, para reparar las fallas mecánicas que ha presentado su vehículo y poder continuar con su trabajo.

loans.use: Repairing the mechanical errors in his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Edgar Eloy

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 22 años, vive en casa con su madre. Aprendió desde muy niño - viendo a su madre - el negocio de los tejidos a máquina, del cual ahora es partícipe, poniéndole muchas ganas, ya que toda la experiencia ganada durante todos estos años le han servido para crear sus peculiares modelos.Edgar trabaja durante toda la semana para confeccionar sus prendas y las vende los días sábado y domingos en las ferias de la ciudad. Aunque resulte extraño - en un hombre - a Edgar le gusta el tejer, solo que algunas veces le resulta complicado la combinación de colores y puntos para lo cual le pide ayuda a su madre. Con el dinero que se le pueda facilitar, Edgar invertirá en comprar otras máquinas, además de variedades de lanas para poder hacer crecer su producción y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre que con los años ya no puede trabajar como lo hacia en su juventud.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Edgar is 22 years old and lives at home with his mother. As a child he learned to machine weave textiles by watching his mother; now he uses his experience to create interesting models, weaving with much enthusiasm. Edgar works all week to make his garments and sells them on Saturday and Sunday in fairs throughout the city. Although it is strange for a man, Edgar enjoys weaving; however he often asks his mother for help as he has trouble creating combination of colors. With the money he is asking for as a loan, Edgar plans to invest in the purchase of another weaving machine as well as a variety of wool that will allow him to help increase their production and provide a better quality of life to his mother since she can no longer work as she did in her youth.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for the production of their textiles.

loans.name: Lucila Flora

texts.es:
La señora Lucila, socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de muebles, y para ello Lucila y su esposo tienen una carpintería y ella es quien la administra porque es contadora de profesión. Su esposo es quien la apoya en los contratos con sus clientes y le va muy bien con esta actividad, además está contenta con los resultados del negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará madera de todo tipo como caoba, ishpingo, cedro y otros insumos que necesita para realizar un buen trabajo y quedar bien con los clientes que en su mayoría son los colegios, banco de materiales y las Municipalidades.  

Lucila tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposo porque sus hijos. Desde muy joven se destacó por ser una mujer entusiasta, trabajadora, responsable y perseverante. Sueña con tener una ladrillera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila is a partner in the Communal Bank “Picota”. She lives in the San Martín region and province, in the district of Picota. Lucila sells all kinds of furniture, and Lucila and her husband own a carpentry workshop. Lucila is the business administrator, because she’s an accountant by training. Her husband helps her make contracts with clients and is happy with the results of the business. With this loan of 1,000 soles Lucila will buy several types of wood, including mahogany, ishpingo, and cedar. She’ll also buy other supplies needed to do good work and keep her clients happy. Her clients are mostly high schools, supply banks, and municipalities. She'll repay the loan in six payments. Lucila is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children. Since she was young, Lucila has been enthusiastic, hard-working, responsible, and persevering. Her dream is to own a brick-making business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy several types of wood

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina inició el negocio para ayudar a la economía familiar, siempre ha apoyado a su marido que es albañil, pintor, de todo un poco, y hace 8 años empezó a hacer aseos a casas, y desde hace 6 se dedica a la venta por catalogo con una amplia gama de artículos, como colchas, zapatos, ropa, vajillas y cosméticos y gracias a esto ha logrado progresar y ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un carrito- exhibidor para llevar sus productos y poderlos mostrar a sus clientas y tianguis. Con tu apoyo Cristina saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Cristina started the business to help the family’s financial situation. She has always supported her husband, who is in construction, painting, and a little of everything. Eight years ago, she started cleaning houses. For 6 years now she has sold a wide variety of items, such as bedspreads, shoes, clothing, crockery, and cosmetics, by catalog. She has managed to make progress and offer her two children a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, to be repaid in six months, to buy a little display cart to transport her products and showcase them to her customers and at outdoor markets.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a small display cart.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo Víctor de 40 años y sus hijos Demetrio de 14 y Leucadia de 9. Se dedica desde hace ya 20 largos años a su trabajo de tejidos a máquina, en su mayoría teje chompas, pantalones y todo lo que su imaginación le indica para poder ofrecer a la venta y también por pedidos.
Lo que le gusta a Isabel de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo de trabajo, si quiere trabaja durante todo el día, a veces cuando tiene que atender a sus hijos trabaja por las noches. Por otro lado, cuando tiene pedidos debe encerrarse en su pequeño taller hasta acabar con toda la producción y se le hace abrumador, pero ella ha sabido responder muy bien, haciendo que su trabajo le resulte muy provechoso para generar los ingresos que ella necesita. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar mayor cantidad de material, como lanas de todas las calidades y colores para poder hacer que sus prendas sean mejor vendidas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 49-years old and lives with her husband Victor (40-years old) and their children Demetrio (14) and Leucadia (9). She has worked for 20-years making fabrics, weaving the best sweaters, pants and everything one could imagine to sell and for orders. What Isabel appreciates most about her job is how she’s able to dispense her time. If she wants, she can work all day, or at times if she needs to attend to her children then she’ll work at night. On the other hand, sometimes when she has orders to close production by deadlines it’s somewhat hard to do so in the small shop that she has - it’s quite overwhelming, but she has responded well and the benefits of her work prove to generate the much needed profits. This is the first loan request from Microfinanzas PRISMA and with these funds, Isabel will be able to buy a larger supply of wool of all kinds of quality and colors in order to make the best clothes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a large supply of wool for her shop.

loans.name: Marta Mayra

texts.es: Doña Marta, habita en el barrio de Sabana Grande, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera, y no tiene hijos, su trabajo en la elaboración de ricas cosa de hornos, rosquillas, desde hace treinta y cinco años  pues es heredad de sus abuelos, ya que su fuente de trabajo ha sido los horneados desde muy niña, pues no ha sido fácil por que es un trabajo donde se agita mucho a demás que hay que darle el punto a la rosquillas. Con esta solicitud es la segunda la cual va invertir en materia prima en la compra de maíz, queso, dulce, azúcar, manteca y otros productos que ocupa para hacer las rosquillas, más que todo desea aumentar las ventas para lograr mejores ingresos, A largo plazo es poder mejorar la infraestructura del horno para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marta lives in the neighbourhood of Sabana Grande; she is 50 years old, single, and has no children. She has had a business baking sweets, donuts, for the past 35 years, an inheritance from her grandparents. Her work has revolved around baking since she was a very young girl even though it is not easy work as it takes a lot of stirring to shape the donuts. With this, her second loan request, she will buy raw materials such as corn, cheese, sweets, sugar, butter, and other products which she needs. Above all, she wants to increase her sales to increase revenues. Her long-term goal is to rebuild her oven to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, and butter in bulk

loans.name: Amalia Rufina

texts.es:
Amalia se dedica a la venta de fruta; es casada y tiene un hijo. La fruta la vende en las ferias de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Y requiere el crédito para la compra de fruta por carga para reducir sus costos y aumentar sus ingresos.
Vive en la zona de bajo irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Amalia sells fruit. She is married and has one child. She sells fruit at the local markets in the city of La Paz, and needs a loan in order to purchase fruit by the bushel in order to reduce her costs and increase her income. She lives in a rental home in the lower Irpavi section of the city of La Paz. This is the third time that she has applied to Impro for a loan. Her credit history, the way she repays her loans, makes her an excellent credit risk.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
El señor Salvador V. M. es casado, el vive con su esposa y con 1 de sus hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 8 años en su hogar. El señor Salvador trabaja como albañil por su propia cuenta, actividad a la que se  dedica desde hace 7 años, este trabajo representa la principal fuente de ingresos para el con los cuales mantiene a su familia y también con los que ha sacado adelante a sus otros 2 hijos que ya están casados.
El señor Salvador está solicitando un préstamo para construir enjarres interiores y exteriores en un cuarto para que de esta manera el señor Salvador y su familia tengan un hogar más amplio en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Salvador V. M. is married and he lives with his wife and one of his children. They have been living in their home for the past 8 years. Salvador has been self-employed as a mason for the last 7 years. This job gives him his main source of income which he uses to support his family. He was able to raise his other 2 children who are now married and living on their own. Salvador is requesting a loan so that he can build the exterior and interior framing of an addition to his home. With this addition Mr. Salvador and his family will have a larger home for them to live in. Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construct exterior and interior framing

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 346, provincia de Juanjui, departamento de Mariscal Cáceres. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 es mayor de edad y 1 todavía depende de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja administra el Instituto que hace años fundaron juntos. Como una oportunidad de crecer ingresa al banco hace 4 años, con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en un cafetín dentro del instituto.

Actualmente sigue con el mismo negocio, y además cuenta con una fotocopiadora con el que trabaja diariamente permitiéndole un ingreso diario para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 3,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara un terreno mas grande para el cafetín.

Isabel manifiesta su alegría de pertenecer a Manuela Ramos por haberle permitido crecer como mujer y empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in the Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 346, province of Juanjui, department of Marshal Cáceres. She is 47 years old and is the mother of 2 children, 1 of legal age and one of which who still depends on her. Her spouse administers the Institute that years ago they founded together. As an opportunity to grow, she joined the bank four years ago. With her first loan of $300 dollars she decided to invest in a small cafe inside the Institute. At present, she continues with her business, in addition to counting on a daily income from a a photocopier, with which she will be able to repay her loan promptly. With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy a larger plot of land for her cafe. Isabel is very happy to belong to Manuelo Ramos, which has permitted her to grow as a woman and a business person.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger plot of land for her cafe.

loans.name: Iris

texts.ru: Ирис мужчина 47 лет , женат имеет шестерых детей.Жена домохозяйка,занимается домашними делами.Сам Ирис занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота, коров.У него сейчас 5 голов коров,из которых две дают жирное, хорошее молоко.Ему по бизнесу помогают его сыновья , которым 18-20 лет.Кроме этого они занимаются ремонтом домов на заказ.Для увеличения оборотного капитала бизнеса животноводства, Ирис решил получить кредит в Микроинвесте.
texts.en:
Iris is a man of 47 years of age, married and has six children. His wife is a housewife and does the household chores. Iris has a business of raising cattle such as cows and then reselling it. At this time he has five heads of cows two of which give good heavy milk. His sons help him with the business who are 18 and 20 years old. Besides this they also do repairs and remodel homes. To increase the working capital of his animal husbandry business Iris decided to get a loan from MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand animal hunsbandry business

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor L. is a villager in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell. The additional profits will be used to support her family.

Her husband, Mr. Pha Soeung, is a farmer who cultivates rice on his own piece of land. This couple has seven children. Four of them are employed in a shoe factory. Another stays at home to look after the housework and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
El señor José Alberto vive con su esposa la señora Martha que se dedica de lleno al hogar. 
El trabaja en una empresa como operador con un ingreso estable, teniendo una antigüedad de 4 años, cuentan con dos hijos a los cuales les brindan una buena educación. 
Ella tiene un proyecto que es el iniciar un negocio de abarrotes ya que dentro del área de donde viven seria un buen  sector comercial. 	
Este es el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
José Alberto lives with his wife, Martha, who is a housewife.

He works as an operator in a business with a stable income. He has been there for four years, which offers his two children a good education.

She would like to start a grocery business, since they live in an area with a good commercial sector.

This is their motive for requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin a grocery business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a daughter. She says her daughter who is a hairdresser is currently married and lives with her husband.

Yaa lives with her husband and two other dependents in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a businesswoman. She sells second-hand textiles – clothes for both sexes and also bedsheets.

Yaa procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years and desires to expand her business. Yaa is hopeful to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure second-hand textiles for re-sale

loans.name: Nasreen Rauf Group

texts.en:
Waiza baji and Shaheena baji each want a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switchboards and switches) for their electric shops. 
Shagufta baji and Riaz baji each want a loan to buy goats for their animal-selling business.

Nasreen baji is the group leader of these four ladies. They all belong to a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Her husband's name is R.. He has an animal-selling business. He specifically sells goats to the butchers. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy goats to expand her husband’s animal-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) to resell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen had established a career as a court reporter, before she was sidetracked by personal tragedy.  After many years, she returned to court reporting and eventually found her passion in helping the hearing-impaired community through transcription and closed captioning services.  While working for a community college providing educational captioning services, Karen started One Stop Verbatim Services, which offers universal access to not only the hearing-impaired, but also English language learners, the elderly, and distance learning students.  Karen has big dreams for her business—she spends plenty of time cold-calling potential clients, such as sports stadiums where she wants to initiate captioning for sports games and events on their big screens.

A $10,000 loan will enable Karen to purchase the updated equipment that she needs in order to provide the best service to her clients and to expand her services to include web podcasts.

loans.use: Equipment for closed captioning services

loans.name: Fraternite Group

texts.en:
The “Fraternite” or “Fraternity” Bank of Hope group includes both male and female entrepreneurs, who belong to northern Haiti. After successfully repaying their first loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with the 2nd loan. Wilner D. is one of four representatives of the group. He is a hardworking, 26-year-old man.

Wilner says he “mixes it up” with a variety of products selling mostly bamboo, vegetables and charcoal. He is happy that he could buy his tools outright and invest more in his business. The larger investments has given him increased profits, which in turn allowed him to help his family by saving ~ USD35 (1400gds). Wilner says, “Though things are hard, I’m thankful for the assistance. I hope to be a good steward over what has been given to me and to see it grows in the future.” Wilner and Esperanza thank you for your support.

loans.use: bamboo, tools for cutting and transport

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es: Doña Digna está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (repara su cocina), labora como docente de la escuela Mauricio Cajina desde hace 16 años, tiene un niño de 11 añitos que estudia su 6to grado de educación primaria, su esposo trabaja como albañil y ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, se caracteriza por ser una mujer  responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy humilde, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, donde la población cada dia crece mas, ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que ha obtenidos grandes beneficios, pues ha mejorado su vivienda y comprado electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar.  Actualmente doña Digna está estudiando su 4to año en la universidad URACCAN de Nueva Guinea,  su sueño es seguir estudiando, y que su hijo se desarrolle en  mejores condiciones,  también espera tener estabilidad laboral para continuar ayudandoles a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Dona Digna wants to refinance her 7th loan so that she can make improvements to her house (kitchen repairs). She has worked as a teacher at the Mauricio Cajina school for 16 yeas. She has a young son, 11 years old, who is in the 6th grade. Her husband is a construction worker and they share household expenses and rent. Dona Digna can be described as responsible, scrupulous, hard-working and modest. She lives in the #2 area of the Nueva Guineau neighborhood where the population grows larger by the day. She is grateful to AFODENIC for past loans that have allowed her to improve her house and buy appliances, things that have made the lives of her family better. Dona Digna is now in her 4th year at the URACCAN de Nueva Guinea university. Her dream is to continue her studies and to see her son grow up in better conditions. She also wants steady work since her family has few economic resources and she wants to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen repairs.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella P., 49, is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, where she is the married mother of six school-aged children. To earn a living, Bella makes and sells bibingka or rice cakes in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years now, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Bella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to expand her product line. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to expand product line

loans.name: Keli

texts.es:
La señora Keli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y no tiene hijos.

Keli, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de refrigerios, hoy en día vende productos de catálogos de las diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Kelita, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Keli belongs to the Communal Bank "San Marcelo II" in the Morales District in the San Martín Province of Peru. She is a common-law wife, is 29 years old, and doesn't have children. Keli is a woman who has managed to get past many difficulties in her life and her desire to get ahead gave her good results. Before, she worked selling snacks, and today she sells catalog products from different lines such as: Unique, Esika, and Avon, and she is very happy about what she has achieved. With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, she will buy beauty products for her stock, like women's and men's perfumes, lotions, compact powders, lip liners, nail polish, as well as another display case to show her products in. With her maturity, Kelita is an example to follow for many women who start a business and achieve their goals with perseverance. She is very thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and helping other women grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy catalog products to increase her stock

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is a silk weaver; she operates a silk-weaving business at her house located in Kosh Dach. Kosh Dach is an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. It’s a skill she learned from her parent. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then in turn sells it in Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Mr. Tev Ros, is a security guard. In the past, he used to be a motor taxi driver. 

Mom has asked for a loan one time already. She is now requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business, and she will use a part of her loan to buy cow and ox to raise as well.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business and buy cow and ox to raise.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is 35 years old and married with three children whose ages range from 6 to 16 years old. The eldest two children attend school. The family lives in the village of Sitio Napulo, Brgy. Cerantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. As a mother, Arlene is always looking ahead and thinking about her children's future. She makes plans for when they grow up; she wants to send them to school and get a college degree, and later have a stable job, have their own family, and be free from poverty. But then she sometimes questions how her dreams can be fulfilled because her husband's income is too small and not sufficient even to cover their household expenses.

With these aspirations in mind, Arlene began to help her husband by selling seaweed in the local market and other neighboring places. The little she earned helped defray the household expenses and support her children's school-related needs. She then decided to expand her business to earn more, and so asked around about where and how she could access additional capital to do this. It was at this time that she learned about NWTF-Project Dungganon and how it could help her financial needs. In 1996, Arlene became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, and she used her first loan cycle to increase the volume of her seaweed business. She diligently paid her weekly installments and maintained her good credit record so that she could take advantage of a larger loan in the next cycle. By so doing she increased her income. She then had enough capital to start another business, a general store in her neighborhood. The store now earns 3,000 PHP a month to supplement the family income.

Arlene is a shrewd businesswoman and plans her cash flow well. In her previously cycle, she borrowed 17,000 PHP, which she used to invest in her business. She was able to fully pay it on time and without any delays. This time around, for her ninth cycle loan, she is borrowing only 6,000 PHP. This is because she anticipates that demand for her products will drop because people in her neighborhood will have less disposable income as it is off-season for the biggest employers in the area – the sugar mill and sugar plantations. She intends to add the loan to her revolving working capital in her general store.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: As additional capital for the business

loans.name: Demberel

texts.en:
Demberel E. is 25 years old and lives with his wife in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. E. owns and operates a cafe in his town. His menu includes a variety of traditional Mongolian meals such as lapsha /noodle soup/, buuz /steamed meat dumplings/ and huushuur /fried flour meat pockets/. E. opened his cafe in 2005 with the help of his wife. He runs the business and his wife cooks. E. also operates a meat trading business to supplement his family's income. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase groceries and meat for his businesses.							

Demberel's wife, who helps run the cafe is pictured above

loans.use: To purchase groceries and meat for his businesses

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma B., a 46 year old entrepreneur from Ascoville, Malaria, Caloocan City.  Her husband Nicomedes, 49, works overseas.  Wilma takes care of their two children.
 
Due to consistent consumer demand, Wilma embarked on selling electronic load credits  for mobile phones five years ago.  She used to only attend to her direct selling of cosmetics and apparels (which she still does).  She now earns more than P20,000
net income a month. 

Wilma applied for a new loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the amount of P12, 000.00 as additional capital for her businesses.  She wishes to establish branches in other areas.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her retail business

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea S., age 34 and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Yan, age 39, have been married since 1992 and have two young sons. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.   

Sophea has been selling clothes for 10 years. She buys supplies of clothes from the Phnom Penh market for resale in the local market. Her husband has been selling watches for 10 years as well. She does not own her own shop, so she has to spend a lot of money to pay for rential costs. It is difficult for her to manage her income to support her family. 

Sophea is requesting a loan of 1,000USD to purchase her own shop to sell clothing.

loans.use: To purchase a shop to sell clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 43 years old. Susan is married and has 3 children. The eldest is an adult while the remaining two are school-aged. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a video karaoke unit for the business. Susan is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, and feed and other supplies for her pig-raising activity. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Susan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo is 51 years old, married, and has three children, all still in school.  He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a coastal community in the central region of Ghana, which is a popular tourist destination. Kwadwo earns income running a drug store by the roadside in his community. Kwadwo has been in this business for over 11 years now and currently needs a loan to buy drugs in bulk to increase the stock in his store.

loans.use: Purchase of drugs for sale

loans.name: Aidalina De Mercedes

texts.es:
El señora Aidaliana De Mercedes M. calderón es originaria del municipio de san Juan de Limay departamento de Estelí su principal actividad de trabajo es el comercio ella tiene una pulpería donde los ingresos que obtiene los invierte en su finca además se dedica a actividades ganaderas como compra venta de ganado.

Doña Aidalina utilizara el crédito para la retención de novillos de engorde desea retener sus novillos para buscar una mejor ganancia en ellos y poder venderlos de pesa, su negocio comenzó vendiendo comida en un restaurante con su mama luego se dedico a poner una pulpería y rento el local donde tenia su restaurante hoy en día dice que compro una pequeña finca con ayuda de sus hijos y su esfuerzo propio donde también se dedica a compra venta de ganado dice que ella siempre a trabajado con crédito y que lo que tiene es gracia a ello por lo que piensa que con este crédito le baya muy bien.

Aidalina es una madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos tres mayores de edad y una menor que es la que depende de ella el cual entrara a la universidad este año dos mil diez. Este es el tercer crédito que Aidalina tiene con ceprodel en un periodo de dos años y medio expreso que con los créditos que se le han dado en ceprodel a obtenido buenas ganancias ya que a invertido en su negocio y su finca además platea que piensa seguir trabajando con ceprodel porque ella se a superado a través del crédito y esta muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aidaliana De Mercedes M. Calderón comes from the San Juan de Limay municipality in the administrative district of Estelí. Her main job is in business; she owns a small store and invests the income she earns into her farm. She also sells cattle. Doña Aidalina will use the loan to keep young bulls for fattening. She wants to keep the young bulls in order to obtain a better price for them and to be able to sell them at a good weight. She started her business by selling food in a restaurant with her mother. Later she began to set up her little store and rent out the location where she had her restaurant. Today she tells us that she has bought a small farm where, with the help of her children and with her own efforts, she will also sell cows. She tells us that she has always worked with credit and that she is thankful for it because she believes that with this loan she will do very well. Aidalina is a single mother with four adult children and one younger child who is still dependant on her. Her youngest will start university this year, 2010. This is the third loan that Aidaline has with Ceprodel over a period of two and a half years. With the loans obtained through Ceprodel she has earned good profits as she has invested in her business and her farm. She is planning to continue working with Ceprodel because the loans have brought her success and for that she is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 7 young bulls for fattening

loans.name: Anecita's Group

texts.en:
Anecita P. is from the village of Tungawan Tambulig ZDS. She is 33 years old. Anecita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Anecita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other daily use products in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $116 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 42 years old man who lives in Gaza, Palestine. He is married with seven young children. He owns a barn in which he has raised different kinds of cattle since 1990. He needs a loan of $2000 to do some maintenance works in the barn and to buy more cattle. Ahmad  has a successful business and would appreciate some help to continue his good work.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and maintain their barn

loans.name: Samorn
