texts.en: C. Samorn is 28 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She works in a grocery store, making approximately U.S. $10 in revenue a day, while her husband, pictured, is a sculptor who makes about U.S. $6 a day.  She and her husband have one little child. C. Samorn is asking for a loan of U.S. $1,000 to purchase sculpture tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase sculpture tools.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice M., 27, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Joel M., an appraiser, and they are blessed with a child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Janice has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

Now, with your help, Janice would like to obtain a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish the current stocks in her product inventory.

Janice dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to replenish her current stock

loans.name: Laura Esperanza

texts.es: Laura Esperanza R. L. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a sus dos hijos, de 17 y 12 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar en la escuela del lugar. Ella posee un comedor en el que se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos de lunes a sábado, así mismo comercializa bebidas, golosinas y otros productos más. Dicho negocio está ubicado frente a la Fiscalía General de La República regional de San Miguel, en donde Laura vende la mayor parte de sus alimentos con los empleados de la Fiscalía, contando de esta manera con muchos clientes fijos los cuales día tras día consumen sus productos. Una de las principales razones de estos es porque Laura ya posee 10 años de tener este negocio, por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar siendo recomendada por muchas personas. Laura solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima necesaria para poder elaborar mayor cantidad de comidas y de esta forma extender el menú, entre los ingredientes que ella más necesita están: granos básicos, sodas, frutas, verduras, golosinas y pan. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Laura ya que ella es una persona muy trabajadora quien siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante y brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos los cuales dependen por completo de ella.
texts.en:
Laura Esperanza R. L., 50, lives in San Miguel department with her two children, who are 1 7 and 12 years old and are students at the local school. She has a small eatery where she prepares breakfasts and lunches from Monday through Saturday; she also sells beverages, snacks and other products. Her place of business is located across from the offices of the San Miguel Region Attorney General’s office; most of her sales are to employees of this office, who are regular customers that consume her meals daily. One of the main reasons this is so is that Laura has been in this line of work for 10 years so she is very well-known and highly recommended by many people in the area. Laura is asking for funds to buy all the raw ingredients she needs to make a larger quantity of meals so that she can expand her menu. Among the most needed ingredients are: basic grains, soft-drinks, fruit, vegetables, snacks and bread. This fills Laura with much enthusiasm because she is a hard-working woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and provide for her two children, who are completely dependent on her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soft-drinks, fruit, vegetables, snacks and bread.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus G. is from the village of Olango. He is 59 years old. Jesus is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesus raises crops. The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jesus has been engaged in his business for over 29 years and earns approximately 45 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Jesus joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Jesus is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jesus from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Aakuvi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est a appris la couture, en 2005 elle a ouvert son propre atelier qu’elle a appelé « HAUTE COUTURE LA JAUVIALE » plus tard elle a associé à ce commerce la vente des articles de mercerie et de pagnes ainsi elle réalise de très bons chiffre d’affaire chaque jour. Elle veut agrandir le commerce de pagnes et des articles de mercerie raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers articles de merceries et des pagnes.
Elle est mariée et a 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady learnt the sewing trade and in 2005 opened her own workshop, whch she named "HAUTE COUTURE LA JAUVIALE". Later on she complemented this business with the sale of haberdashery products and "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric). She thus makes a good turnover every day. She would like to expand the "pagnes" and haberdashery business, and, for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy various haberdashery products and "pagnes". She is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of haberdashery products and "pagnes"

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, a 37-year-old businessman, has been selling industrial chemicals and soap in Nairobi for the last ten years and terms it profitable. He is now requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add a stock of industrial chemicals and purchase containers for packing soap. Describing himself as hardworking and determined, Patrick hopes to buy a house and have a well-established industrial chemicals shop in five years.

loans.use: To add a stock of industrial chemicals and purchase containers for packing soap

loans.name: Lambert

texts.en:
Lambert is 32 years old and he is still single. He is well known in the business of selling a variety of domestic items including dishes, glasses, etc. He has been in this business for about eight years and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Lambert is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing some attractive dishes. With these additional dishes, he will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of domestic items including dishes

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mrs. La K. and her family live in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She was born in 1961. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow crops on to sell to support her family. 

Now her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. La K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, a cow for breeding, rent a plow to plow her field, and, with the rest of the loan, she plans to buy some piglets and pig feed. Her husband, Mr. Met Chea, is a construction worker. With these activities, they support a child who is a soldier. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a cow for breeding, and rent a plow to plow her field

loans.name: Nakirebe Womens Development Association-Mpigi Group

texts.en: For the last 7 years her Pub business in Nakirebe-Mpigi has been her springboard to financial stability. For a lady who began as a waitress, this is simply a milestone.  31 year old N. Jane is evidently a go-getter and it is for this reason that this married mother of 6 has propelled the growth of her business by leaps and bounds.  It goes without saying, that this business has been her main source of livelihood. With profits from it she has supported family and close relatives. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 50,000 shillings and with this loan, she is optimistic that she will be able to purchase more crates of beer and other liquor for her Pub. This she envisages will open for her some new financial growth horizons.

loans.use: The purchasing of more crates of beer and other drinks for her Pub

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma B. is from the village of Agassian. She is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elma B..
Elma is 34 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing products in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Indecisas Group

texts.es:
Doña Graciela se dedica a la venta de zapatos por pedido, pero los otros integrantes D. grupo tienen otras actividades algunos tienen su tienda de abarrotes, otro se dedican a vender productos de belleza, ropa, topers, son productos que se les logra sacar un poco más de ganancias comentan los integrantes D. grupo las indecisas.

Graciela es una mujer muy luchona puesto que ha salido adelante con su pequeña hija, ella se dedica a vender zapatos por catalogo, le ha echado muchas ganas porque es la unica forma de darle lo mejor a su hija, además de que es un ingreso extra, por el momento vive con sus papás pero quiere independisarse por el bien de su hija y ella, para esto necesita hacer crecer su negocio, solicitó 5000 para poder hacer su pedido más grande y tener más mercancia que mostrarle a sus clientes,así aumenta sus ventas y tendrá más clientes. 

Ella empezó con la venta de zapatos porque se dio cuenta que es un buen negocio siempre y cuando se le invierta pero no había tenido la oportunidad de invertirle un capital más fuerte y ahora con el crédito quiere hacer más grande sus ventas, ella esta conciente de que su negocio no la va a defraudar porque hasta ahora le ha dado para invertir y se queda con una parte de sus ganancias, "ahora más motivada estoy por el crédito pues si trabajo y le invierto tiempo tendre más ganancias y podre invertir más en la compra de zapatos", todo lo hace por su pequeña hija, Doña Graciela es madre soltera y necesita darle un futuro económico estable a su hija para que no le llegue a faltar nada. Su unica intención es hacerse de un ahorro para poderle dar los estudios a su hija que apenas esta empezando con su vida escolar.
texts.en:
Doña Graciela sells shoes by order, but the remaining group members have other business activities. Some have grocery stores, while others sell beauty products, clothing, and Tupperware in order to earn more income. The members of this group call themselves “Las Indecisas” (The Undecided). Graciela is a woman who is determined to get ahead with her young daughter. She sells shoes through a catalog since it is the only way for her to provide the best for her daughter as well as generate extra income. At the moment she lives with her parents, but she wants to be independent for her own sake and that of her daughter. Now she needs to grow her business, so she is requesting 5000 MXN so that she can place a larger order and have more merchandise to show to her customers. This will help her increase her sales and attract more customers. Graciela began selling shoes because it provided her with a good business. However, she has not had the opportunity to invest in her business due to insufficient capital. Now with this loan she will be able to generate more sales. Graciela is always aware of the needs of her business and does not want to disappoint anyone. Since she has been provided with the chance to invest, she hopes to keep part of her earnings. “This loan has provided me with more motivation in my work because I will be able to invest in the purchase of more shoes and earn more income,” says Doña Graciela. She is a single mother who does everything she can for her young daughter. Graciela needs to provide her with a stable financial future so that she lacks nothing. Her only intention is to set aside some savings for her daughter’s education since she is about to start school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mrs. SaroE. Eam and her husband, Mr. Chhum Uk, live in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have one son and one daughter. The son attends school and the daughter is a garment factory worker. 

SaroE. sells porridge in front of the garment factory. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. The couple asked for a Kiva loan once before. Now SaroE. is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive work.

loans.name: Sugeivis

texts.es:
Sugeivis es una joven mujer que vive en San Jacinto, población de gran predominio  de artesanos de hamacas y mochilas, pero también concurren las actividades derivadas de la madera  y en menor proporción los comerciantes; allí Sugeivis tiene su negocio llamado  Muebles y Artesanías San Jacinto, desde hace dos años cuando cambió su actividad como comerciante de electrodomésticos, para dedicarse a lo que hoy hace: ella trae desde Sampues, municipio del departamento de  Sucre, mecedoras, juegos muebles para la sala y para dormitorio, los comercializa en San Jacinto y en Valledupar, lugares y en esté ultimo agrega para su venta las  famosas artesanías de su natal San Jacinto, para complacer los pedidos de sus clientes que son docentes y  trabajadores independientes. 
Sugeivis es muy feliz con su negocio y depende económicamente de él, además de tener  a cargo su abuela y una hermana; con su credikiva, comprará   hamacas, bolsos, juegos de cuarto, juegos de comedor y sillas en cuero que ya tiene encargado. Su principal meta es prosperar con el negocio, aumentar las ventas y lograr que este adquiera mayor reconocimiento de la comunidad, así mismo desea ayudar a su hermana para que siga estudiando. Entre sus desafíos cuenta que algunas veces se han presentado  clientes de difícil cobro, que  reaccionan de manera agresiva, pero finalmente ha sabido sortear cada situación y en el futuro esta experiencia le ha servido para seleccionarlos mejor, pues ella quiere progresar y ser muy exitosa por encima de todas las adversidades.
texts.en:
Sugeivis is a young woman that lives in San Jacinto, a population predominantly of hammock and backpack craftsmen, but there are also woodwork activities and a smaller number of shopkeepers. There Sugeivis has her own business called Furniture and Handicrafts of San Jacinto, for the past two years since she switched from her job as an electric household appliances shopkeeper to do the work she does today. She brings from Sampues, a municipality of the department of Sucre, rocking chairs and furniture sets for the living room and bedroom, and sells them in San Jacinto and in Valledupar. In the latter she also sells the famous handicrafts of her native San Jacinto to meet the requests of her clients that are teachers and independent workers. Sugeivis is very happy with her business and depends economically on it, in addition to having to care for her grandmother and a sister. With her Kiva credit, she will buy hammocks, bags, bedroom sets, dining room sets, and leather chairs that she has already ordered. Her main goal is to prosper with her business, increase her sales, and through this to receive more recognition in the community. Also, she wants to help her sister continue studying. Among her challenges, she says that sometimes she has customers that are difficult to collect from, that react in an aggressive matter, but she has finally figured out how to handle each situation and in the future this experience will help her make better selections. She wants to progress and be very successful despite all the adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hammocks, bags, bedroom sets, dining room sets, and leather chairs which she has already ordered

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila E. is a married woman who lives in Jingjong Village, Brgy Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating oyster culture and fish vending businesses. Her husband Jesus E., who is 50 years old, works as a businessman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 14 to 28 years old. 

Cirila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cirila has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to add to her capital to purchase a fishing boat and to fund her oyster culture activities so that she can continue to save up for future, for family and business. 

The accompanying picture shows Cirila on the beach pointing to her oyster culture site. Cirila E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund for oyster culture

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher A. is 57 years old and is married to Barack Ochieng. They have one adult son. The husband has retired from his place of work and depends on his pension to enable him make ends meet.

For the past 11 years, Jenipher has run a posho mill (grinding machine), grinding maize into maize flour. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a client, and she is applying for her second loan. She is in need of maize to add to her stock so that she can be able to meet the demands of her clients. Her monthly income is KES 15000.

She hopes to expand the business and yield more profit to help her contribute well to the upkeep of the family.

loans.use: To buy maize to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria M. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 50 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns a business raising and fattening pigs sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of the raised animals.

In 2009, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Ivie

texts.en:
Ivie C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 10. She is engaged in farming. She helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. Ivie also runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells sugar, vinegar, and other kinds of products. She also sells their rice at her store. Ivie wants to help improve her family's living conditions. 

Ivie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ivie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan T. (pictured) is 47 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Phat Kroch, who is 48 years old, have been married since 1987. They have two children: one son and one daughter. Their son is in school, while their daughter is married and lives outside the family home.

To support their family, Chan and her husband are silk weavers. They sell their finished products to a middleman, who takes their products to Phnom Penh or other places to re-sell for profits. In addition, the couple also farms to generate income.

Chan is now seeking a loan in the amount of $600 to both purchase weaving materials to better operate her weaving business and to buy a water-pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: To expand and improve her businesss by purchasing weaving materials and a water-pumping machine

loans.name: Luis Camilo

texts.es:
Luis de 35 años, (aparece con su familia (-) el menor ) es un hombre emprendedor pero por cosas del destino lo sacaron del trabajo dándole una liquidación que le ayudo a buscar una actividad económica. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín pudo ubicar una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Ya tiene 8 años con su tienda en donde vende víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar la libra a $ 0.25, aceite a $ 1.20 etc. Con la ayuda de su esposa ha podido surtir más la tienda con vegetales y verduras. Ellos quieren seguir trabajando para darle un buen futuro a sus tres hijos de 9, 7, y 3 años (aparecen los mayores en la foto). 

Tiene muchas aspiración con su tienda por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar vitrinas, arroz, azúcar y así poderla surtir mas. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa ubicando una losa y que sus hijos terminen los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
35 year-old Luis (who appears in this photo with his family, minus his youngest) is an enterprising man.  Fate meant that he lost his job and was given severance pay which helped him to look for a business activity.

Luis lives in a peri-urban area called Fortín where he set up a store in the front of his home.  He has had his store for 8 years now.  He sells essential household products such as rice, sugar at $0.25 a pound, oil at $1.20, etc.  With his wife's help, he has been able to better stock his store with vegetables and greens.  They would like to continue working to provide a good future for their three children aged 9, 7 and 3 (the eldest two appear in the photo).

Luis has a lot of aspirations for his store.  He would like a loan so that he can buy display cases, rice, sugar and thereby better stock the store.  In the future, he would like to better build his house, installing a tile floor, and he would like his children to finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: To buy display cases and rice

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Davaa A. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Uvd province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence.

Davaa operates a firewood and coal selling business, with the help of his wife, in their town. He has been engaged in this business for the past 2 years and has gained much experience. He purchases one truck of coal and firewood and packages them into bags to sell at the local market as a retailer. Their monthly business profit reaches between 100,000 and 120,000 MNT.

Davaa is a modest man. For the future, he says, "All I want is to provide higher education for my children and see them live a decent life." He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase 2.5 tons of coal and half a truckload of wood at wholesale prices for his business.

loans.use: To purchase 2.5 tons of coal and half a truckload of wood

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María Elizabeth; ella tiene 54 años D. edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza ella venD. perfumes, cremas, colonias, entre otros más, la socia es consultora D. las líneas D. Avon, Esika, Unique y Dupre D. esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante y se divierte ya que es un trabajo que le gusta mucho.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mas productos y D. esta manera abastecerse para poder tener más variedad D. productos que ofrecer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elizabeth belongs to the ” SUMAC SONCCO ” communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Maria Elizabeth is 54, married, and has 5 children. She has a beauty products sales business. She sells perfumes, creams, cologne and other items. She is a consultant for the Avon, Esika, Unique and Dupre lines. This is how she gets her family ahead, and she has fun because this is a business that she likes a lot.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more products in order to stock up and have a greater variety of products to offer.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: for the purchase of more products to stock up and have a greater variety of products to offer.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Rises in prices first hit the most vulnerable classes of the population. Rural areas and those who financially depend on trade suffer the most. 

Nazira O., 27, is a member of this group. She is married to a farmer and has three children, the oldest of whom is 8 years old. Her kids are in school and daycare while she is at work. Following the recommendations of her sister five years ago, Nazira invested a start-up capital of 20,000 soms in retailing consumer goods in a market in the small town of Kerben.

She is happy with how she is running the business despite the challenges she faces with transportation of wholesale goods. Nazira’s home town of Kerben is several hours away from the capital Bishkek, where she gets the wholesale products. This long distance affects the quality of goods and her ability to cover costs. In order to attract more customers she applied for a loan from Kiva that would help her to broaden the assortment of her products. She plans to spend the anticipated proceeds on purchasing an automobile so that she can transport the goods herself.

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for trade

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy S. is 39 and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. Dy and her husband sell traditional cakes and earn a daily income of 5 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 25 USD on food and 30 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Dy is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport her cakes to market. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Dy would like to repair her house.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Santos Cristobal

texts.es:
Don Santos de 70 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán, vive con su familia en su mayoría nietos, él trabaja para poder ayudar a sus hijos, dedicándose a la elaboración de loza, este oficio lo aprendió desde niño, su padre se lo enseño, hoy día el comercializa y compra a pequeños productores, realiza el proceso de la quema de los productos, luego los ofrece en el mercado. La dificultad de don Santos se da en el invierno ya que se produce menos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la elaboración de sus productos como leña, nacazcol, loza cruda y el transporte, esta inversión será una gran ayuda para don Santos, ya que fortalecerá el negocio y aumentaran sus posibilidades de recibir mejores ingresos, dándole a su familia una mejor solvencia económica para que sus hijos continúen en sus estudios universitarios.
Don Santos se considera satisfecho con la labor que ha realizado por años, pero su aspiración es enseñar a sus hijos el arte de la alfarería, para que estos le den continuidad al negocio, por tal motivo él se esfuerza cada día a dar la mejor dedicación a su familia y luchar por que tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Santos, 70, lives in Guatajiagua, Morazán department with his family, mostly his grandchildren.  He works to help his children.  He is a potter.  He learned this occupation while still a little boy; his father taught him.  Today, he sells to and buys from small producers.  He bakes the items and then sells them in the market.  His difficulty is winter which is when production drops off.

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise needed for his production: firewood, nacazcol seeds (source of black ink), and unbaked pots and to pay for transportation.  This investment will be of great use to him because it will strengthen the business and increase the possibility of obtaining better income thus providing his family with improved economic solvency so that his children can continue with their university studies.

Santos feels satisfied with the work he’s done over the years but his hope is to teach his children the art of pottery so that they will provide continuity to the business.  Because of this he strives daily to be more dedicated to his family and fights to meet their needs.

loans.use: To invest in firewood, nacazcol seeds, unbaked pots and for transportation costs.

loans.name: Kerly  Tatiana

texts.es:
Kerly  tiene  21  años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío de Las Monicas ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. Realiza esta actividad hace 1 año, teniendo clientela  establecida. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Kerly desea adquirir más productos de belleza y así ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido. Para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Kerly is 21 years old and single.  She lives together with her parents in the small village of Las Monicas, in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Kerly's business is selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She sells these products to her neighbors and friends.  She works hard every day to attract more customers since the more orders she makes, the more income she makes from the company that supplies the products.  She has been in this business for 1 year and has an established customer base.  Her business helps her to cover her personal expenses and support her parents with their household finances.

Kerly would like to acquire more beauty products and thereby expand her business, setting up a sales location for selling her cosmetics in her home.  This will mean that she will have products to hand and her customers won't have to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders arrive.  For this reason, she needs to acquire more products and, in order to achieve her goal, she has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita nació en la provincia D. Anta del departamento D. Cusco, ella tiene 52 años D. edad y vive en la ciudad D. Izcuchaca, Anta. 

Margarita se dedica a varias actividades económicas como a la crianza D. animales menores, venta D. artesanía y venta D. ropa. En esta oportunidad Margarita requiere el microcrédito para comprar pollos y para comprar ropa. El sueño D. Margarita es abrir una veterinaria en la ciudad D. Izcuchaca.    

Margarita es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene D. la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Margarita was born in Anta Province, Department of Cusco. She is 52 years old and lives in the city of Izcuchaca, Anta.

Margarita is involved in different business activities such as raising small animals, selling crafts, and selling clothes. She is taking this opportunity to request a microloan to buy chickens and clothing. Her dream is to open a veterinary clinic in the city of Izcuchaca.

Margarita is a responsible person who is a member of the Communal Bank “Warmicuna Llanqanchis”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The phrase “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” means “Women Who Work” in the Quechua language.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita E., 53, is a resident of Pangarap Village, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Julio, a carpenter. She is the mother of one child who is currently attending college. By the grace of God, Nenita has managed to support her child's schooling up to the college level. This is the dream for most Filipino parents like Nenita, as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Nenita has been running her own variety store for 12 years now.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a place to go to buy cooking oil, a sachet of shampoo, an egg or even soft drinks and candies for PHP 5.  She buys these items at wholesale prices and retails them with a minimum mark-up.  She also sells cell phone load credits to all mobile phone networks operating in her local community.  She earns an estimated net monthly income of around PHP10,000.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Nenita is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more grocery items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita dreams a of running a successful business and enjoying a good life and good health with the entire family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to replenish the stock of her variety store

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en:
Zipora is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages 3 and 12 years old. Zipora sells beans and sorghum. Her business is well organized. She employs two people in her business and has three year's of experience.

Zipora has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more beans and sorghum. With the profits, Zipora will pay school fees for her children and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of beans and sorghum

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El señor Walter es maestro y los fines de semana viaja al interior el país ya que el comercializa chamarras. Estas actividades son  su fuente de ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para  el aumento de capital para comprar más chamarras de invierno debido a que la temporada de invierno ya está por comenzar en Bolivia. Vive en anticretico con su madre en una casa ubicada en la zona de San José de Yunguyo  de la ciudad de El Alto; es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en Impro.
texts.en: Mr. Walter is a teacher who travels to the interior of the country on weekends to sell jackets. These are his two sources of income. Because winter is beginning in Bolivia, he needs this loan to increase his capital in order to buy more winter jackets. He lives in an anticrético housing arrangement with his mother, in a house located in the San José de Yunguyo zone of the city of El Alto [anticrético is a common rental arrangement in Bolivia where the renter gives a lump sum loan to a property owner in exchange for housing for a specified length of time]. He is single and does not have children. This is the first time he has taken out a loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy winter jackets to sell

loans.name: Ana Rosario

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio por eso quiere seguir con su tienda de abastos.  

En la actualidad tiene su tienda surtida con diferente mercadería que solicita la clientela del sector donde vive. Trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo snack, bebidas,  carnes, granos, enlatados etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando y satisfaciendo los pedidos de sus clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar etc. en el futuro quiere incrementar su clientela y poder aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, is a working woman who has many aspirations for her business so she wants to continue with her grocery store.

Currently she has a shop stocked with merchandise for the different clientele in the area where she lives.  Ana works from the early hours selling snacks, drinks, meats, grains, canned goods etc.  She has many aspirations for her business and she wants to keep working and satisfying customer orders. With the requested loan she wants to buy rice, oil, sugar etc.  In the future she wants to increase her customer base and increase business.

loans.use: to buy rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 43 years old, is married with 4 children and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To help her family financially, Editha has a mini grocery store that generates PHP 10,000 per month. Editha sells different kinds of food, fruits, spices, and refreshments.

Editha wants to change the building materials of her store because it is constructed only of light materials. Editha has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to buy new building materials for the store. Editha has been a member of GDMPC for more than 4 years. In the future, she hopes that she will have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the store

loans.name: Saidakbar

texts.ru: Саидакбар проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Саидакбар занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. То есть он покупает несколько телят, откармливает, а потом продает по более высокой цене. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки одного теленка.
texts.en: Saidakbar lives in A. Jomi. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Saidakbar works in animal husbandry. He fattens and sells cattle. He buys some calves, fattens them, and then sells them for a higher price. He has been doing this for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy one calf.

loans.use: to buy one calf.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es natural de Sicaya, tiene 53 años, toda su vida radicó en este lugar y en la actualidad vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia. Posee una granja donde cría animales menores, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 2 años. Ella posee espacios grandes de terrenos que se encuentran cercanos a su casa, ahí construyó un ambiente grande para sus aves como pollos y gallinas; ahora también de cuyes, que los vende periódicamente y  es administrado por uno de un familiar de confianza y que son socios actualmente. La venta de pollos ha ido en aumento porque tiene un cuidado especial con sus animales, además de que siempre esta pendiente de ver lo mejor para el crecimiento de su negocio. En adelante desea tener una granja grande y ser abastecedora de estos animales dentro de su zona. Viene trabajando de manera grupal en MFP por medio de la invitación personal de sus vecinos la cual se animó a integrar y en la actualidad este es su crédito número 16, por el cual solicita un préstamo en beneficio de su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cuyes productores y en la siembra de alfalfa que sirve de forraje para sus animales.
texts.en:
Carmen, 53, is from Sicaya and has lived there all her life.  She lives with her husband and daughter in her own house, and has a farm where she has been raising small animals for two years.  Near her house she has two large strips of land where she built a house for her chickens.  Now she also raises and sells guinea pigs and is in business with a relative.  Chicken sales have increased thanks to her special care with the animals.  She is always looking for ways to improve and grow her business.

In the future she wants to have a larger farm so she can be the main supplier in the area.  She has been working as part of a group through MFP which she was asked to join through an invitation from neighbors who encouraged her to join.  This is her 16th loan, which she plans to use to buy guinea pigs for breeding and to plant alfalfa seeds which will be used as fodder.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Malengo Group

texts.en:
Mwanaenzi, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school. For the past four years, she has been running two businesses: she is food vendor and she sells paraffin for fuel. Mwanaenzi works from six in the morning through six in the evening and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She is a member of the loan group “Malengo,” which has 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

Mwanaenzi is requesting a loan to increase her sock of paraffin. This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy land, pay school and household expenses, as well as to start selling paraffin. Mwanaenzi has successfully repaid all of her loans. Her dream is to one day be able to buy more land.

loans.use: to incrase her stock of paraffin

loans.name: Elvira Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Elvira, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 10 y 7 años los mismos que estudian dos en colegio y dos en escuela. El marido es chofer y trabaja en una empresa.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de chifles en su casa, junto a sus hijos todos los días se encargan de fabricar este producto que es muy apetecido por los pobladores y luego distribuirlos a las diferentes tiendas y picanterías de la localidad.  También se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, estas ventas las realiza puerta a puerta sobretodo en las tardes cuando se ha desocupado del trabajo de la fabricación de chifles. Lleva 10 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien creciendo cada dia más.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar manteca en canecas ya que así le salen más baratas y fundas plásticas para envasar los chifles. Está en el Banco Comunal  siete ciclos y le gusta por  La ayuda que siempre ha recibido del banco.

Su sueño es son tener maquinarias para producir a mayor escala sus productos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years ago as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds” because of the large amount of this fruit that existed back then, the members of the “Mujeres 13 de Septiembre” (13th of September Women) meet every fifteen days.

Elvira, 40, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 17, 15, 10 and 7 years of age.  Two of them go to secondary school and two are in elementary school.  Her husband’s a driver and works for a firm.

She has a home-based business making fried banana chips.  Together with her children she makes this product that is highly sought after by local residents and that she then distributes to various local stores and snack shops every day.  She also sells all types of clothes door to door, especially in the afternoon when she’s finished making the banana chips.  She’s been in business ten years and does very well, growing more each day.

She will use this loan to buy lard in tubs because they are less expensive that way and plastic bags to package the chips.  

She’s been in the communal bank for seven cycles and she likes it because of the help she always gets from the bank.  Her dream is to have machinery to produce her products in a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy lard and plastic bags.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. She is 27 years old and married to Simon; they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming income.

In the future, Hellen hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years of age and married. She is a very responsible and hard-working mother to her four children. Two of her children are currently studying and the other two are still infants. For five years, she has been engaged in selling and making balut — a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell, commonly sold as street food. She is glad because her business is improving and she is able to start another business — a retail store. She has been managing it for three months and from it she is able to earn about P1,000 a month. Her income from balut and retail store sales was used to cover their daily needs, allowances for her children, and payment of electric bills. 

Evelyn would like to buy her groceries in bulk so that she could minimize the cost of going to and from the market, but her income is not sufficient. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy balut and different kinds of basic items such as sugar, oil, eggs, bread and soft drinks for her shop. She believes that with this loan and hard work she can maintain and improve her business. She is also aiming to support her children until they can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy balut and different kinds of basics such as sugar, oil, eggs, bread and soft drinks for her  retail shop business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old and married to Rosebella who runs a salon in Irimis thus contributing income to the family. Together they have one child aged three years old. He operates a retail shop in Irimis trading center and has been there for a period of four years earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

This is his second term loan and wishes to use the loan to purchase two bales of maize flour, one bag of sugar, two bales of wheat flour and one bag of rice. The ploughed profits will be used to repay the loan and to purchase more stock for the business. His dream is to expand his shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his shop

loans.name: Claudia Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Josefina esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a mejorar el local donde tiene su negocio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo de trabajo que es (secadora de pelo, maquina para cortar el cabello, plancha de pelo y para los tintes) ya que fue victima de un robo y se llevaron toda su herramienta de trabajo. 
Doña Claudia Josefina planea pagar el crédito con una parte de sus ganancias ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia y poder darles los estudios necesarios a sus dos hijos, que tiene bajo su responsabilidad, ya que es madre soltera. 
Desea mejor su negocio y que tenga más ingresos y así poder darles la mejor educación y vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is grateful for assistance and she asked for this loan because it will help her improve the place where she does business, and to be able to buy work equipment such as hair dryers, shears for cutting hair, hair straightener, and hair dyes. 

She was a victim of a robbery and they stole her work tools.

Claudia will repay the loan from her profits, which is how she provides for her family including the cost of educating her 2 sons, as she bears this responsibility as a single mother. 

She wants to improve her business and increase her earnings to be able to give her children the best education and life that she can.

loans.use: to purchase tools of the trade for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is very supportive lady who helps her husband financially by sewing clothes. She is well known in her community for her sewing skills and receives regular orders every month. She has no children. 

Her husband operates a fruit-selling business. He goes to the fruit market everyday early in the morning and buys fresh seasonal fruits for selling to his customers. 

He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and currently he is in need of money for buying fresh fruits in larger quantity. Therefore, Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. Her husband is very experienced in his business and Rehana is hopeful that an investment will bring his business to better and more profitable position. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling.

loans.name: Nueva Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA MARANATHA” iniciará su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de celulares, venta de colchones, distribuidora de productos HERBALITE, venta de mani, venta de comida, venta de repuestos, venta de papa y verdura, tienda de víveres, venta de DVD. 

La señora Maria  indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de sus vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos que trabaja hace tres años, aprendiendo el mismo de una de sus amigas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de repuestos), que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializa en el puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con el grupo la capacitación de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nueva Maranatha” is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Center. This group consists of 11 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Maria. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling mobile phones, selling mattresses, distributing Herbalife products, selling peanuts, selling food, selling spare parts, selling potatoes and vegetables, managing a grocery store, and selling DVDs.

Sra. Maria says that she joined Pro Mujer 10 years ago after receiving an invitation from her neighbors. She currently has a business selling spare parts which she has managed for three years. Maria learned this trade from one of her friends.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her inventory of spare parts. She acquires her merchandise at the fairs and later sells from her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to generate the income to support her family as much as possible. Maria is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria said that she enjoys sharing with her group, the health seminars, and the loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. This young man decided in 2010 to start his own business working as a furniture painter. He has had 8 years of previous experience working in this domain. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow $2,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools in order to accomplish his work properly. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to renew his business tools in order to accomplish his work properly.

loans.name: Mo'ataz

texts.en: Mo'ataz is a 33-year-old married man from Baqa'a, Jordan. He is the father of three children. Mo'ataz has an aluminum metal shop and he is requesting a loan of 700 Jordanian dinars to purchase a stapling machine and do maintenance on the metal cutting machine. An aspiration of Mo'ataz is to expand his business by leaving his partners and opening a totally owned shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stapling machine and do maintenace on the metal cutting machine

loans.name: Zacaria

texts.en:
Zacaria is 59 years old and lives in P6 Bangkal, Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is married with 4 adult-aged children. 

Zacaria has a shop that sells dried fish and longanisa. She had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase dried fish and to purchase the primary ingredients in making sausage.

Zacaria has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Zacaria hopes to expand her business and to become a supplier of Longanisa within the city.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and sausage.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Maribel sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Maribel con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Maribel solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos entre otros.
texts.en:
Maribel continues participating in the Choquequirao communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues working selling crafts such as, for example, textiles, shawls, gloves, "chullos" [wool caps with earflaps], mantillas, large blankets, ponchos, jackets, and ceramic decorations.

The last loan went well for Maribel and she managed to get good profits.  For this reason she wants another loan, since it helps her a lot in her business.

Maribel is requesting the loan to invest in buying materials to make blankets, banners, clothing for figures of saints, and chullos, among other things.

loans.use: to buy materials to make blankets, banners, clothing for figures of saints, caps with earflaps, and other things.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, cassavas, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, cassavas, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael believes that "Success is the fruit of every sacrifice." He is 32 years old, and newly married. His great ambition for his family is to improve their status of living and give them a better life. As a way of gaining income, he engages in buying and selling of dry goods in the public market. He has been in this business for almost 12 years and usually earns a profit of P 10,000 a month, that he uses for their needs and to save for future emergencies. 

He aims to improve his business and increase the products he offers to satisfy his customers' demand. But due to insufficient capital, he is requesting for P20,000 to buy additional stock of dry goods like blouses, pants, sweaters, polo shirts, skirts, socks and underwear to sell. He believes that he can improve the business as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods like blouses, pants, sweaters, polo shirts, skirts, socks and underwear to sell

location.town: Brgy. Almaguer North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Omar Alonso

texts.es:
Omar tiene 24 años de edad es un joven muy emprendedor, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad cálida y afectuosa muy conocida como la Tierra del sol Eterno, por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, con sus majestuosas dunas y su muy conocida  “Laguna de Huacachina”, sus pobladores son muy acogedores y hospitalarios, así como también luchadores, ya que a pesar del terremoto ocurrido en el año 2007 no se han dejado vencer por la adversidad y siguen adelante, en esta ciudad generosa vive Omar. Omar le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Ingeniería de sistemas, en sus tiempos libres Omar disfruta de jugar el futbol, es un deporte que lo apasiona mucho.

Omar es muy trabajador, tanto es su esfuerzo que el tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y ademas su negocios cabinas de internet (cibercafe), aunque sea un poco tedioso él con mucho esfuerzo maneja los dos negocios, con el apoyo de su mano derecha que es su pareja, a pesar que ella aun estudia, colabora mucho en el negocio y es quien le da ánimo para seguir adelante, Omar le dedica al negocio 10 horas diarias, en el cual puede atender alrededor de 15 a 20 clientes diarios, en un dia puede ganar hasta S/.200, pero en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/.300.

Omar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias al apoyo el podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa, asi como tambien renovar sus cabinas de internet, con esta mejoría el podrá tener más variedad en los productos que ofrece y le permitirá mejorar las instalaciones de su cabina para que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos, con ello generara mayores ingresos para poder ahorrar y cumplir uno de sus mas grandes sueños:” Tener su propio auto”
texts.en:
Omar is 24 years old and is a very entrepreneurial young man. He lives in the city of Ica, a warm and affectionate place that is known as the Land of Eternal Sun due to its warm climate throughout the year. It has majestic dunes and a well known oasis, "Laguna de Huacahina". The people of the city are very welcoming and hospitable in addition to being fighters. Despite the earthquake that occurred in 2007, they have not allowed themselves to be defeated by adversity and continue forward. Omar lives in this generous city. Omar really would like to study Systems Engineering. In his free time he enjoys playing soccer as it is a sport that he has a lot of passion for. 

Omar is a hard worker. His effort is so great that he has a business selling clothing as well as a business in internet booths (cyber cafe). Though it is a bit tedious, he manages both businesses with a lot of effort and with the support of his right-hand, his partner. Despite the fact that she is still studying, she helps out a lot with the business and is the person who gives him the motivation to get ahead. Omar works ten hours a day at his business, during which time he attends to around 15 or 20 customers daily. In one day he can make up to 200 PEN, but on a good day he can make up to 300 PEN. 

Omar really appreciates the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support he will be able to buy more merchandise for his clothing sales business as well as renovate his internet booths. This improvement he will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer and it will allow him to improve the cyber cafe facilities so thta the customers will feel more comfortable. With this he will generate mor income to be able to save and follow through on one of his biggest dreams: to own his own car.

loans.use: to set up his business and to buy equipment.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 31, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Pov is requesting for a loan of USD 800 to purchase dirt to fill up her village land in order to build a new house. In the future, she would like to support her child to study until he/she gets a Bachelors degree.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up her village land in order to build a new house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with one of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, John has been working hard to manage his health clinic, which sells medicine. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine and some equipment for the clinic, and will help John to generate greater profits and build a house of his own and provide basic needs for the family. John hopes that in the future he will be able to see his business expand more. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine and some equipment for the clinic

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a loving mother of her three children.Meanwhile,two of them had settled for marriage and the other one is still studying.Anita is a rolling vendor within her local community.Her husband is a farmer and at the same times a tricycle driver.Piggery has been Anita's first business involvement.She and her husband still working hard for their future emergency purposes.They don’t want to ask money or depend on their children help because they have their own families. Anita wants to generate her own money that's why she keeps on selling fish,vegetable and meat within her village.With her aim to have stable source of income,she is asking for additional capital of PHP50,000.She will invest this amount in buying fish,vegetable and meat to sell.She knows that this amount will help her much in running her food vending business and in sustaining her family basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy fish,vegetable and meat for her food vending business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 47 years old and is an honest, active, enthusiastic and entrepreneurial person. She and her three childrenlive in the city of Tampico. Two years ago, on the side walk outside her home, she started to make and sell hamburgers. But later she built a small stand with an overhead roof in from of her house. She started this for her need to obtain an income to help out her husband, mostly with the education of their children. Her husband's income was only enough to cover the household expenses. The daily struggles and the love of her family have permitted Cristina to keep up her business through so many years.

She needs to expand and continue with her business, as it is the onlyh way to provide her children with the education they need. Today she needs a loan of $925 for the purchase of ingredients that she uses to make her foods, such as, meat, cooking oil, natural gas, bread, tomatoes, onions, napkins, disposable cups and plates. These needed especially during this time of year when sales are highest. It is up to you, don't wait any longer. Become part of Cristina's efforts. She thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina tiene 47 años, es una persona honesta, activa, entusiasta y emprendedora. Ella es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la localidad de Tampico. Hace doce años, en la banqueta de afuera de su casa, comenzó a elaborar y vender tortas, pero después construyó un pequeño local techado al frente de su domicilio. Esto lo inició por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo, sobre todo con la educación de sus hijos, ya que con lo que él ganaba no nos alcanzaba más que para solventar los gastos del hogar. El esfuerzo diario y el amor a su familia han permitido que Cristina, después de tantos años conserve el proyecto que un día emprendió.

Ella necesita crecer y continuar con su actividad, pues la única forma de poder brindarle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan. En éste momento ella necesita de un crédito de $925 DLLS para la adquisición de materia prima con la que prepara sus alimentos, tales como carne, aceite, gas, pan, tomate, cebolla, servilletas, vasos y platos, desechables, ya que en ésta época aumentan las ventas. La decisión esta en tus manos, no lo dudes más, vuélvete parte de los logros de Cristina y su familia, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (food)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en: Faiq A. is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorny-Karabakh. He is 32 and married with 5 children. He opened his small pharmacy in 2000 by borrowing some money from a friend. He has now decided to enlarge his shop to include a new section for optics.  To reach this goal, he borrowed $1,200 in 2002 from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To enlarge his pharmacy

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Nila Alonso D. O. is 58 years old, married, and has a 23 years old daughter. She is a student; she studies Business Administration at the university. Her husband has had a bakery for more than 15 years and together they run a bakery that they opened in their home.

Every day, Nilda and her husband get up early and start making bread. Once ready, Nilda opens up the store while her husband delivers to nearby customers like grocery stores, supermarkets, etc. Thanks to the profits the business generates, they have been able to pay for her daughter's studies and they can live in a dignified way.

Nilda is requesting a loan of $600 that she plans to use to buy more base materials line flour, sugar, yeast, anise, etc. because the demand of their products has increased significantly in the last few months.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra. Nilda Alonso D. O. tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene una hija D. 23 años, ella es estudiante y actualmente se encuentra cursando la carrera D. Administración D. Empresas en la Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la panadería hace ya más D. 15 años y juntos administran una panadería que abrieron en su casa.

Todos los días Nilda junto con su esposo, se levantan temprano y comienzan su labor D. preparar los panificados; una vez elaborados, Nilda abre su local y los venD. en la misma panadería, mientras que su marido sale a entregar los pedidos a clientes D. la zona, como almacenes, supermercados, etc. Gracias a sus buenas ganancias ellos han podido pagar los estudios D. su hija y vivir D. forma digna.

Nilda solicita el crédito D. $ 600 con los que desea comprar más materia prima tales como harina, azúcar, levadura, anís, etc. ya que en los últimos meses han aumentado significativamente la demanda D. sus productos.

loans.use: to buy more base material like flour, sugar, yeast, anise, etc.

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en: Kuini is a twenty-nine year old lady with three children. She lives with her family of more than ten people, but is the only other person working besides her husband. She thought she could run a small business in order to help out her husband, so she wants a loan for US $500 to buy supplies for a bingo business, as well as to repair her home by buying cement, timber and iron roofing materials. She greatly appreciates the financial help from the SPBD program, because without it, she cannot start her business or improve some of the things needed for her family life. She will work very hard at her business, which she believes will be of great help to her and her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Bingo business and for home repairs.

loans.name: Rosario Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosario is a young mother who day after day seeks to offer the best in health and well being to the members of her family. This fact made her decide a year ago to set up on the side of their home a little candy shop and juice shop, with the intention of providing economically for her six year-old daughter. Previosuly, Rosario was just dedicated to studying. When she married her partner and gave birth to her little daughter, the responsibilities became a lot greater and she saw the obligation to postpone her managerial studies for a period, with the hope of beginning them again in the future. Today she has been able to meet both her goals by satisfactorily finishing her studies without neglecting her role as a mother, so she may now look to the future with optimism. For this reason she will continue working and managing her own business with the longing to make it grow and create her own enterprise that will generate resources for her family and a group of families in her neighborhood. Rosario wants to open a store where she sells medical materials and instruments commercially because her house is located close to a hospital, but meanwhile she will continue working in her convenient store and extending the same quality of service as always. For this purpose she needs to invest a small amount of money in her present business to cover the expenses of her young daughter's education. Support Rosario to continue steadily in her longings to excel.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Rosario, es una joven madre que día a día busca lo mejor para brindarle salud y bienestar a los miembros de su familia. Esta realidad hizo que hace un año decidiera emprender al lado de su pareja el establecimiento de una pequeña juguería y confitería, a fin de poder sostener económicamente a su pequeña de seis años.Anteriormente, Rosario, sólo se dedicaba a estudiar; cuando se unió a su pareja y nació su pequeña las responsabilidades fueron más grandes y es así que ella se vió en la obligación de postergar por un tiempo sus estudios de administración con la esperanza de reanudarlos nuevamente en un futuro.Hoy ha podido concretar ese anhelo y pudo terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y no descuidar su rol de madre y mira el futuro con optimismo. Por esta razón seguirá trabajando y administrando su propio negocio con el anhelo de hacerla crecer y no quedarse sin crear su propia empresa que le genere recursos a su familia y a un grupo de familias de su localidad.Rosario desea abrir una tienda donde comercializar materiales e instrumentos médicos por estar ubicado su casa cerca de un hospital, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando en su juguería, atendiendo con la misma calidad de siempre y para este fin necesita invertir una pequeña cantidad de dinero en la implementación de su actual negocio para cubrir los gastos educativos de su pequeña.Apoya a Rosario a continuar firme en sus anhelos de sobresalir.

loans.use: Improve her little sales space for the convenience and loyalty of her clients.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Like many women in her town, Mrs. Kossiwa Yao’s principal activity is the transformation of palm nuts into cooking oil. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She has been practicing this activity for the last 10 years. She contributes to the family’s expenses with the income from her business. She receives orders from surrounding villages. In turn, she goes to the surrounding villages and buys palm nuts. She brings them back to Amoussoukopé and using old fashioned methods, she extracts the oil to fulfill her clients’ needs. She masters her activity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Kossiwa Yao comme plusieurs femmes de la localité a pour activité principale la transformation des noix de palm en huile de cuisine. Elle agée de 28 ans , mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle exercrce cette activité depuis 10 ans. Elle participe aux charges de la famille par le revenu de son activité. Elle reçoit des commandes des villes environnantes. A son tour elle va dans les villages environnants achète des noix de palm, les ramène à Amoussoukopé et par la méthode artisanale elle extrait de l'huile pour la satisfaction de ses clientes . Elle a la maîtrise de son activité

loans.use: Purchase of 40 baskets of palm nuts in surrounding villages to extract 30 liters of palm nut oil and sale of the oil.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 30 years old and lives with her husband. She owns a beauty salon which she opened in 2002. Annie works as a hairdresser there from 8 am to 9 pm daily, making about US$135 per month.
