Annie hopes to receive a loan to increase the supply of her beauty salon services. She is a member of the loan group Peace, whose members help one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: Increase in the supply of parlor's services

loans.name: Rik

texts.en: Mrs. Rik K., who is 20, is a mother of a little child who works as a house wife and cook for her family. To help her family to earn a better life, her husband Mr. Song Sean, who is 23, is a souvenirs vendor at the Bayon temple and makes about $5 per day. To get a more convenient ride to work, the couple would like a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase a motor.

loans.use: Hope to use this loan to purchase a motor for commute.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia M. is from Saltillo, Nuevo Leon. She is married and has a 4-year-old daughter. Her husband works as an office worker. She stared her business 9 years ago. Since she was little she has enjoyed sewing. She started doing some mending, and thanks to her effort and good work, she managed to save some money. After that she was able to create clothes and acquire a larger clientele.

Because she lacks capital to buy inventory, she requests a loan for US $475, which she will pay in 6 months, so she can take advantage of the coming Spring-Summer season. With your support, Alicia will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Alicia Martínez es originaria de Saltillo Nuevo León, es casada y tiene una hija de 4 años, su esposo trabaja como empleado. Inicio su negocio hace 9 años, desde pequeña le ha gustado la costura, empezó haciendo pequeñas composturas y fue gracias a su empeño y buen trabajo que pudo junto dinero, entonces consiguió confeccionar mas prendas y así hacerse de una clientela más amplia.

Debido a la falta de liquidez para comprar inventario es que ella solicita un crédito de US $475 que pagara en 6 meses, buscando aprovechar la próxima temporada primavera- verano. Con tu apoyo Alicia podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: buying merchandise (comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is a married woman with two children, ages 2 and 15. Yusta owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2007. Everyday she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy supplies for her restaurant, such as a chair, table and thermos.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sa-Em

texts.en:
Mrs Sa-Em Rath, 38, and her husband, Mr Kimchit Chay, 44, have been married for 14 years. They have one son and one daughter, both in school. Beside the children, her mother also lives with the family. Her husband has been a mason since 2005. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Sa-Em has been a weaver since she was 18 years old. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business and some amount for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to repair her house.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q., 50 years old, earns most of her income from the pension. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are working and the other 2 are still going to school. To be able to fulfil her children’ needs for school supplies, she and her husband have to cut down on their living costs. In 1999, she talked to her husband and decided to join the TYM Fund and borrow money. At first, she used the borrowed money to breed animals. However, breeding animals did not bring her much profit while she had to spend money to buy food for them. After researching about the local’s need, she decided to borrow money to invest in making tofu. This activity brought her profit. They could also feed the pigs from the remaining tofu. Their family economy becomes stable through time. Currently, her husband and children are responsible for making the tofu at home and she does the selling process. Their average income is approximately 200 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more tofu-making machines.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Q. năm nay 50 tuổi. hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí vì thế đều có thu nhập từ lương hưu. Trong số 4 người con của chị, hai con đã trưởng thành có công ăn việc làm ổn đinh, còn hai con đang đi học. Do nhu cầu học hành của các con ngày càng tăng nên lương hưu của hai vợ chồng chị không đủ để chi tiêu trong gia đình. Vì thế , năm 1999 chị bàn với chồng tham gia Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để làm thêm nghề phụ. Vòng vốn đầu anh chị lựa chọn mua thêm giống để chăn nuôi nhưng công việc chăn nuôi không mang lại lợi nhuận cao do chi phí mua thức ăn tốn rất nhiều tiền. Sau khi nghiên cứu nhu cầu của người dân địa phương anh chị Q.ết định vay vốn tiếp để đầu tư vào mua máy móc sản xuất đậu phụ. Công việc làm đậu phụ đã đem lại nguồn thu đáng kể cho gía đình. Ngoài thu nhập từ việc bán đậu phụ anh chị còn tận dụng được nguồn thức ăn cho lợn từ việc sản xuất đậu phụ. Nhờ biết cách tính toán làm ăn công việc của anh chị ngày càng ổn định. Hiện nay chồng và các con chị phụ trách công việc sản xuất, chị trực tiếp bán cho người tiêu dùng tại chợ. Thu nhập của gia đình đạt 3000000đ/ tháng . Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để tiếp tục mua máy mới đầu tư cho sản xuất đậu để bán tại các chợ.

loans.use: buy machines to make tofu to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. is married and has seven children in her care. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her business which consists of buying and selling vegetables and fabrics dyed with indigo using a resist-dye technique found in Senegal called "thioup.” She wants to use this loan to improve the health and living conditions of her family. This loan will be repaid in a single installment at the end of six months.
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Fatou S. est mariée et a 07 enfants à charge. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter et à revendre des légumes et tissus teints à l’indigo « THIOUP ».Elle veut avec ce prêt améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Ce prêt sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois.

loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables and "thioup" fabrics

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phan Thị C. 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Cũng giống bao gia đình khác ở vùng nông thôn nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu trông vào mấy sào ruộng và chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ. Do thiếu vốn nên việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị không đem lại nhiều về hiệu quả kinh tế. Năm 2005 chị tham gia vào Quỹ Vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Từ khi tham gia vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn hơn, chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi cũng được gia đình chị tu sửa do vậy kết quả chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất tốt. Từ những kết quả chăn nuôi đem lại mấy năm gần đây kinh tế gia đình chị đã từng buớc thay đổi, chị đã mua sắm đựoc nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình phục vụ sinh họat hàng ngày. Là người chịu khó nên những lúc nhàn dỗi vợ chồng chị lại đi làm thuê thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày 100.000đ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs Phan Thị C. is 41 years old. She's a TYM fund member since 2005. Like many other families in the region, her family income comes from their exploited land and their pig raising business. Because they did not have enough capital to invest in the pig business, it did not yield enough income for her family. In 2005, she joined TYM to get a loan and she invested all in her pig business. She built new pig pen and expanded the operation. This has been a success. Things have changed for the better. Her family financial situation has improved a lot. She has been able to buy all the necesary goods for her household. She and her husband work hard, when they have free time they go to work for other farmers. This could bring in extra 100.000 VND a day. This time Ms C. is requesting a loan of 6.000.000 to invest in her pig business. Her family income is 5.000.000 VND a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, como toda madre preocupada por el bienestar y educación de sus hijos, trata de desenvolverse en diferentes actividades para generar ingresos económicos y así ofrecerle educación a su hijo Darwin de 18 años.Su deseo más grande a es ver a su hijo con una profesión y un futuro promisorio, por esa razón, decidió trabajar en una prestigiosa farmacia de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus conocimientos sobre medicamentos, su  disponibilidad y buena la atención que brinda, hacen incrementar la cantidad de clientes.Adicionalmente a esta labor, se dedica a la artesanía, generando de esa manera  ingresos extras para la tranquilidad  y estabilidad de su hogar.En esta oportunidad, requiere obtener un préstamo, para poder inscribir a su hijo en una  academia pre universitaria, con el fin de  que  reciba  una buena  preparación para que postule y logre ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda, just like any mother concerned with the education of her children, works in different areas in order to produce some revenue and offer a education to Darwin, her 18 year old son. Her dream is to see her child as a professional and with a promising future. Because of this reason, she decided to work in a prestigious pharmacy in the city of Juliaca. Her knowledge of medicaments and her demeanor help increase the amount of clients that visit her. In addition to this job, she also works as a handcraft, generating in this way the extra revenue for the tranquility and stability of her home. In this opportunity, she requests a loan to sign up her son in a preparatory academy so that he is prepared to go to college when he graduates.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inscribir a su hijo en una academia pre universitaria. / Incribe her son in a pre-college academy.

loans.name: Niño Lachocc Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Niño Lachocc esta ubicado en L. Comunidad D. Yananco en el distrito D. Huancavelica, departamento del mismo nombre. Rodeado D. árboles porque el cementerio al lado D. Seminario mayor, el Río Ichu, un bello paisaje. L. actividad principal D. L. comunidad es L. agricultura, L. ganadería y el comercio.

Maximiliana C., es casada, tiene 4 hijos, se inició vendiendo lana D. oveja a Huancatex, después vendió kerosene con un pequeño capital que logro ahorrar. L. mayor dificultad que tuvo fue superar L. separación D. su esposo. En su bancomunal aprendió a compartir y a tener familiaridad con las socias, adquirió experiencia al recibir las capacitaciones. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado desea incrementar sus productos D. Omnilife que venD. ahora paralelamente con L. venta D. kerosene.

Dina R., es casada, tiene 3 hijos, empezó vendiendo lencería en las ferias, como tiene hijos pequeños no pueD. vender todo los días, aprovecha las campañas escolares, naviD.ñas y otras. Sus prestamos les permiten invertir en su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos. El sueño D. Dina es darle lo mejor a sus hijos, tener una tienda y ser mayorista.

Francisca R., tiene 2 hijos, inició su negocio con L. venta D. ropa, viajaba a Lima a traer mercadería para vender en las ferias dominicales, vendía casaca y productos D. belleza. Con el préstamo voy a estar mejor porque podré invertir en mi negocio y tendrá mas ganancias.
texts.en:
The "Niño Lachocc" Community Bank is located in the Yananco region, in Huancavelica district and state. The bank is surrounded by the trees of the cemetery next to the seminary, the Ichu River and a beautiful landscape. The region's main economic activities are agriculture, ranching and traD.. Maximiliana C. is married and has four children. She started out selling sheep's wool to Huancatex. Later she sold kerosene using a little money she had saved. Her greatest challenge was getting over the separation with her husband. In her community bank she leanred how to share and be familiar with the partners. She acquired experience through training. Maximiliana would like to use the requested loan to increase the Omnilife products she now sells along with kerosene. Dina R. is married and has three children. She began selling lingerie at fairs. Seeing she has small children, Dina isn't able to make sales every day. She takes advantage of school, Christmas and other holidays. Her loans allow her to invest in her business and generate greater revenue. Dina's dream is to proviD. the best to her children, open a shop, and be a wholesaler. Francisca R. has two children. She started her business with clothes sales. She traveled to Lima to bring back merchandise to sell at the Sunday fairs. She sold jackets and beauty products. She will be better off with the loan because she will be able to invest in her business and will earn greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in 10 partners' businesses

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 25 años, convive con su pareja Roger de 30 años, quien también es comerciante de zapatos y sus tres hijos Yerson de 6, Mariela de 4 y Ángela de 2. Ella es una madre amorosa, se dedica desde hace 6 años a su pequeña empresa de producción y venta de calzado, para poder mantener a su familia a la cual espera poder brindarle lo mejor. Gracias a Dios el negocio va progresando y le resulta cada vez más rentable, ya que los clientes ya van prefriendo sus bonitos zapatos. A Ana no se le hace complicado su trabajo, ya que trabaja a favor de sus hijos, los cuales son su razón de vivir y cada vez que tiene que hacer sacrificios, piensa en ellos para seguir adelante. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero comprará materiales para la elaboración de calzado, como son suelas, cuero, pasadores, hebillas, etc. para poder realizar acabados más finos y aumentar el precio y cantidad de sus zapatos.
texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old and lives with her partner 30 year old Roger, who is also sells shoes. They have three children, Yerson age 6, Mariela age 4, and Angela age 2. She is a loving mother. She has had her small business making and selling shoes for 6 years, which enables her to support her family with the hope of providing the best for her family. Thanks to God her business is growing and ever more profitable, as her customers prefer her beautiful shoes. Ana does not find her work complicated, she works for her children’s benefit, who are her reason for living and every time she has to make sacrifices she thinks of them and forges on. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With the money she will buy materials to make shoes, such as insoles, leather, shoelaces, buckles, etc. to make her finished products even better and increase the price and quantity of her shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng T. is a 55-year-old widow, and she now lives in Moat Boeng village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On the plantation she gathers little rice revenue to support her family. In order to improve her living, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions after she sells the cow. Mrs. Yeng T. has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase automobiles for transport

loans.name: Alto Mesa Verde Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Alto Mesa VerD." esta representado por la señora Agustina  y conformada por 17 miembros los cuales aun gran mayoría se conocen ya que residen en la misma localidad. en general los socios (as) se dedican al rubro comercial D. productos como, ropa, comida, zapatos, verduras fresca, bebidas, cosméticos y a actividades como el servicio público. Los socios Saben que dentro del marco comercial la competencia D. ofertas y demandas D. los clientes es granD. pero saben como salir adelante gracias a su gran experiencia en el M. libre. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para haces a sus productos mas competitivos. los socios no tienen experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que es su primer ciclo con la fundación Agrocapital, pero ellos (as) asegura que son gente honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora por lo que no defraudaran a la institución.
texts.en:
The group "Alto Mesa VerD." is represented by Señora Augustine and is composed of 17 members, the majority of which know each other as they resiD. in the same location. In general, the partners engage in a commercial line of products such as clothing, food, shoes, fresh vegetables, beverages, cosmetics, and activities for public service. The partners know that within the commercial market, the competition of supply and demand of customers is great, but they know how to move forward thanks to their great experience with the open market. With the credit, they intend to purchase materials and supplies to make their products more competitive. The partners have no experience with joint credit and it is their first season with the Agrocapital foundation, but they assure that they are honest, responsible and hard-working and therefore not defrauding the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Mrs. Tita A. hails from Pandan, Antique. She is blessed with one child. Her husband is always in the vegetable plantation helping with chores out there, showing that he supports her in her business. Mrs. A. is engaged in plantation growing and vegetable vending. She is very fortunate that her husband had knowledge in agriculture, and that’s why she had confidence to establish this kind of business.

Mrs. Tita A. sells to people in her neighborhood and in the market. Her plantation is planted with different vegetables. She rents the land for 1,500 pesos a month. She also sells fish every morning for additional income.

Mrs. Tita A. will use the 5,000 peso loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and gardening tools. She dreams that someday she will be able to buy the land so that her profits will go into her savings. She believes that this will provide a better way for her business to progress. She also dreams that her child will finish her study and have a good future.

Through ASHI she has achieved self-confidence and her social life has become much more relaxed.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Elzara

texts.en:
Elzara is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her potato farm to later sell its agricultural products in the markets of the closest towns or to traders from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area. However, she wants to increase her investment in agriculture and expand her farmland to improve the living standards of her beloved family. Let’s help this mother to keep working for the well-being of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa T. L., 26, is married with one child. She has two years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the village people  and public six days per week. She has had one previous loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145). SPBD loans are Lisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of flour, sugar and other items for her business

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: Hermenegildo tiene 55 años, es casado, tuvo 12 hijos, fallecieron 5, ahora vive con uno de ellos. Desde su infancia se dedicó a la agricultura de forma artesanal, a través de esta actividad pudo educar a todos sus hijos y brindar el bienestar a su familia. Pero lo que nunca pudo controlar son las plagas ocasionadas por mucha lluvia; en consecuencia, nos comenta su melancolía al ver afectada su chacra de su papa, ahora su producción no será como él se había propuesto; por ello, hoy los sentimientos de tristeza nublan el brillo de sus ojos. Hermenegildo cortará las hojas de la papa con la ayuda de su esposa para evitar perder en su totalidad el cultivo, y una vez que logre cosechar la ofrecerá como semilla, y espera cotizarla a un precio considerable para cubrir la educación de su último hijo, quien lo apoya en sus labores agrícolas. Hermenegildo tiene la cualidad de ser muy responsable, no sólo en los pagos a MFP, sino también en cada uno de los acuerdos en su banco comunal, este es su 7mo crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papa y alverjas.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is 55, is married, and had 12 children, although 5 of them have passed away. He now lives with one of them. Since his childhood he has worked in agriculture. Through this work, he was able to educate all of his children and offer well-being to his family. But what he never could control were the occasional plagues caused by a lot of rain. As a consequence, he told us he is sad because his potato crop has been affected. Now his production won't be as good as he thought, so his sadness has made his normally bright eyes cloudy. Hermenegildo will cut the leaves of his potatoes with the help of his wife to avoid losing his entire crop. Once he harvests them, he will sell them as seeds. He hopes to be quoted a good price so he can cover the educational expenses of his youngest son, who helps him with his agricultural work. Hermenegildo is very responsible, not only with his payments to Microfinanzas Prisma, but also with each one of his agreements with his communal bank. This is his seventh loan. The money that he is requesting will go towards chemical fertilizers for his next planting of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Jesus Demarche Group

texts.en:
The “Jesus Demarche” or “Jesus is working” Group is made up of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their 1st and 2nd loans, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 3rd loan. Their businesses range from charcoal sales to cleaning materials for the home.  Ylda M. is one of three representatives of the group. 
Ylda sells a variety of items ranging from sugar to cleaning powders to cold drinks and candies. She is thankful for her loans because she was able to purchase several animals and further furnish her home with the increased profits from her business.  Ylda contributes the increased number of children attending school to the loans and the growth of businesses in the area. Ylda dreams of expanding her business and continually moving forward. On behalf of Ylda, Jesus Demarche, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cleaning powders, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 52 years old and raises both swine and chicken. She is married to a house carpenter, Felimon M.. Her family lives in Barangay Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela, a rural village. They have five children who were unfortunately unable to continue their studies through college because of poverty. Some of them are already married. Nida is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for the maintenance and expansion of her livestock business. Nida was happy that in spite of having a big family, she was able to send her children to school, even if it was just through high school. She was also glad that her children are very understanding and they really have good relationships with each other even though most of them are already married. According to her, patience and diligence is the key to have a successful business and family relationships.

loans.use: Business Maintenance and Expansion

loans.name: Rodrigo Cristino

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en las afueras del Mercado central, el señor Rodrigo P. se dedica a su actividad de servicio de transporte teniendo su propio triciclo con el cual traslada a las personas de un lado a otro dependiendo el lugar que se visite.

Rodrigo tiene la necesidad de invertir en el triciclo para mejorar sus condiciones y por esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y así mejorar el medio de transporte y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the outskirts of the central market, Rodrigo P. makes a living transporting customers with his pedicab, taking them from one side to the other depending the location. Rodrigo faces the necessity of investing in his pedicab to improve its conditions, and for this he has turned to Kiva partner CEPRODEL to request a loan so he can improve his means of transportation and provide a better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his mototaxi

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La señora Ángela López C., tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene cinco hijos , ya todos casado e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , doña Ángela desde hace 19 años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su hermana , los planes hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo.
texts.en:
Ángela López C., 58, lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood, which is located in the Concepción municipality. She lives with her husband, and she runs the household. They have five married and independent children. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. Ángela has been farming for 19 years. The biggest difficulty is the pests that affect the crops. She started farming with help from her sister. The plan for the farm is to be able to diversify. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Pedro Reynaldo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, el señor Pedro T. se dedica a laborar arduamente porque requiere invertir en su vivienda por medio de la construcción del techo y la construcción de un pozo. El señor Pedro lleva a cabo esta labor con el objetivo de beneficiar a su familia brindándole mejores condiciones.

Es por este motivo que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así iniciar su labor en su localidad en el municipio de Telica.
texts.en:
In the Telica municipality of the city of León, Sr. Pedro T. works hard because he needs to pay for two home projects: finishing construction of a roof and digging a well. He needs this work performed in order to provide his family better living conditions.

He has come to CEPRODEL for a loan to pay for construction materials so that work can begin on his home in Telica.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena G. is from the village of Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Lorena is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena owns and operates a food market. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seafood to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lorena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell

location.town: Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer fuerte y valiente, tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Ya son 20 años de ardua labor agrícola, la cual realiza junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ellos cultivan principalmente la papa y también crían ganado ovino y otros animales menores como los cuyes, los cuales mantiene en su casa. Todas las mañanas sale a pastear a sus animales durante largas caminatas que duran horas, debido a la distancia de los pastizales adecuados para que sus animales estén bien alimentados. Pasados 6 meses aproximadamente las tareas se intensifican, ya que la cosecha o la siembra requieren de mayor esfuerzo físico. Pero mientras tanto, Julia sale a vender los cuyes que tiene en su granja y de esa manera responder a las necesidades urgentes que se presentan en el hogar. Durante todos estos años sus cosechas le han proporcionado ganancias variables, pese a eso, el sustento familiar se mantiene y por esta razón Julia planifica para el futuro en seguir luchando por tener mejores cosechas. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su perseverancia en formar parte de su banco comunal le ha permitido ser reconocida como una de las integrantes más solidarias y se compromete a seguir  con esta buena actitud. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de ovejas y abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Julia is a strong and brave woman. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. For 20 years, she has engaged in arduous farm labor along with her family. They primarily grow potatoes, but also raise sheep and other small animals such as guinea pigs. Every morning they allow their animals to graze during their long walks that can last for hours because of the expanse of their pastures. Once six months have passed after the planting of their potato crops, the activities involved with the harvest begin to intensify because a lot more physical work is required. In the meantime, Julia sells guinea pigs in response to urgent needs that arise at home.

In previous years, their crops have provided variable gains. Despite these difficulties, Julia has been able to support her family and continues to fight so that she can have better harvests.

Julia is requesting her fourth loan from MFP. Her perseverance and participation in her Communal Bank have enabled her to become recognized as one of the most supportive members of her group. She pledges to continue with a good attitude. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase heads of sheep and fertilizer for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer & heads of sheep

loans.name: Borann

texts.en:
Mrs. Borann P., 48, is widow, lives in a small village a long National Road Number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been operating grocery store since 1986. 
Borann used to apply for a loan from Kiva through MAXIMA. She is now asking for another loan in the amount of $300 purchase grocery items for continuing her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for continuing her selling grocery business.

loans.name: Fazirah's Group

texts.en: M. Fazirah is 27 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 9. She also takes care of two orphans, children of desceased siblings, including paying their school fees and other requirements. She makes a living by printing and binding books, but because of limited capital she has not been able to turn her business into a full secretarial service. She wants to acquire a new photocopier, and paper supplies to expand both her business and her income. Fazirah is hardworking and determined, and believes she will make it.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier and paper supplies for her business.

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Yorng S. is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in Battambong Province. She has been involved in a business of selling vegetable at a local market in the town, earning approximately an income of US $2.5 per day. Her husband purchases recycle material from place to place for resale, earning an income of US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by one of S.’s children who is currently employed as a construction worker, earning collectively an income of US $2.5 per day. She is asking for a loan of US $600 to have her husband repaired and invest on the recycling business. By doing so, S. hopes that her husband will be able to generate more income and save the money for the good future her children’s education.

loans.use: repair motorbike

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika M. currently sells beer and local alcohol at a bar. She is requesting a loan; she will use the money to purchase brewing materials.  Monika is 55 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children, none of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house that she will sublet. 

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchasing brewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase genge items and medicine for her Pharmacy in bulk

loans.name: Adulfa

texts.en:
Adulfa C. is from the village of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Adulfa is married and has six school-aged children.

To make a living, Adulfa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as sweet candies, biscuits, and mango, in the local community. Adulfa has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Adulfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adulfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Adulfa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Adulfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem R. is 51 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers and raise animals to earn a living. They are able to make a combined amount of about $5 profit every day. Chhem R. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to expand her cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 55 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives in a small community which is a suburb of Offinsu in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Currently all of his children are in school. 

He runs a chemical store and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs, etc. in his neighborhood.  Many local people patronize his drugs as first aid and for cures when they are sick. He has been in business for five years now. He is among the few people who run a licensed chemical shop in the community. His chemical shop is registered to operate by the Ghana pharmaceutical council. 

He wants to use the loan to buy an increased supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently requested by his customers. He hopes to make a good income to take care of his family. This would enable him save more money to support his children in school.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Mbah

texts.en:
H. was born on  May 25, 1964. She is a widow who is blessed with four kids, none below 15 years of age  Being a hard working lady, she has faced so many challenges in life including being a widow at a young age, ill health and being unable to take care of her children. Due to all of these challenges, she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in 2008. In this same year, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000FRS and the repayment was done promptly. With a loan of 150,0000FRS, she plans to buy palm oil, water fufu and eru (a popular Cameroonian dish) and cultivate a small yam farm. The loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed. She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a long period of time. She has a good location for that particular business. And she has a lot of customers.
Her neighbors are happy her business is right beside them, because they don't have to go to the market and they can buy from her late at night. She plans to use the profit to plough back into the business, cater for her son, and give good medical attention to herself and her son. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of the social services GHAPE offers and the comfortable repayment method. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy and sell palm oil, water fufu, and eru

loans.name: Yay

texts.en: Yay S. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been buying rice from the growers and reselling it to the market wholesale to earn a profit of about $3 of profit each day. Her husband is a truck driver who is able to make $3 per day as well. This couple has three school-aged children. Yay S. is asking for a loan of $1000 to increase her stock of rice.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson N. is a 26 year old owner of a motorcycle transport business in Thika, Kenya. He has received a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase a new motorcycle. Benson desires to be a leader in the local passenger ferrying industry. He is married with a 6 month old child. His challenges are cut-throat competition from other motorcycle taxi operators in the area. He describes himself as innovative and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Dinalyn

texts.en: Dinalyn is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur.  She has two children with her husband, Ruel.  Her oldest child is only three years of age.  Dinalyn is a rice farmer and tills one hectare.  This is how she gets her income.  Dinalyn wants to expand her business to improve her earnings because she wants her children to have a proper education.  She joined CEVI to get a loan. She is requesting Php4, 000, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Noli Jangad Group

texts.en:
Noli J. is from the village of New Look, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old. Noli is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Noli is single. To make a living, Noli owns & operates a business venture making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Noli has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Noli joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Noli is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Noli from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is one of the oldest loyal borrower's of FATEN. She and her husband started taking loans 10 years ago to start their own workshop where they make wooden crosses and statues. Her husband shapes them and she paints, sticks pieces together and manages selling and dealing with customers.

Her husband started this business with his nephew. By the time he could save enough money to rent his own workshop and start making his own production, the workshop grew. Now Wafa is taking a loan from FATEN to buy olive tree wood since their work prospers in summer, which is the tourism season in the Bethlehem area.

Wafa stands in the workshop showing some of their products.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like olive wood

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, Comarca la Pita, el crédito será destinado para compra de 1 vaquilla, de esta manera seguir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, Comarca la Pita, el crédito será destinado para compra de 1 vaquilla, de esta manera seguir adelante con su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una vaquilla

loans.name: Seydina Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Seydina Ousmane N. né en 1986 est un jeune célibataire très dynamique. C'est un menuisier de métier mais s'active également dans l'aviculture depuis 4 ans pour diversifier ses activités et faire face aux difficultés du métier de menuisier dues à la rarification des marchés. Cependant, il compte acheter avec ce prêt des poussins, aliments et matériels de volaille pour augmenter sa production et de gagner plus de marchés.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydina Ousmane N. was born in 1986 and is a very dynamic young single man. He is a carpenter by profession but in order to diversify his activities and cope with the difficulties of the carpentry trade resulting from a scarcity of customers, he has also been active in poultry farming for four years. With this loan he is planning on buying chicks, food and equipment for poultry farming, so he can increase his production and get more customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, food for poultry and equipment for poultry farming

loans.name: Ndayambaje

texts.en:
H. is a carpenter and is married with two children. He owns two machines which allow him to make timber for sale. He has been in this business for about fifteen years and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

With these fifteen years of experience in his business, the number of H.’s customers has increased to the extent that he can not now satisfy his customers. To end this, he would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase an additional machine which will be useful in making many timbers for sale.

With this machine, H. will satisfy the demand of his customers and he will, hopefully, earn more profits. These profits will allow him to continue taking care of his family. In addition, he will keep reinvesting in his business through creating many sources of income and creating more jobs for the people in his community.

loans.use: To buy an additional machine for making timber

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 42 years old and is married with two children who are 13 and 17 years old. She makes a living by selling a large quantity of bananas and she has been in this business for about twenty years. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Marie Chantal, after realizing that the demand of her customers is greater than her selling capacity, is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. She will purchase a large quantity of bananas so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

With the demand satisfied, Marie Chantal hopes that she will earn more profits than previously and these profits will be used for a further reinvestment in her business and for building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas to sell

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem P. lives in Kouk Kruos village in Takeo province and she is 47 years old. She is a congee seller in her local village and besides this, she is a farmer who owns a more than two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Cham Roeun Brang, is a mechanic. 

This couple work a lot but they can earn only a little income. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sem P. is asking for a loan to buy an ox to plow her field. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a car driver who gets a low salary to support his family, while the other is attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow her field

loans.name: Altanhuyag

texts.en:
Altanhuyag G. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His daughter attends a local elementary school and his son is in kindergarten, while his wife helps with his business. 

Altanhuyag operates a cellphone sales and repair service in his town. He started his business in 2008. He has made much progress with his business over the last year and has built a strong customer base. Altanhuyag has gained much experience operating his business and continues to improve his phone repair skills. The success of his business has raised his working capital from 1,000,000 MNT when he started to a level exceeding 2,300,000 MNT today. 

Altanhuyag hopes to expand his business in the future and dreams of one day owning his own repair shop. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cellphones and cellphone parts in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 58 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests corn to sell. She prays for good health so she can continue working hard for her family. It's her goal to give them better living conditions.

Daniela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be her 2nd loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Laura Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Laura Azucena V. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive en la comunidad de San Antonio que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es conocida por su exuberante vegetación, es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población joven a migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Doña Laura Azucena tiene 33 años es casada  y tiene 5 hijo de 17, 15, 14, 11 y 9 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad, su esposo trabaja como albañil, tiene casa propia que le fue heredada por sus padres, pero su hermano hipoteco la casa para poder salir del país hacia los Estados Unidos, lamentablemente el no cancelo la deuda por lo que su casa ahora se encuentra en remate.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de chanchos y cuyes los cuales los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene  alguna necesidad, también  lava ropa  y arregla  casas pero este no es un trabajo fijo.

Es socia del banquito hace 6 años, los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio y en el estudio de sus hijos, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos. Su meta es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación para que se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Laura Azucena V. is a member of the community bank named Cumbe. She lives in the community of San Antonio, a community that is part of the Cumbe region. This region is well known for its exuberant vegetation. The climate is relatively cold and the population is mostly made up of cattle farmers and agriculturists. Many of the young members of the population have emigrated in search of better work opportunities. Laura Azucena is 33 years old, she is married and she has 5 children, aged 17, 15, 14, 11 and 9. The four eldest children are in school and her youngest daughter goes to primary school in the community. Her husband is a construction worker. They have their own home because it was inherited from her parents. But her brother mortgaged the house to move to the United States. Unfortunately he never paid back the loan so their house is currently in foreclosure. Laura Azucena's occupation is raising pigs and guinea pigs. She sells them in the community and whenever she has a special requirement she washes clothes and cleans houses, but this is not a regular job. She has been a member of the community bank for the past 6 years and she has received a great deal of support in the development of her business, and in turn she has been able to send her kids to school. This loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is to give her kids a better education so that they may succeed in life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Bunthea

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthea M. (in the photo), 27, is a driver. His wife, Mrs. Sokheng Phon, 27, is a garment-factory worker. They have been married since 2007 and just have a young son. Nowadays, the couple lives with their parents in a village along National Road Number Four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

They want to live in a separate home, but they do not have money to build a house. Therefore, Bunthea is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to make the buildings.

loans.use: To build a house to live in

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Gloria; 39 años D. edad y es soltera, ella se dedica desD.  hace dos años a la elaboración D. viandas, la socia venD. comida D. forma ambulatoria, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes, ella desea comprar unas ollas y aceite y productos al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Gloria, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Gloria is 39 years old, she is single and since two years she has been working as a street vendor selling the meals she prepares. The loan she is requesting will be used for the wholesale purchase of tools and ingredients such as pans and oil. She is thankful for the loan that will be granted to her, and at the same time she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and oil.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is a married woman who lives in Purok Paho, Barangay Pacol, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through vegetable vending, growing and selling rice, and dressmaking businesses. Her husband, Manuel A. Sr., who is 45 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 18 and 19 years old. 

Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seventeen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $230, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for the farm so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Jocelyn A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Danilo E. tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Sandy Emerita Martinez quien se dedica al cuidado de la casa y Jose Danilo se dedica a la compra venta de camarones, pescado blanco, pescado rojo, y babosa esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años.
 
su puntos de venta son Pespire, San Lorenzo, y Moropocay.
traslada en su carro su producto y tiene la ayuda de su papa quien tambien se dedica al mismo negocio. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado y camarones tambien necesita una parte para darle mantenimiento al carro en que transporta su prodcuto.
 
Jose vive en la casa de un hermano que radica en los estados unidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Danilo E. is 29 years old and married to Sandy Martinez Emerita who cares for the house and Jose Danilo.  Mr. E. buys and sells shrimp, white fish, red fish, and slugs for a living.  He has made his living this way for two years. 
 
He sells in Pespire, San Lorenzo, and Moropocay and transports his products by car.  His father, who works in the same business, helps him. He plans to use the loan to buy fish and shrimp. He also needs a part to fix the car they use to transport their product. 
 
Jose lives in his brother's house (who lives in the United States).

loans.use: To buy shrimp, fish, and spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es: Karen es una joven emprendedora que tiene un hijo de 5 años y es muy reconocida en Sourdis, barrio al suroccidente de Barranquilla por su gran dinamismo y ganas de hacer  crecer  su negocio de vender mercancía variada, como ropa y calzado, que inició con un préstamo otorgado por un familiar y que ella sorprendió  y por eso buscó financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque su pequeño capital no alcanza para responder a la demanda del mercado. El credikiva es su segundo financiamiento con esta organización y con él comprará calzado, vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños  para cubrir la demanda de la temporada de Diciembre que se avecina y las familias aumentan sus gastos para verse más elegantes. Con su anterior financiamiento logró acceder a más clientes y aumentar un poco sus utilidades, de aquí su entusiasmo por hacerlo crecer, porque sueña con tener un sitio de exhibición y venta de sus productos, y con diversificar su oferta y potencializar oportunidades de nuevos mercados. Su mayor desafío es controlar la recuperación de su cartera y para ello ha tomado medidas, relacionadas con la observación previa de sus clientes nuevos, antes de entregarle la mercancía a crédito y con solo otorgar la cantidad de crédito que la gente pueda pagar.
texts.en:
Karen is an entrepreneurial woman who has one 5-year old child.  She is very well known in Sourdis, a neighborhood to the southwest of Barranquilla, for her great energy and desire to grow her business.  She sells a variety of merchandise such as clothing and shoes, a business she started with a loan from a relative.  She sought financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation because her small amount of capital wasn’t enough to meet market demand.

Her Kiva credit is the second loan with this organization.  She will use the funds to buy shoes, and women, men and children’s clothing.  She would like to be able to meet the demand over the upcoming December holiday season, a time when people increase their spending in order to dress up.  With her previous loan, she managed to capture more customers and increase her scope a little.  She has great enthusiasm to continue growing, and dreams of having a storefront for her products, diversifying her offerings, and tap into opportunities in new markets.

Her greatest challenge is replenishing her expenditures and, for this reason, she has taken certain defensive measures.  She carefully observes new customers’ habits before allowing any purchases on credit, or she limits these purchases to an amount the person can realistically repay.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and women's, men's and children's clothing to meet demand over the upcoming December holiday season.

loans.name: Latifaan's Group

texts.en:
Latifaan, pictured with her hand raised, is a 51-year-old housewife. She lives with her family in a 3-room brick house in the city of Faisalabad, which is well-known for its textile industry. Her house is located in the area known as Bhaiwala, where she has been living for over 20 years. She and her husband have five children: 2 sons and 3 daughters. Her daughters are currently receiving their education, while her sons left school to start their own butcher shops in the market. Now that their businesses are growing and doing well, they should be able to provide financial support for the family.

Latifaan's husband’s name is S. H., and he is a butcher by profession. More specifically, he sells chicken meat to his clients. He has been engaged in this business for over 10 years, and customers prefer to purchase meat from his shop due to its freshness and good weight. Latifaan is applying for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He plans on using the loan proceeds to purchase chicken meat in a larger quantity so that he can satisfy the increase in customers' orders and thereby increase his sales. She is an established client of Asasah, and this would be her third loan from Asasah. With respect to those prior loans, she repaid the loans on time and never missed group meetings.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by purchasing chickens in bulk

loans.name: Nurzada's Group

texts.en:
Nurzada A. is a resident of Tokmok. She is the leader of this group loan. Nurzada is 31 years old. She is an economist and earns money by working as a consultant. 

Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 KGS, Nurzada started to breed cattle. Her brother helps her with that activity. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle and then improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita M. is from the village of Esperanza West. She is forty years old. Merlita is married with two school-aged children. Merlita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP for the same purpose. This loan will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mirna Cristabel

texts.es:
Mirna, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 22 años y vive con sus dos hijos Luis Enrique de 6 años y Yesica de 4 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de ropa como su fuente principal de ingreso para llevar a su hogar el alimento para sus hijos. El negocio tiene un año de administrarlo y su madre fue su principal apoyo para iniciarlo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa ya que en esta temporada ella prevé un aumento en sus ventas por lo que quiere prepararse surtiendo el negocio con prendas de vestir de moda, este préstamo la ayudara a disponer de mercadería y ofrecer a los clientes.
Con el apoyo del préstamo ella espera crecer su micro negocio y así fortalecer sus ingresos para darles a sus hijos la alimentación, salud y educación necesaria.
texts.en:
Mirna lives in the Corinto department of Morazán.  She is 22 years old, and she lives with her two children.  Luis Enrique is six years old, and Yesica is four years old.  She is a single mother.

She sells clothes as her primary source of income for feeding her children.  She has been running her business for one year.  Her mother was her primary support for starting the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes.  She foresees an increase in sales this season, and she wants to be prepared by stocking her business with fashionable clothes.  This loan will help her to have merchandise to sell to the customers.

With the support from the loan she hopes to grow her small business.  That way she will strengthen her income in order to give her children food, health, and the necessary education.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Tsogtbayar is 24 years old, single, and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He lives with his mom and niece in a ger, which is a traditional nomadic tent. His mother is retired. Tsogtbayar is a professional producer and used to work for national broadcasting television as a producer for six years. He is currently employed with “Bolovsrol” television, as a producer as well. Tsogtbayar is an artistic and very hardworking person, and this is the only income for his family. He is planning to make movies and do advertising. Therefore, he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new professional video camera.

loans.use: To purchase a new professional video camera

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
El señor José Juan M. tiene ya mas once años dedicándose a la reparación de autos, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Don José Juan ya ha tenido tres créditos con kiva los cuales ha utilizado para invertir en su taller, esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo ya que necesita comprar herramientas mas modernas y partes eléctricas para autos, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en la negocio. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este préstamo y así tener lo necesario en su negocio, para darle a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Mr. José Juan M. has been repairing automobiles for over eleven years.  This business is the only source of income for his family.  José Juan has already had three loans through Kiva which he has invested in his workshop.  He plans to use this new loan to buy more advanced tools and electric auto repair parts, since he does not have the money to do this himself right now. 

He kindly requests your help so he can obtain what he needs for his business and provide his customers with the best service possible.

loans.use: To buy tools and auto repair parts

loans.name: Haider

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has six children. In 2008, H. opened his own food market because the competition in his area is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.

H. is requesting a $1500 loan to buy two refrigerators and increase his inventory. He is planning to develop his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two refrigerators and increase his inventory

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra T. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es admirada por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su belleza natural, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente amable y cordial hacen de Cuenca una ciudad hermosa.

Doña Mayra tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos  de 14, 13 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller propio en donde  realiza de estucos (cielos rasos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

La Señora. Mayra realiza los quehaceres domésticos de varias casas, actividad que realiza hace mucho tiempo, labora de lunes a viernes en distintos horarios. Los fines de semana tiene un pequeño negocio de comida rápida.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando: víveres, gaseosas, aguas, papas, etc. Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace dos años y medio, tiempo en el que los prestamos le ha permitido crecer poco a poco en su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun). She lives in the sector of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca. This city is admired for its architectural beauty, which contributed toward its recognition as a World Heritage Site. The natural beauty, different cuisines, and the kind friendly people are all characteristics that make Cuenca a lovely city.

Doña Mayra is 32 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 13, and 9). Her first two children are in high school while the youngest child attends a school in the city. Her husband works in his own shop where he makes stucco (used for installing raised ceilings). They do not own a home, so they live at the house of a relative.

Doña Mayra provides housekeeping services to different families. She has held this job for a long time and works Monday through Friday on a specified schedule. On the weekends, she manages a small business selling fast food.

The money from her loan will be invested in her business. She will buy groceries, sodas, water, potatoes, and other items. Mayra joined the Communal Bank two and a half years ago. Throughout that time, the loans have enabled her to grow her business gradually. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase groceries, sodas, water, potatoes, and other items for her fast food business

loans.name: Mayela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Máyela de 35 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus cinco hijos, es madre soltera y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su madre, ya que tiene experiencia en el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para engorde, esta compra le permitirá crecer y ampliar la granja de cerdos los cuales al crecer y engordar serán comercializados a buen precio.
Las aspiraciones de Máyela son ampliar el negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayela is 35 years old, and lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  She is a single mother who lives with her 5 children, and has a business raising pigs.  She started this business with the help of her mother, who already had experience in this line of work.

Mayela requests a loan to buy pigs to fatten.  This purchase would allow her to grow her business and expand her pig farm, where she raises and fattens pigs that she later sells at a good price.

Mayela hopes to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
Jun F. is from the village of Arwas Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Jun is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jun raises pigs for fattening and sale. Jun has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jun joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jun is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jun from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Enhbaigalmaa

texts.en: Enhbaigalmaa is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, age 46, works as a guard for a private company. Her oldest son and daughter go to college while the youngest helps with the family business. Enhbaigalmaa operates a clothing sewing business in her town. She started her business in a rented booth in 2007, with working capital of 80,000 MNT. Now her working capital exceeds 400,000 MNT. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking and open-minded person who says, " I want to own my working place in the future." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is currently in the business of selling sugar. She is 42 years old, married, with six children, all of whom go to school. Asha has requested a loan to buy more sugar for her stock. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits.

loans.use: to buy more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de galettes et font de la restauration.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des céréales pour la préparation des galettes et du riz pour la restauration.                                                                        
YOROBO D. compte acheter  quelques colis de condiments alimentaires avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
